loans.name: Dios Te Ama Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Dios Te Ama” esta representado por la señora Sandra  y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando primer ciclo muy entusiasmados por trabajar juntos para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos como ropa americana, pan, salchichas, empanadas, refrescos y otros de los socios trabajan en transporte público, soldadura y como empleados de empresas publicas. Dentro del ámbito comercial todas las socias saben salir adelante para llevar el pan de cada día  a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para hacer crecer sus negocios con la compra de mercadería, insumos y la compra de repuestos y herramientas para sus servicios. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría de los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos de crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Dios Te Ama Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Sandra, is comprised of 15 group members who are currently in their first loan cycle. They are very enthusiastic about working together to help move their small businesses forward. Some members sell things like American clothing, bread, sausages, empanadas, and beverages. Other members work in public transportation, welding, or as employees in public companies. The group members know how to get ahead in business so that they can give their families their daily bread. This loan will be used to make their businesses grow by purchasing merchandise, supplies, spare parts, and the tools they need to provide service. Regarding their experience with solidarity groups, most of the group members have already dealt with similar microfinance institutes, but none of those institutes have given them the support and trust that this foundation has, allowing them to make progress with their plans to grow and provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reymundo tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Nuevo Paraíso, del distrito de Rázuri, en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas y 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Nos cuenta que empezó a criar animales desde pequeño y que durante este tiempo ha sabido atesorar el conocimiento y experiencia necesaR. para el manejo de granjas. 

Usualmente cría patos y los vende a los comerciantes de carnes de la zona. Hace poco tuvo que vender todos sus patos y empezó a criar pollos con la finalidad de mantener su negocio. El mismo les prepara los alimentos y cuida de ellos. Con los ingresos de este negocio cubre sus gastos personales y sostiene a sus padres que, debido a su avanzada edad, no pueden trabajar.

El se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la alimentación y sanidad de sus pollos. Reymundo es muy responsable y trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es retomar su cría de patos porque considera que son más fáciles de criar y que no requieren de mucho cuidado.
texts.en:
Reymundo is 40 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the village of Nuevo Paraíso in the District of Rázuri, Ascope Province in La Libertad region, which is 3 hours and 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Reymundo raises and sells poultry. He said he began raising animals as a child and has been able to absorb knowledge over time and gain the experience necessary to manage a farm. He usually raises ducks to sell to local butchers. He recently had to sell all the ducks and has now started raising chickens in order to maintain his business. As with the ducks, he feeds and cares for them in the same manner. With the revenue he generates, Reymundo is able to cover his personal expenses and support his elderly parents who are unable to work.

This is Reymundo’s first loan from Edypme Alternativa. He is requesting 1000 soles to purchase feed and medicines for his chickens. Reymundo is a responsible and hardworking individual. His greatest wish is to return to raising ducks because they are easier to care for and require little attention.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed & medicines for his chickens

location.town: Nuevo Paraiso - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old with two school-age children, a son and a daughter. She sells used women's clothing in a busy location in Nairobi. She's been in business for three years and previously worked at a photocopy shop. She is requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her inventory.

Nancy says that Faulu has given her economic empowerment and, in the future, she would like to be the managing director of her own company.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Corazón de María" esta representado por la señora Norah y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales cuentan con un ingreso diario generado por sus propios negocios pequeños como la venta de frutas, yogurt, empanadas, F., comida y prestando servicios como peluquería y albañilería. En lo que representa a la competencia las socias son gente que produce y vende productos de calidad hechas por ellas mismas por lo que tienen clientes  fieles que les ayudan a generar un ingreso necesario para el sustento de sus familias, es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para hacer crecer sus negocios con la adquisición de insumos materiales y nuevas herramientas que ayuden a generar una mayor cantidad de productos y una mejor prestación de servicios que genere mayores ingresos y le permita brindar a sus familias una mejor calida d de vida. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría de los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos de crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Corazon de Maria Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Norah, is comprised of 13 members who earn daily wages generated by their small businesses selling fruit, yogurt, empanadas, flowers, and food, or providing hairstyling or bricklaying services. In terms of competition, the group members are people who produce and sell high-quality products that they make themselves, which is why they have faithful customers who help them generate the profits necessary for their family expenses. For this reason, they need this loan in order to make their businesses grow by obtaining supplies, materials and the new tools that they need to make a greater quantity of products and offer better services. Thus, they can generate more income, which will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. Regarding experience with solidarity groups, a large majority of the members have previously worked with similar microfinance institutes, but none has ever given them the support and trust that the Fundación has given them so that they can make progress with their plans of growth, in so doing, giving their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Propiangas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Propiangas”  están representadas por la señora Mirian y conformadas por 12 socias de las cuales 9 son mujeres y 3 hombres; Entre las mujeres se dedican a la venta de productos como comida, hamburguesas, abarrotes, empanada, pan y cosméticos por cataloga; mientras que los varones se dedican a la soldadura y el resto son empleados de fabricas en la periferia de la ciudad. La competencia en la venta de productos es alta pero saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y con entusiasmo de tener su propio negocio. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito será invertido en la compra de más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron atentes en instituciones financieras similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la que están muy agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The Las Propiangas Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Mirian, is comprised of 12 group members—9 women and 3 men. The women sell food, hamburgers, provisions, empanadas, bread, or cosmetics by catalog, while the men are in welding or work in the factories around the city. Competition is high, but the group members know how to get ahead with great efforts and the enthusiasm of owning a business. The loan will be used to generate more profits so that the members can give their families a better quality of life and provide a more promising future for their children: their reason to get ahead in life. Regarding experience in microfinance, the group members have previously worked with institutes similar to Fundación Agrocapital, to which they are grateful for the trust and financial support they have given them.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diannarose

texts.en:
Diannarose is a 34-year-old single mother with two daughters, who are both attending school. She sells secondhand clothes to young ladies in her Miss Sixty shop in Nairobi. She's been in business for seven years and employs one person. After successfully completing a loan from Faulu for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes.), she is now requesting Kes. 40,000 to increase her inventory.

Diannarose describes herself as an honest, humble and hardworking business lady with a vision. She says Faulu has allowed her access to credit so that she can keep her shop adequately stocked. She hopes that she can open more stalls in the future and become an established business lady who independently supports her business.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Juan Adolfo

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y 3 años en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica al servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi. Empezó alquilando motos y luego pudo comprarse una unidad móvil de segunda mano con la que viene trabajando hasta el día de hoy. Además desde hace dos años se dedica al cultivo de espárragos en un terreno de dos hectáreas que suele arrendar. Su esposa tiene también una pequeña bodega – tienda con la que ayuda a sustentar la economía familiar.

Debido a que su moto necesita mantenimiento en algunas piezas Juan se encuentra solicitando por primera vez  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles. El es un padre honrado y muy trabajador, su sueño es poder construir su casa de ladrillo debido a que está construida rústicamente y seguir adelante para brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children (ages 12, 8, and 3) in the District of Paiján, Ascope Province in La Libertad region, which is 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 15 years he has been transporting cargo and passengers in his motorcycle taxi. He began renting these vehicles until he was able to purchase one secondhand. He still has that vehicle today. In addition, he grows asparagus on a two hectare plot of land that he leases. His wife operates a small grocery store in order to help with the family expenses.

Juan is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 300 soles in order to perform maintenance on his motorcycle. He is an honest and hardworking father who dreams of building a brick house. In addition, he hopes to succeed so that he can provide his children with a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Reyna Estela

texts.es: La señora Reyna Estela O. M. de 40 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y tiene años de trabajar con Adim  donde ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, trabajadora y con visión. Ella está recibiendo este préstamo como estimulo a su labor y por ser una clienta de calidad el cual ocupara para mejorar su humilde casa que con las lluvias se le inunda.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna Estela O. M. is 40 years old and has a business selling clothing. She has been working with ADIM for years through the Violeta Group. She has demonstrated that she is a responsible, hardworking, and visionary person. She is receiving this loan as stimulus for her work and for being a good client who is concerned about improving her humble home that was impacted by flooding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old and married with two children, aged 10 and 12. He is the proprietor of Gent Paradise where he sells gentlemen's wear like suits, shoes, and shirts. He has one employee. He primarily sells to bankers and for wedding events. He has been in business for fifteen years and is now requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to add stock to his business, specifically shoes.

Peter describes himself as an honest businessman, guided by the principle of integrity and geared towards achieving his goals and aspirations. He says that he has become empowered through the training he received at Faulu.

Peter hopes to become a leading supplier of men's suits and shoes in Nairobi. In ten years, he would like to be an established businessman, owning his own home and still growing with Faulu.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 29 year-old married mother of two school-age children, a son and a daughter. She runs a small restaurant and also sells clothing. She has been in business for one year and is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to purchase more stock to expand her business.

Grace says that she learned how to manage her business more professionally since she joined Kiva partner Faulu where she is the chair of her group. She describes herself as hardworking and hopes to own a larger restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Julia Beatriz C. O. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia desde hace varios años, siendo su negocio de los primeros que se establecieron en Trojes. Julia es nativa de Oropoli y en busca de fuentes de trabajo para mejorar su situacion economica es como ella y su esposo llegan a esta zona caracterizada por ser una zona apta para la ganaderia, caficultura y agricultura. Estas actividades son las mas fuertes de esta zona.
La sra. C. y esposo tambien se dedican a la ganaderia pues tiene una pequeña finca de café y ganado, con mucho esfuerzo y fe han logrado superarse y sacar adelante a su familia
necesita al credito para surtir mas su negocio donde tenga de todo un poco de tal manera no dejar al cliente irsele sin comprar nada.
texts.en:
Señora Julia Beatriz C. O. has had a grocery store for several years. This was one of the first businesses that was established in Trojes. Julia is a native of Oropoli and while searching for a job to improve their economic situation, she and her husband arrived at this area that is characterized by being good for raising livestock, growing coffee, and agriculture. These activities are the most popular in the area. Señora C. and her husband also raise livestock and have a small coffee farm. With a lot of effort and faith, they have managed to improve their situation and to take care of their family. She needs this credit to supply her business where she has a little bit of everything, so she doesn't want her customers to leave her store without buying anything

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereal, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, butter, oil, margarine, soup, sauces, pastas, bread, soft drinks, churros, and cookies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín es un hombre muy jovial de 44 años, es padre soltero y tiene 4 hijos. Cuando aun vivía con la madre de sus hijos sembraba en la chacra de sus suegros, pero desde hace tres años que vive solo y viene sembrando sus plantas de café y plátanos en chacras alquiladas, donde paga entre 600 a 800 soles por año. 
Con tranquilidad y muchas esperanzas, Agustín cultiva sus chacras, pero no por ello, olvida su responsabilidad como padre. Por el momento piensa sacarle provecho a las chacras que alquila, por ello le presta toda su dedicación a sus cultivos, sólo así está seguro de obtener mayores ganancias y con ellas comprarse sus propias chacras. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y ya se ha hecho rápidamente amigo con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y de asistir a las reuniones del cada mes. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Agustín is a very cheerful 44-year-old man. He is a single father of 4 children. When he still lived with the mother of his children, he had a farm on his in-laws' land. For 3 years, he has lived alone and grows coffee and plantains on rented land, where he pays between 600 and 800 PEN. Calmly and with a lot of hope, Agustín farms his land, but he doesn't forget his responsibilities as a father. At the moment he plans to benefit from the land that he rents, and he has dedicated everything to his crops. This is the only way he will be sure to obtain better profits and that he will be able to buy his own land. This is his first credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has made friends very quickly with the other members of his communal bank. He promises to make his payments on time and to attend the bank's monthly meetings. He plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César es un joven soltero y muy sereno de 24 años, vive en la casa de su hermano. Tiempo atrás trabajaba para los cultivos de su hermano, a quien le tiene mucha gratitud, pero también piensa que ya es hora de independizarse, por lo cual su hermano mayor está muy contento de tal decisión. Por tal motivo le prestó su chacra, donde César ha sembrado plátanos.  Él tiene mucha confianza de que le irá bien, pero mientras tanto seguirá apoyando a su hermano hasta que obtenga mayor capital. Logrado este objetivo piensa sembrar café por ser un producto más rentable. De salirle todo como él piensa, con las ganancias va a comprar sus propias tierras, donde pueda sembrar tranquilamente todas las plantas que desea.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, donde se ha comprometido en pagar todas sus cuotas en los días señalados. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
César is a young, calm, 24-year-old bachelor. He lives in his brother's house. He used to work farming his brother's land, and he is very grateful to him. But he also thinks that it is time to become independent, and his older brother is very happy with his decision. For this reason, he loaned a plot of land to him, where César has grown plantains. He has a lot of confidence that this will go very will for him, but meanwhile, he will continue helping his brother until he receives more capital. To acheive this objective, he plans to grow coffee because it is a more profitable crop. If this goes as planned, he will buy his own land with his profits where he can peacefully grow all of the plants that he wants. This is his first credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has promised to make all of his payments on their appointed days. He will use the money he is requesting to buy coffee plants and chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants and fertilizers

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Sr. Ernesto C. se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda en la cual vende zapatos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior y varias cosas mas.  el cuenta con mas de 20 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocios. Su negocio esta ubicado en la calle del comercio, a la vez se dedica al cultivo de cafe lo que le genera otras fuentes de ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia, tiene 4 hijos y depende de su matrimonio solo uno, el cual cursa la carrera de Agronomia en la Universidad Agricola ubicada en Catacamas Departamento de Olancho
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Ernesto C. has a store where he sells shoes, skirts, shirts, pants, blouses, underwear, and various other items. He has more than 20 years of experience with this type of business. His business is located on the commercial street in his area. He also grows coffee, which generates another source of income for him to improve his family's living conditions. He has four children, but only one of them still is still his and his wife's dependent. This son is studying agriculture at Universidad Agrícola in Catacamas in the department of Olancho. He is requesting this credit to buy merchandise so he can supply his business and satisfy his clients' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes, underwear, shirts, skirts, pants, and blouses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.es:
Erickson es un joven soltero de 23 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. En vista que es el hermano mayor ha tomado la responsabilidad de apoyar a sus hermanos menores. Él siembra café, plátanos y frijol en las chacras de sus padres. Realizar estos trabajos agrícolas le agradan mucho y más cuando trabaja con toda su familia; mientras su madre va prepara los alimentos, su padre y su hermanos lo ayudan con el macheteo, y así también durante las cosechas, de ese modo no siente pesada su labor. 
Al ver Erickson que sus hermanos le ayudan se siente motivado, y con mucho gusto comparte sus ganancias con ellos.
Pero sus anhelos a futuro son de independizarse y tener sus propios cultivos, y mejor aún si logra comprar sus propias tierras.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy agradecido por contar con tal apoyo, por lo cual hace un juramento de no defraudar a su grupo con el incumplimiento de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Erickson is a young single man, 23 years old, who lives with his parents in their home. Given that he is the oldest brother, he has taken the responsibility of helping to support his younger siblings. He plants coffee, bananas and beans on his parents’ farmlands. He enjoys carrying out these agricultural tasks, and appreciates them even more when he gets to work with his whole family. While his mother prepares the meals, his father and brothers help him clear land. They also help during harvest time and therefore, during these times, he doesn’t feel the arduousness of the work as much. Seeing his siblings pitch in motivates Erickson, and he shares his earnings with them with great pleasure. However, his future plans are to become independent and have his own crops, which would be even better if he could manage to purchase his own lands. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very thankful to have such support, for which he promises not to defraud the group by failing to make any payments. The funds he is requesting will help him buy fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es una mujer muy trabajadora de 40 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar, cultivar y cuidar de sus cultivos de café y plátanos. Ella trabajan con mucha constancia y esmero, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y cuando terminar las labores en sus chacras, van atrabajar en las chacras de sus vecinos, donde la pagan a 13 soles y a su esposo 15 soles. 
Con estas ganancias adicionales a sus cultivos, Lorenza busca mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Por ello sueña en incrementar sus chacras de café, para dejar de trabajar como jornalera.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y tiene toda la predisposición de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir contando con otros préstamos posteriores. El dinero que solicita es para que comprar semillas de café para hace un vivero.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a hard working 40-year old woman who lives with her partner, father, and 4 children. Together with her husband, she dedicates herself to planting, cultivating and caring for her coffee and banana crops. She works consistently and with enthusiasm, from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. After she finishes tending to her own farmland, they go to neighbors’ lands to work, where she earns 13 soles and her husband 15 soles. With the additional earnings, Lorenza seeks to improve the standard of living for her children. She dreams of increasing her production of coffee so she can discontinue seeking out extra work on other peoples’ lands. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to paying her installments on time, since she wants to be able to rely on additional credit in the future. The funds she is requesting will be used to buy coffee plant seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plant seeds.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
la joven Xiomara C. tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de medicinas,  el crecimiento y la administración que le ha dado a su negocio es muy buena ya que nos comento que los ingresos que le genera su negocio los reinvierte en la compra de algunos medicamentos que son mas baratos y que tambien contribuye a sus padres con los gastos del hogar mejorando de esta manera la situacion familiar.
para este nuevo año de ser posible continuara con los estudios de enfermeria y luego una licenciatura que le permita certificar su negocio como una farmacia.
su meta es poder tener su negocio bien establecido y que sea una farmacia de calidad.
texts.en:
The young Xiomara C. has dedicated herself to selling medicines for 3 years. The growth and management she has provided to her business has been very good, and she commented to us that she reinvests the income she generates into the purchase of medicines at better prices. She also contributes funds to her parents, to help improve the entire household’s quality of life. In the coming new year, if possible, she would like to continue her nursing studies and, later, the licensing required to register her business as a pharmacy. Her goal is to have a well established business that is a high quality pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic medicines.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 55 años, está casado y tienen 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a labrar la tierra y quitar todas las malezas de sus chacras de frejoles, plátanos y café. Con mucho cariño cuida de cada una de sus plantas, puesto que depende de su buena atención para que sus cosechas sean buenas. 
En todo este tiempo sus cultivos jamás le han fallado, por ello le da gusto dedicarse a ellos. Para él, el apoyo de su esposa en sus faenas agrícolas es fundamental, por eso la quiere muchísimo.
Para la comercialización de sus productos, ambos viajan a la ciudad y tratan de vender al que mejor postor para que sus ganancias sean mejores y de modo comparte pueda cubrir la alimentación y educación de sus hijos, quienes son su adoración y el motivo de su esfuerzo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contento porque lo invitaron a ser parte de un banco comunal, donde ha prometido no defrauda la confianza y ser puntual en todos los pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 55 years old, married and has 3 children who live at home. Since he was very young, he has worked the land and removed the weeds from his farms of beans, bananas and coffee. He takes care of each one of his plants with lots of love; due to the fact that the harvests depend on his careful attention in order for them to be successful.

In all this time his crops have never failed, therefore he is glad to dedicate himself to the plants. For him, the support of his wife with the farm work is fundamental; because of this he loves her very much.

In order to sell the products, both of them travel to the city and try to sell them to the highest bidder so that their earnings will increase so that he can provide for his children’s food and education, he adores them and they are the reason for his efforts.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy because he has been invited to be a part of a communal bank. He has promised to not abuse the confidence and to be punctual with all the payments. He is requesting funds in order to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es:
Teodosio es un hombre laborioso de 64 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia.
Pese a su avanzada edad, trabaja con mucha agilidad y dinamismo en sus cultivos de café, plátanos y frejol. Dedicarse en esta actividad le parece muy divertido y con su manos rudas macheta los arbustos y la mala hierba, en aras de mantener limpias sus chacras. 
El cultivo de su mayor agrado es el café, por serle muy rentable, sobre todo en los meses de mayo a julio, en esta temporada trabaja en compañía de su esposa, quien le ayuda a recoger los granos de café, para que en una solo carga lleven la mayor cantidad posible a las acopiadoras de su zona. 
En el caso del frejol y los plátanos no obtienen tantas ganancias como con el café, pero le son muy útiles para cubrir los gastos diarios del resto de los meses, con los que cubre la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy motivado por los ahorros que podrá tener, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar sus cuotas de forma puntual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus diversos cultivos.
texts.en:
Teodosio, 64, is a hard-working man. He lives with his life partner, the mother of their four children, in his own house. In spite of his advanced age, he works his coffee, banana, and bean fields with much agility and energy. Working at this activity is enjoyable for him. He uses his coarse hands to clear the bushes and weeds in order to keep his fields clean. The crop that he likes the best is coffee. It is very profitable for him, especially from May to July. In this season he works with his wife, who helps him gather the coffee beans. They do this so that they can take one load of the largest quantity possible to the suppliers in the area. He does not get as much income from beans and bananas as he does from coffee. But, they are very useful for covering the daily expenses the rest of the months. They cover the food and the childrens’ education. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very motivated by the savings that he will be able to have. He promises to make his payments punctually. He will use the money that he is now asking for to by chemical fertilizers for his diverse crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.
Virginia, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería de ropas, pero como no le fue muy bien y ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su ella misma y su pareja, emprendió su propio  negocio de venta de bandejas, para lavar ropas. Virginia nos cuenta, que para realizar sus ventas, se levanta muy temprano, para recorrer por diferentes calles y así visita a sus clientes, que ya la conocen. 

Posteriormente, en las quincenas y fin de mes, solo se dedica a cobrar a sus clientes, juntamente con el apoyo de su pareja. Sus ventas le va muy bien y se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo que realiza, y con su carisma y buena atención que le caracteriza. 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, quincenalmente comprará 60 bandejas, en diferentes tamaños y colores, para así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a mujeres como ella, que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Luz y Esperanza II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has one dependent child who goes to school. Virginia previously worked selling clothes, but that did not go very well for her. Facing the necessity of contributing economically to the household and motivated by herself and her life partner, she set up her own business selling basins for washing clothes. Virginia tells us that in order to make her sales she gets up very early to travel different streets. She visits her customers; they already know her. Later, midmonth and at the end of the month, she only works at collecting from her customers. She does this with her life partner. Her sales are going very well. She is proud of the work she does with her characteristic charisma and good service. She will use this loan for 1,300 PEN to buy basins in different sizes and colors. She will do this every two weeks to satisfy her customers. She now feels happy with the service she offers. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue doing this for a long time, and that they help lots of enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy quantities of wash basins

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de productos de la región.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar lanas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y frazadas por pedido.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar una casa en Puno.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of the Juchuy Niño Communal Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 34, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She lives in the Capana community. She has an elementary school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan for 300 PEN allowed her to increase the capital in her business of selling regional products. She currently needs a new loan for 500 PEN. This will allow her to buy different colors of wool to make articles of clothing and costumes by order. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy a house in Puno. She likes the meetings and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different colors of wool

loans.name: María América

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y una de sus cinco hijos en el caserío Mocape, distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 27 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Su esposo adquiere los animales a los negociantes de la zona. Ella es la encargada de criarlos y su esposo el de venderlos todos los viernes en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Usualmente comercializan ovejas, cabras y chanchos. Este es el único ingreso estable con el que cuenta la familia.

Ella desea ampliar el negocio familiar con la compra de más animales para su posterior cria y venta por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y muy responsable. En la fotografía aparece en un potrero cerca a las ovejas que está criando. En la zona es muy común ver a las ovejas pastar libremente.

Su más grande anhelo es poder arreglar su casa, construida de material rústico y mejorar la calidad de vida con la que viven.
texts.en:
María is the mother of a family. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and one of her 5 children in the Mocape settlement, Olmos district, in Lambayeque province. Mocape is about 2 hours from the City of Chiclayo.

For the last 27 years she has dedicated herself to raising and selling farm animals. Her husband acquires the animals from venders in the zone. She is in charge of raising them and her husband sells them every Friday in the city of Chiclayo. Usually they sell ewes, goats and hogs. This is the only stable income that the family can count on.

She wants to expand the family business by buying more animals to raise and sell. For this reason she is soliciting a loan of 1,000 new sols through Edpyme Alternativa. María is a happy woman, hard working and very responsible. In the photograph she appears in a pasture with the ewes she is raising. In this zone it is very common to see ewes grazing freely.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ANIMALS TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Santos Eucebia

texts.es:
la Joven. Santos Eusebia G. C.  se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con un pequeño
negocio denominado "VARIEDADES CHEVITA" tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien,  esta soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, los que apoya con algunos gastos en el hogar.
uno de sus sueños es tener una gran tienda en la que pueda emplear personas y de esta forma contribuir con fuentes de empleo, hay que buscar nuevas alternativas para poder salir adelante, es una mujer con un espiritu de superacion. con este credito que esta solicitando hara crecer su negocio y  lograra dar un paso mas en el peldaño de la escalera de sus sueños. puntualizo chevita como popularmente se le conoce en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos Eusebia G. C. is a young businesswoman. She has a small business called Variedades Chevita. She has been in this business for over six years. It has gone very well for her during all of that time. She is single, and she does not have children. She lives with her parents, and she helps with some of the household expenses. One of her dreams is to have a large store where she can employ people. This way she can contribute by providing a source of employment. You need to look at new alternatives to be able to get ahead. She is a woman with the spirit to succeed. She will use the loan that she is asking for to make her business grow and take a step on the stairway to her dreams. In her community she is popularly known as “Punctual Chevita”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramona Hercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ramona B. se dedica a laborar como conserje en una empresa de la capital con el fin de llevar a su casa de habitación el sustento para el bienestar de su familia. 

La señora Ramona tiene un pequeño hijo que está estudiando y requiere invertir en el pago de la matricula para garantizar que el próximo año su pequeño siga estudiando y  es por este motivo que ella solicitó el crédito para pagar la matrícula del colegio y así garantizar que su pequeño continúe estudiando para llagar a ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Ramona B. works as a janitor for a company in the capital city of Managua. She does this to bring home support for the well being of her family. Ramona has a small child who is in school. She needs to pay the enrollment fee to guarantee that her little one will be able to keep studying next year. That is why she is asking for this loan, to pay for his school enrollment. That way she will guarantee that her little one will continue his education to be able to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school enrollment fee for her son

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años en el centro poblado menor Insculas, distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace seis años instaló una pequeña tienda en su casa donde ofrecía abarrotes, golosinas y productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite). Este negocio era la única fuente estable de ingresos económicos que poseían ya que su esposo trabajaba eventualmente como obrero agrícola.

El negocio era el único de su tipo en la zona por lo que sus vecinos e incluso pobladores de otros caseríos acudían a su establecimiento regularmente a adquirir sus productos. Hace poco su esposo consiguió arrendar un terreno para sembrar maíz y debido a ello la tienda quedó desabastecida porque todo el capital que se invertía en la bodega pasó a invertirse en el terreno.

Ahora que la cosecha ya está cerca María desea reabastacer su negocio por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de más productos.

Ella desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo y juntos sacar adelante a su familia, María es una mujer trabajadora, activa y muy responsable.
texts.en:
María is a 26 year old mother. She lives with her husband and their three children; ages 7, 4, and 2. They live in the Centro Poblado Menor de Inculas in the Olmos district, Lambayeque province. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. Six years ago she set up a small store in her house. She sells groceries, sweets, and basic needs products (rice, sugar, oil). This business was the only source of stable income that they had as her husband worked occasionally as a farm worker. The business was the only type of its kind in the area, so her neighbors and inhabitants from other hamlets frequent her establishment regularly to get their products. A little while ago her husband got a piece of land to rent in order to plant corn. Because all of the money that used to be invested in the store was now invested in the land, the stock in her store was left depleted. Now that the harvest is near, María wants to restock her business. Because of this she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan for the first time. She is asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy more products. She wants to keep working to help her husband. Together they will get the family ahead. María is a hard-working woman who is active and very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs items to restock her business

loans.name: Alpacoma Group

texts.es: Hace mas de cinco años,  entre familiares y vecinas se forma la asociación “Alpacoma”, se reúne en el centro focal villa Exaltación, a la fecha esta compuesta por  diez miembros, Actualmente Dolores C. es la presidente de grupo, cuenta que inicio  su negocio  porque tenia limitaciones económicas en su hogar, vio la  necesidad de obtener recursos necesarios para  gastos alimenticios de sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de frazadas, sus demás compañeras tienen distintas actividad, por ejemplo: Claudia confecciona fundas para autos, Nancy vende frutas, Concepción vende comida, Osar fabrica ladrillos. El grupo en su totalidad necesita capital para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
Over five years ago, a group of family members and neighbors got together to form the Alpacoma Association, which holds its meetings in Villa Exaltacion. To date, it is comprised of ten group members. Dolores C. is the current president of the group. She states that she started her own business because she had financial limitations in her household, so she felt the need to earn the income necessary to cover her children’s nutritional expenses. She sells blankets for a living. The rest of her fellow group members own different types of businesses. For example, Claudia makes vehicle covers, Nancy sells fruit, Concepcion sells fast food, and Oscar makes bricks. The entire group needs working capital to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Magdalena G. se dedica al servicio, cuenta con un comedor que se conoce como 
"COMEDOR EMMANUEL" tiene mas 30 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo
le ha ido muy bien, con este negocio logro que sus hijos estudaran y salieran adelante. Maria vende comida desde que el plato solo costaba menos de 0.75 centavos de lempira, ahora un plato de comida vale de 40 a 50 Lempiras. En este lugar ella fue la primera que puso comedor.
aprovechado las ganancias a mejorado su casa en la que vive y tiene su negocio , tiene una hija que le ayuda en la elaboracion de la comida y una de sus metas es poner un pequeño Hospedaje ya que aquí se carece de este tipo de servicios y las personas que necesitan este tipo de servicio tienen que regresarse hasta EL Paraiso que esta ubicado a 17 kilometros de esta zona.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena G. is in food service. She has a restaurant called “Comedor Emmanuel”. She has been in this business for over 30 years. It has gone well for her during all of this time. Through the business she was able to educate her children and get them ahead. Maria has been selling food since a plate of food only cost less than 0.75 Lempira. Now a plate of food is worth 40 or 50 Lempiras. She was the first to start a restaurant in this place. Taking advantage of her earnings, she has improved the house where she lives and has her business. Her daughter helps her make the food. One of her goals is to set up a small boarding service because her area lacks this type of service. People need this type of service. They have to go back to El Paraiso, which is 17 kilometers from this area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, soft drinks, plates, glasses, disposable forks, rice, sugar, shortening, oil, vegetables, juice in boxes, cheese, and sausage

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Diomith, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Anteriormente Diomith, trabajaba en CEPCO (Centro de Estudios y Promoción Comunal del Oriente) donde poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, así de esta manera se inicio con la venta de cosméticos, nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien, por lo que ahora, es directora de la Línea UNIQUE, donde cuenta con su propia cadena de consultoras, en diferentes zonas de la Ciudad. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su aumentar su stock como: perfumes y colonias para damas, caballeros y niños; cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  Asimismo seguirá formando su propia red de representantes de la línea UNIQUE, la cual esto también genera gastos.

Diomith, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Diomith belongs to the Virgen de la Inmaculada Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 40, married, and has two children. The children are still dependent upon her, and they go to school. Diomith is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life’s path. She feels content and proud of what she has achieved. Diomith previously worked for CEPCO (Center for Studies and Communal Promotion of the East). Little by little she was saving and generating her own capital. This was the way she started with her cosmetic sales. She tells us that things are going very well for her these days. She is now a director of the UNIQUE line, where she has her own chain of consultants in different areas of the city. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will increase her stock by purchasing beauty products like perfume; cologne for women, men, and children; creams; compact powder; lipstick; and nail polish. She will continue forming her own chain of representative for the UNIQUE line, which also generates income. Diomith is an example to follow for many women who start a business; with perseverance they can achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and for helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals, palm nuts, fruits, and food condiments

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita V. es madre responsable ya que ha llevado el sustento a sus dos pequeños hijos que estudian en el colegio. Sus pequeños requieren del apoyo de ella para superarse por lo que a diario ella vela por el bienestar de cada uno de ellos.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para el pago de los aranceles escolares ya que le urge hacer tales pagos para permitir que sus pequeños sigan estudiando en el colegio y así contribuir para que en el futuro lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita V. is a responsible mother who has provided for her two small children who are studying in school. Her little ones require support in order to succeed in school, so she sees to the welfare of each one of them daily. The reason that she has approached Ceprodel is to request a loan to pay for school fees, since she must make these payments in order that her children can continue to study at school, so that they can become true professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Yovani

texts.es:
Yovani tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío Cerro Santa Rosa, distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores. Cría ovejas y cerdos para venderlos a los negociantes de la zona o a sus vecinos. Esta actividad es la única que le provee de ingresos permanentes. Eventualmente se desempeña como obrero agrícola en los terrenos cercanos.

El desea empezar a alimentar a sus animales con algun tipo de alimento balanceado y así mejorar su calidad. Por ese motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven responsable y que está trabajando arduamente para lograr sus metas. Desea seguir criando animales y reuinir el suficiente dinero para construir su propia casa y adquirir un terreno agrícola donde pueda desempeñarse como agricultor y así sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Yovani is 25 years old. He lives with his wife in his parents’ home which is 2 hours away from the city of Chiclayo and located in the Cerro Santa Rosa settlement, district of Olmos, Lambayeque province.

As of four years ago he has been in the business of raising and selling small animals. He raises sheep and hogs for sale to his neighbors and businesses in the area. This work is the only thing that provides him with a steady income. Occasionally he works as an agricultural laborer in nearby fields.

He would like to start feeding his animals with some type of balanced diet in order to improve their quality. For this reason he finds himself applying for the first time, for a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a responsible young man who is working passionately to achieve his goals. He would like to continue raising animals and save enough money to build his own house and acquire a plot of farmland where he can work as a farmer and in that way help his loved ones succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced diet for raising animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, juice, rice, beans, cheese, sausage, limes, salt, spices, bread, plates, glasses, and disposable silverware.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Central, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar galletas, mana (cereal), frutas diversas, gaseosas, jugos, etc. para vender en las ferias de las alturas una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave Disrict, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. Graciela lives in central Ancara and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling livestock.

Graciela is current requesting a new loan of 500 soles to buy cookies, “mana” (a candy dough similar to marzipan), various fruits, sodas, juices, etc. She will sells these products at the high fairs once a week.

Her greatest wish is to continue working. Graciela enjoys her savings the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food & beverages to sell at the fairs

loans.name: Rister

texts.es:
La señora Rister, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 61 años y 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.

Rister, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que maneja. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la línea: Esika, como complemento D. su negocio también venD. los Productos D. Gano Café (Productos naturales para la cura D. diferentes tipos D. enfermedades).

 Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,300.00, comprará productos D. belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices, labiales, esmaltes D. uñas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. productos D. gano café y harinas para sus dulces.

Rister, a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir D. muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Rister is a member of the Immaculate Virgin Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 61 years old, married, and has three children of whom one is still a dependent.

Rister is a cheerful and charismatic woman who is extremely devoted to her family. These qualities help her in running her business. She sells the Esika line of cosmetics, which complements her other business selling “Gano Café” (natural products for curing different types of diseases).

With this loan of 1300 soles, Rister will buy beauty products to add to her inventory such as colognes for women, men, and children; crèmes, pressed powders, eye pencils, lipsticks, and nail polish. Some of the money will be used to buy “Gano Café” products and flour for making sweets.

Rister is a role model for many women her age as someone who has started a business and achieved her dreams through perseverance. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza M. se siente muy satisfecha porque tiene un hijo que estudia en la Universidad y está convencida que algún día llegará a ser un profesional de mucho éxito. Ella ha trabajado por mucho tiempo para brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo intelectual.

Ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el pago de la matrícula universitaria de su hijo y por tal razón espera confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado y podrá continuar contribuyendo al bienestar del desarrollo de su hijo para que este llegue a ser alguien muy preparado en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza M. is very pleased that her son is studying at the university. She is convinced that he will become a successful professional some day. Maritza has a worked a long time in order to provide him with the conditions necessary for his intellectual development.

She requests a loan in order to pay for her son’s university registration fees. For this reason, she is confident that her loan will be granted so that she can continue contributing to her child’s welfare and development as well as prepare him for life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's university registration fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell sheets

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
el sr. Oscar T. tiene un taller de mecanica, tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, en su taller da muchos servicios especialmente a taxistas, les cambia el aceite, todos los filtros y cambia piezas de direccion y otras, a las personas que lo visitan les gusta su trabajo ya que es una persona bien detallista y trabaja muy bien. el necesita el credito para comprar barril de aceite ya que por barril le sale mucho mas barato que por galones y asi tiene mas ganancias. 
tambien necesita comprar varias piezas para tenerlas en su bodega para trabajar mas rapido cuando los clientes llegan y asi no tener que ir a buscarlas cuando las necesite.
el sueño de el es tener un negocio en el cual pueda atender todo tipo de vehiculos, con scanners y computadoras para detectar las fallas de lso automoviles.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar T. operates an auto repair shop and has been engaged in this type of business activity for a long time. He provides many services at his shop, especially to taxi drivers. He performs oil changes, filter replacements, inspection of the steering components, and other services. His customers come back to him because he is a detailed person and a good worker.

Oscar needs a loan so that he can purchase a barrel of motor oil since it is much cheaper that buying it by the gallon. The savings will help him keep more profit. He also wants to buy various parts to keep in inventory so that he can work quickly when customers are at his shop instead of having to buy them as needed. He dreams of eventually having a business in which he can service all types of vehicles, using scanners and computers to detect malfunctions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor oil, oil filters, gas filters, air filters, and spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Nubia M. se dedica a atender su negocio de fabricación y venta de colchones los que son comercializados por ella misma ofreciendo diferentes estilos de colchones para los clientes que le visitan. 

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus clientes y por este motivo no cesa de trabajar y buscar la manera de atender a su clientela. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su localidad para ampliar su espacio donde vende los colchones y con el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción para iniciar a ampliar y remodelar el local y así brindar buenas condiciones a los clientes que compran los colchones.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Sra. Nubia M. attends to her business of manufacturing and selling mattresses. She offers them in a variety of styles to the customers who visit her store.

Nubia is known as a hardworking woman who is concerned about the welfare of her customers. For this reason, she continues to work hard and look for new ways to serve her clients. She is requesting a loan so that she can make improvements to her store by expanding the space in which she sells mattresses. The funds will be used to buy construction materials so that she can begin expanding and remodeling her store and provide better conditions in which her customers can shop for mattresses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can begin expanding & remodeling her mattress store

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 5 años de edad y 3 meses de nacido en casa de sus suegros, en el caserío Callejón Cascajal, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo es peón agrícola y que los ingresos que percibe no son permanentes, hace 1 año empezó a vender ropa a sus vecinos y a los pobladores de las zonas cercanas. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos y compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Carolina nos comenta que la idea de su negocio nació debido a que la zona en donde viven está muy alejada de la ciudad de Chiclayo y que la ropa en la ciudad más cercana, Olmos, se vende a un precio elevado. Empezó con pocos clientes y ahora viaja constantemente a adquirir más mercadería para cubrir la demanda.

Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para ampliar su negocio.

Carolina es una mujer alegre y muy responsable. Su más grande anhelo es construir su casa propia y adquirir mostradores para su ropa. En la fotografía aparece junto a las dos bolsas donde guarda la ropa que vende.
texts.en:
Carolina is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children (a 5 year old and a 3 month old baby). She and her family live in the house of her in-laws located in the village of Callejón Cascajal. This community is in Olmos District, Lambayaeque Province, which is 2 hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Since her husband works as a farm laborer, he does not earn a permanent salary. One year ago, Carolina began selling clothing to neighbors and residents of nearby villages. She works by taking orders and then purchasing the merchandise in Chiclayo.

Carolina says she came up with the idea to start this business because her village is too far from Chiclayo and that the clothes being sold in the nearest town of Olmos are expensive. She started with only a few customers, but she now travels frequently in order to obtain more merchandise to keep up with demand.

She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles. The funds will be used to buy more inventory so that she can expand her business.

Carolina is a cheerful and very responsible woman. Her greatest dream is to build a home and buy cabinets for storing clothing. In the photograph, she appears with the two bags she currently uses to hold clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Janete Miriam

texts.es: La señora Janete T. de 40 años de edad, es maestra de un centro privado desde hace dieciocho años, procreo cuatro hijos los cuales estudian para tener una educación, su esposo es pastor por gracias esta la familia junta. Gracias a Dios mi vida tuvo sentido ya que por circunstancia de la vida mi mama murió, y nos crió mi abuelito pero mas tarde el también murió y por ayuda de una tía salimos adelante ya que nuestro padre nos había abandonado. Vive en un barrio Pablo Úbeda, sus planes es poder terminar de asegurar su casa por eso con este prestamos comprara  piedra, cemento, arena y hierro para hacer un muro en la parte de atrás de la casa y poder estar en mejores condiciones de seguridad ya que en el barrio hay mucha delincuencia por falta del desempleo en nuestro país. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer las mejoras a nuestras viviendas, ya que solo a través del crédito se lograr construir por la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Sra. Janete T. is 40 years old and has been teaching for 18 years at a private school. Her four children are students while her husband is a pastor. She is thankful that her family is together. Janete thanks God that her life has meaning after the circumstances that she had to endure. After her mother died, she was raised by her grandfather but he also passed away much later. An aunt helped to support her since her father had abandoned the family.

Janete lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Úbeda. Her plans include being able to finish securing her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase stone, cement, sand, and iron to build a security wall behind her house. This will provide safer conditions since there is frequent crime in her neighborhood due to high unemployment throughout the country. She thanks the Institution for the opportunity to make these improvements to her home and providing an easy way for her to make her loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a security wall

loans.name: Orelee Adora

texts.es:
La señora Orelee B. es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo y brindándoles un techo digno donde habitar. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que labora en un colegio impartiendo clases de ingles a los alumnos.

Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda porque ha estado en malas condiciones y para esto es que ella solicita un crédito que le permita comprar los materiales de construcción para utilizarlos en el techo y el piso y de esta manera cubrir las necesidades de sus pequeños con referencia a su vivienda ubicada en la ciudad de Managua.
texts.en:
Sra. Orelee B. is a single mother who is responsible for supporting her three young children and providing them with the necessary conditions for their development. She also wants to give them a decent home in which to live. Orelee is a hardworking woman who works at a high school teaching English to her students.

She needs to invest in her home because of its bad condition. For this reason, Orelee is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials that will be used to repair the roof and the floor. This will allow her to provide the necessary shelter for her little ones. Her home is located in the city of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for roof and floor repairs

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 20, es soltero, pero tiene una pequeña hija que vive con su madre (su ex pareja). Inter diario trabaja como chofer de un vehículo, transportando pasajeros desde la ciudad hasta los diversos pueblos rurales de la provincia. Al día, como máximo realiza dos viajes, y en algunas oportunidades, con suerte, encuentra pasajeros que van de vuelta, es así cuando logra reunir mayores ganancias. Los otros días trabaja en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, de ese modo dinamiza su economía, con la cual cubre los gastos de su hija. 
Para los días de cosecha, Wilmer aprovecha el auto con el que trabaja, pues mientras lleva a los pasajeros, acomoda de 3 a 4 sacos de productos a la ciudad para su comercialización en el mercado o para las diversas acopiadoras de café.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, él ingresó a este banco comunal por medio de la invitación de su hermano, a quien no quiere hace quedar mal, por lo que será muy cumplido con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 20 years old and single, but he has a young daughter who lives with her mother (his ex-wife). During the day, he works as a taxi driver transporting passengers from the city to different rural villages throughout the province. At most he is able to make two round trips in a single day. Occasionally, if he is lucky, he will secure passengers for the return trip into the city and earn more money as a result. On the days he is not driving, Wilmer works in his coffee and baN. fields as a means of boosting his finances so that he can cover his daughter’s expenses.

During the harvest season, Wilmer makes good use of his taxi. While carrying passengers, he can also accommodate 3 to 4 bags of produce to take with him into the city to sell at the market or to various coffee traders.

This is Wilmer’s first loan with MFP. His brother invited him to join the Communal Bank, so Wilmer promises to make his payments on time to keep from making him look bad. He will use the funds to buy chemical fertilizers for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy, by boxes, candies, soaps, toilet paper, detergents, mosquito repellents, etc

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Sonia S. habita en la ciudad de Managua y se dedica arduamente a trabajar para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento en su vivienda que se ha visto muy maltratada por los fenómenos naturales que le han azotado. Ella es madre soltera y con dos pequeños hijos que mantener por lo que desea brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo tanto intelectual como familiar.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para reconstruir el techo y así proteger a sus hijos del sol y de la lluvia. Ella espera ser beneficiada con este crédito para mejorar en conjunto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia S. lives in the city of Managua and is determined to make improvements to her home, since it has been badly damaged as a result of natural events. She is a single mother with two small children to support, so she wants to provide them with the conditions necessary for their intellectual and social development.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for rebuilding the roof so that she can protect her children from the sun and the rain. She hopes to be the beneficiary of this loan so that she and her children can better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to rebuild the roof of her house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay customs fees

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
La señora Dona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de La Inmaculada”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 55 años, 03 hijos; todos independientes.

Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Dona nos cuenta que lleva 10 años en este negocio y empezó vendiendo huevos y galletas, poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, invertirá comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dona, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Dona belongs to the communal bank, "Virgen de La Inmaculada" in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martín, in the department of San Martín. She is married, is 55, and has three chidren. Her fighting spirit has always characterized her, and her desire to get ahead through her own means have led her to open her own business selling groceries. Dona tells us that she has 10 years of experience with this business and started by selling eggs and cookies. Little by little, she has earned experience with this type of business and is making herself known and loved among her customers. Currently she has a loyal clientele who come to her store daily to buy why is necessary to run their homes. She personally attends to them with her the charisma she is know for. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar in sacks, noodles in packages, milk and preserved fish in boxes of a variety of brands, cleaning supplies for the home, and personal hygiene products to continue giving the best service to her customers. Dona is thankful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to raise the number of products she has

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To develop and maintain a computer centre

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores; vive junto a su esposa en el caserío Mocape, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, empezó a trabajar como peón agrícola y poco a poco, con sus ahorros y esfuerzo pudo adquirir un terreno agrícola donde actualmente siembra maracuyá, mango y tamarindo en asociación con otros agricultores de la zona.

Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores (carneros, chanchos, cabritos), con estas actividades ellos han salido adelante desde que empezaron a vivir juntos.

El se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la siembra y mantenimiento de 500 nuevos plantones de maracuyá con los que piensa ampliar su negocio.

Juan es responsable y muy trabajador, en la asociación en donde siembra todos los agricultores se brindan apoyo cuando lo necesitan. Su más grande anhelo es ver terminado un proyecto hidroenergético en la zona que le permita regar su cultivo con mayor facilidad ya que ahora riegan sus arboles frutales extrayendo agua de pozos subterraneos.
texts.en:
Juan, 63, is married and has four grown children. He lives with his wife in the Mocape settlement, which is located in the Olmos district, Lambayeque province. This is two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been farming for 20 years. He started working as a field worker. Little by little, with his savings and much effort, he was able to get a piece of farming land. That is where he currently plants passion fruit, mangos, and tamarinds in association with other farmers in the area. His wife raises small animals (sheep, pigs, goats). With these activities they have gotten ahead since they started living together. He finds himself, for the first time, asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN. He will invest in the planting and maintenance of 500 new passion fruit plants, which will expand his business. Juan is responsible and very hard-working. In the group where he plants, all of the farmers offer support when necessary. His biggest goal is to see the hydroenergetic project in the area finished. This allows for watering the crops with greater ease. Now they water the fruit trees by taking water from underground wells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and maintenance of 500 passion fruit plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA FELIPA D. J. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia tiene estudios hasta 6º de primaria, no logró seguir estudiando porque era humilde y no tenía dinero para lograr su educación. Tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales solo 1 depende económicamente de ella.
MARIA se dedica a la venta de manualidades, como peluches y muñecas tejidas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró una pequeña vitrina para mostrar sus productos. 
Con este crédito de 850.00 nuevos soles comprará material, como: telas, hilos, rellenos, alambres, perlas, broches, etc para confeccionar mas peluches y muñecas, para aprovechar estas fiestas navideñas, y ganar algo mas de ingreso para su familia. 
MARIA sueña con tener una tienda en su casa donde pueda vender sus manualidades.
texts.en:
MARIA FELIPA D. J., 56, lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú.
