Leobardo wants to buy more models of cars so that he can have a more varied inventory and be able to satisfy the needs of more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell used automobile parts.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
El Sra. Mariana la cliente antigua en la institucion, es nacida en Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, vive en la localidad D. Santa Martha, aproximadamente a 20 Kms D. El Torno. Su actividad economica principal es la venta D. ropa nueva en el Mercado Central; el esposo es chofer asalariado D. profesión; pese a que son jovenes tienen 5 hijos todos en edad escolar, por lo tanto el esfuerzo D. ambos tiene que ser el doble para tratar D. sacar adelante a su familia.
El destino del crédito es para la compra D. un puesto en el mercado El Torno, ya que en que estan actualmente es alquilado.
texts.en:
. Mariana has been a client of the institution for a long time. She was born in Santa Cruz D. la Sierra and lives in Santa Martha, which is approximately 20 kms. from El Torno. She sells new clothing in the Central Market. Her husband is a salaried driver. Despite their youth, they have five school-age children which means that both parents must work twice as hard to see the family get ahead. This financing will be used to buy a stall in the El Torno market since they currently lease the one they are using.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market.

loans.name: Hector Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Héctor Ernesto M. vive solo ya que esta separado de su esposa y familia desde hace muchos años atrás, mas esto no ha sido impedimento para que luche por salir adelante, por lo mismo el tiene su negocio propio de venta de hot dog (perros calientes) desde hace 9 años. Negocio que lleva por nombre “Hot dog El Chino”, esta muy establecido ya que se encuentra ubicado en las afueras de una colonia popular y calle muy transitada por los conductores, por tal motivo el cuenta con su gran cantidad de clientela, pero en estos momentos tuvo que realizar un fuerte pago ya que compro otro carrito de hot dog y por tal motivo esta tramitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para la elaboración de su producto.
texts.en:
Hector Ernesto M. lives alone since he has been separated from his wife and family for many years. This has not been an impediment for him to fight to get ahead. He has had his own business of selling hot dogs for the past 9 years. The business is named “Hot dog El Chino” and does well since it’s located in the outskirts of a busy neighborhood and on a street with a lot of motor vehicle traffic. Thus he has many customers, but recently he has had a big expense since he bought another hot dog stand. He is applying for the loan to buy more supplies to make his products.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more supplies

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang C. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Sem, were married in 1993 and they have four daughters. One of them is a garment factory worker, two attend school and the other one is still young. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Leang is now a tailor. Her husband has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for over ten years. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old and doesn’t work well so he spends a lot of money on repairs. Therefore, Leang is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: El Sra. Marlene tiene  como  actividad economica principal,  la venta de ropa nueva, ella es una vendedora sin puesto fijo, ambulante. Su sueño es comprarse un puesto en el mercado para eso ella ahorra, ademas que el credito lo invertira como parte de pago para la adquisicion de un puesto en el mercado de El Torno. En la actualidad esta viviendo en la localidad de Santa Martha junto a su esposo, que se dedica a la  actividad de el trasporte; tienen dos hijos están en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Marlene sells new clothing but does not have a fixed stall from which to sell; she moves from place to place. Her dream is to buy a stall in the market. She will use her savings, in addition to this loan, to buy a stall in the el Torno market. She currently lives with her husband, who works in transportation, and their two school-age children in Santa Martha.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
El Sra. Marina, tiene vivienda propia en la localidad de San Jose, distante 20 Kms de El Torno, departamento de Santa Cruz. Su actividad economica principal es la venta de asaditos (bifes)de carne de cerdo, esta actividad la realiza en la zona central del pueblo. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos; el esposo tiene su actividad propia que es el transporte publico, cuenta con su propio vehiculo.
 El crédito solicitado lo invertiran en la compra de productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Marina has her own home in San Jose, 20 kms from El Torno, Santa Cruz department. She sells grilled pork steaks in the center of town. She lives with her husband and their two children. Her husband has his own job in public transport and has his own vehicle. The funds will be used to buy products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Atikas

texts.en:
Mrs. Atikas Y., 41 and her husband, Mr. Patri Set, 42, were married in 1984 and have 7 children: 5 sons and 2 daughters. The eldest son assists his parents in fishing business, three children are in school and other one works in plywood factory. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Atikas sells fish that her husband caught in the local market. Mr. Patri Set has been a fisherman since he was young. But, some of his fishing materials is old and breaks down so Atikas is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Sam Ol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of sixteen people that all live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sim S. O. was elected by members to be president of the village bank.

Mrs. Sim S. O. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local schoO.. Her husband, Mr. Khun Khom, raises cows while she sells fish at the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to increase her income and expand her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.use: To increase her income and expand her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tevy

texts.en:
Mr. Tevy P., age 24, is single and is living with his parents in a small village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tevy has been working for a restaurant for one year. He hopes to organize his house where he lives to become neat, so he is applying for a loan of $500 to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Don Moisés, Es cliente antiguo de la institucion, vive en la casa de su hermana, por que aun esta ahorrando para comprar la suya. Vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos que estan estudiando en colegio. su actividad principal es la venta de ganado en pie en el mercado campesino actividad que la viene desarrollando desde hace 3 años y con la cual mantiene a su familia. El credito invertira en la compra de una vaca que le ofrecieron de oferta.
texts.en:
Moisés, a long-time institution client, lives with his wife and two children, who are high school students, in his sister's house because he is still saving up to buy his own house. To support his family, he sells live cattle in the farmer's market; he has done this for the past 3 years. He will use these funds to buy a cow which was offered to him at a reduced sale price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng K., 29, and her husband, Mr. Phally Chlam, 47, live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 1 year and just have a young daughter.

Sokheng has been a silk weaver for five years, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband raises chickens at home.

Sokheng is requesting her first loan of US$200 to buy silk materials for her weaving business and to help provide capital for her husband to raise chickens.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and capital for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Sinath Noeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province make up the Mrs. Sinath N. Village Bank, and all thirteen members will use their loans for different purposes.  Mrs. Sinath N. was selected by the members to be their village bank president.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.  She has not been able to earn enough fR. her farming to support her entire family.  In order to increase her income, Mrs. Sinath N. decided to ask for a loan, which she will combine with her savings so she can buy more land on which she can cultivate rice.  Her husband, Mr. Keng Savuth, is a soldier who earns a small salary.  Mrs. Sinath N. is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more land for cultivating rice

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: 28-year old Nelfa L. owns a sari-sari store in Dauis, Panglao.  She is the mother of two children, the eldest is seven years old.  Her store helps sustain the daily needs of her family.  She wants to improve her business but needs additional capital in order to achieve this.  She’s now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help finance her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel L., 30 years-old, is a rice farmer in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato Minadanao.  She has  been helping her husband till their farm to be able to have an abundant harvest. From her one hectare farm, she easily earns Php 45,000 worth of grains, which she utilizes to support their daily needs. 
She needs additional capital to grow her business. The loan will help her fund her farm and buy the farming necessities to grow the harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm equipment.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is 53 years-old and is married to Teodorico G. who works as a farmer. The couple is blessed with six children. Roderick and Heherson are both tricycle drivers; Mary Jane is a full time house wife; Larry is a family driver; Wilbert and Laricbertson are fourth year high school students. Their family resides at the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is near Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela.

She is engaged in farming and vending of vegetables in their village. She sells her products every week at the public market in Cabatuan, Isabela. Her weekly net income is Php 3,000. She desires a loan from Kiva lenders of Php 12,000 which she will use to purchase more fertilizers for her vegetable plantation and also to buy additional products to sell. According to her, we should have patience in order to have bountiful profits.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Bolivia está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. Pampahasi Central, que están ubicados alrededor D. la Institución Emprender, las socias se dedican a la venta D. Comida, Víveres, pan, Cerveza, Abarrotes, Confección D. polleras, venta D. pescado , venta D. ropa, Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 9 ciclos se reestructuro en un 40% D. las socias
Maria Corina  es la líder y presidenta del banco, es una D. las fundadoras del banco, teniendo en cuenta que el banco ya tiene como antigüedad 9 ciclos, la socia se dedica a la confección D. polleras. Durante su permanencia, en el banco comunal ha aprendido a ser una líder responsable con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a la hora D. pago, amigable, alegre, respetuosa con sus compañeras; con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en su taller D. esta manera aumentar sus ingresos  familiares.
Yolandae es  la Tesorera del Banco es una D. las fundadoras que dio origen a la conformación del banco Bolivia se dedica a la venta D. pescado, en ferias, no contaba con capital para su actividad económica, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá comprar  mas mercadería y así aumentar su capital y su estabilidad económica.
Nadia Erika  Socia nueva que se integra a la banca bastante dinámica, alegre, es la secretaria del Banco, actualmente la señora tiene una tienda D. barrio, el crédito lo invertirá en el aumento D. capital D. su tienda, como también comprara materia prima para la confección D. polleras
texts.en:
The communal Bolivian bank is maD. up of 10 clients who are from the Central Pampahasi zone, that are part of the Emprender Institution. The members work in the sale of food, provisions, bread, beer, groceries, shawls, fish, and clothing. During her tenure in Emprender, which has lasted for 9 cycles, there was a 40% restructuring of the bank’s membership. Maria Corina has been the head and president of the bank, and one of its founders. She works making shawls. During the time she has been in the communal bank she has learned how to be a responsible leader with the others. She is strict with their payments when the time comes, friendly, cheerful and respectful of them. With the loan she has been able to increase the capital in her shop to improve the family income. Yolanda is the bank’s treasurer and one of the bank’s founders. She sells fish at markets. She didn’t have any capital at the beginning but she is now asking for a loan so that she can buy more merchandise and thus increase her capital and her economic stability. Nadia Erika is a new member who has joined the bank. She is a dynamic and friendly person, and is the bank’s secretary. Currently this lady has a neighborhood store. She will invest the money to increase the store’s capital as well as to buy the supplies to make the shawls.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Diana Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Diana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Diana, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Diana, 28, lives with her life partner and her son who still depend on her and are studying. She is a member of the “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda” communal bank, which is located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martin province, San Martin department. She has been involved in this activity for many years offering urban mobility in her mototaxi. Her husband drives it through different parts of the city. She began with an initial loan from Manuela Ramos and little-by-little was able to save some money to buy replacement parts and improve the service for the community residents. With this 2,000 new sol loan she will buy parts and oils such as: lubricants, circuit boxes, spark plugs to offer a better service to the customers. Today, she is an independent woman who, together with her husband, makes administrative decisions regarding their business. Diana tells us that belonging to a women's group has helped her to better know her rights and, together, to see that they are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for her mototaxi to improve service.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, 35 years old, has been married for eleven years now. Their marriage is blessed with two children, namely: Judy Ann, 11 years old, who is staying at her grandparents at Sillawit, Cauayan City; and Gino Paulo, 7 years old who lives with them. The family resides in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela.

Erlinda operates a typical village store that serves as her source of income. Her weekly net income is Php 300. Due to inadequate income, she decided to obtain a loan of Php 9,000 from Kiva lenders which she will use it to purchase some grocery items to sell in their village.

With the loan, Erlinda will be able to increase her income and support the schooling of her children because, according to her, she wants her children to have a good education in order to have a better future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Jenry

texts.en:
Jenry L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 30 years old and is single. Jenry owns and operates a specialized "homay" retail store, buying and selling animal feed and rice in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jenry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animal feed products and rice to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice and animal feed products to sell

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Mrs. Glory V., 46 years old, owns a variety store located at Victoria, Aurora Isabela. She is married to Floriano who is already 49 years old but still strong and very determined to harvest more yield on their small farm lot. The couple is blessed with three children: Gemma, Michelle and Floriano Jr. Only the youngest is still studying; the other two are already working.
Glory’s business is very important to her, especially when her two children were still studying. She is thankful because even though her only source of income was selling of goods, she was able to support the education of her children, especially their daily allowances. She just hopes that her youngest child will also graduate with a college degree. With her desire to earn a higher income, she decided to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP6,000 as her additional business capital. She shared that the more commodities she sells means a lot of income, thus she is really hoping that lenders will approve her request.

loans.use: Additional capital for her variety store business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is a patient and kindhearted mother. She has been engaged in a retail store business for almost three years now. Her weekly net income is PHP 300. But her income is insufficient for providing the needs of her family and that's why she is requesting her fourth cycle loan of PHP 10,000 from some generous KIVA lenders. She will use it to purchase grocery items to sell. She wants to strengthen her business to maintain their good living conditions.
She is married to Alejandro P., a farmer, and they have only one child named Chris, 31, who is a college graduate. There are four family members living together in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is near the national highway and rice farm.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis es un joven muy jovial de 21 años que vive en la casa de sus padres.
A pesar de su juventud él sabe usar muy bien su tiempo, ya que desde las 8 de la mañana trabaja en sus cultivos de café, los cuales sembró cuando tenía 18 años en las chacras que sus padres que le cedieron; pero también apoya a sus padres con sus chacras de plátanos, ya que esos cultivos le recuerdan una bonita infancia. 
Denis quiere tener una economía independiente a la de su padre, por ello que quiere realizar otro vivero de café en un espacio del terreno de sus padres, y de ese modo vender una cierta cantidad de plantitas de café y la otra parte trasplantarlas a su chacra.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y pese a ser el menor de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, es quien pone el orden, pues es el fiscal de grupo, además de ser el primero en llegar a cada reunión. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar semillas de café para realizar su vivero, así como fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Denis is a cheerful, 21-year-old, young man who lives with his parents. Despite his youth, he knows how to use his time very well since he works his coffee plantings, which he planted when he was 18 years old, from 8 in the morning. He planted them in a farm his parents gave him but he also helps his parents with their banana plantings since those crops remind him of a happy childhood. Denis wants to be economically independent from his father and that's why he wants to set up another coffee plant nursery on a space available on his parents' farm. He would like to then sell some of his plants and transplant the others to his farm. This is his second loan with MFP and, despite his being the youngest member of his communal bank, it is he who sees that the rules are obeyed for he is the group's sargeant at arms and the first one to arrive at each meeting. With the funds requested he will buy coffee seeds and chemical fertilizers to set up his nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Pho Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who are all living in Damnak Rovieng village in Takeo province make up the village bank group. Mrs. Navy P. is the president who has been selected by the members of the village bank group and they all will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She is 45 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband, Mr. Nan Sokha, owns a loudspeaker which has been hired by the villagers for use during festivals and weddings. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Navy P. decided to request a loan to buy more loudspeakers.

loans.use: to buy more loudspeakers

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una mujer muy responsable de 36 años, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su pareja en su casa propia.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa. Adicionalmente, prepara comida a pedido o cuando es tiempo de cosecha de café y llegan varios jornaleros para trabajar en las chacras.
La mayor cantidad de tiempo la pasa en su bodega, atiende todos los días, a partir de las 6 de la mañana ya está barriendo el perímetro de su casa para que su tienda luzca muy atractiva. 
Esta actividad le agrada muchísimo, pues no es difícil, ya que conversa con sus clientes, se mantiene entretenida y de paso va captando las ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, y eso la hace muy feliz.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y en su banco comunal es una eficiente y muy responsable tesorera, que cumple a la cabalidad su función.El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de comestibles para su bodega, y con la otra adquirirá fertilizantes para sus cultivos de su esposo.
texts.en:
Elva, 36, has 4 children and lives with her partner in their own house. For the past 15 years she has sold food items from a small store she set up in her home. Additionally, she prepares food to order or, during coffee harvest time, when many day workers come to work the farms. She spends most of her time in her store which is open every day. From 6am on you can find her sweeping the perimeter of her house so that her store will look more attractive. She likes her work very much for it isn't particularly difficult and she can chat with her customers, who keep her entertained and, incidentally, provide her with earnings enough to meet her home's expenses; that makes her very happy. This is her second loan with MFP and she is the treasurer of her communal bank, a task she carries out efficiently and responsibly. The money she is asking for now will be used to stock her store with food items and the other part to buy fertilizers for her husband's crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Camino A  La Luz Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Camino a L. Luz está formado por 12 clientes, pertenecen a las Zonas D. Pampahasi y San Antonio, están ubicados alrededor D. L. Sub alcaldia  D. alto San Antonio, las socias se dedican a L. confección D. chamarras, venta D. Cosméticos repostería es su primer ciclo en L. institución.
Arturo es uno D. los socios que conformo el banco D. emprendimiento, líder y presidente del banco es uno D. los socios que ya trabajo en bancas comunales con L. institución, en su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser uno D. los socios  responsables con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a L. hora D. pago, amigable, alegre. Actualmente se dedica a L. confección D. chamarras el préstamo que se le ha otorgado a podido aumentar su capital en L. compra D. materia prima
Cristina es L. Tesorera del Banco, es una D. las fundadoras que dio origen a L. conformación del banco Camino a L. luz; se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. soya en ferias, fiestas y en diversas actividades sociales que se presentan, no contaba con capital para emprender su propio negocio, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  elL. podrá comprar  materia prima para  aumentar su capital en su negocio. Es muy exigente con sus compañeras y estricta en L. puntualidad.
Veroska Vanesa Socia bastante dinámica, alegre, es L. secretaria del Banco, durante su formación en el banco siempre se encuentra animando a sus compañeras, a seguir adelante, actualmente se dedica a L. venta D. cosméticos, el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para L. compra D. cosméticos.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en el aumento D. mercadería, por L. cantidad D. pedidos que tiene, durante este fin D. año.
texts.en:
The Camino a L. Luz (Path to the Light) Community Bank consists of 12 members from the Pampahasi and San Antonio regions. The members have maD. a living making jackets, and selling cosmetics and pastries through their first loan cycle. Arturo is the leader and president of the group because he has worked with other community banks and has learned to be a responsible group member, getting his fellow members to pay on time happily and amicably. Currently he makes a living making jackets. He plans to use the loan to increase his capital so he can purchase the raw materials he needs to make his products. Cristina is the group's treasurer and one of its founders. She makes a living selling soy products at markets, festivals and other social gatherings that present themselves. She did not have the funds to start her own business (why she joined the community bank) and plans to use this loan to purchase the supplies to increase the flow of capital for her business. As treasurer, she is very demanding of the other group members and strict with their punctuality. Veroska Vanessa is a rather dynamic and happy member and is the secretary of the community bank. While the bank was forming she was always encouraging her fellow members to keep making headway. Currently she makes a living selling cosmetics. She plans to use the loan to purchase more beauty supplies so she can increase her inventory for the increase in demand during the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Heydy

texts.es:
Heydy es una joven soltera de 23 años, es la mayor de todos sus hermanos y vive en la casa de sus padres.
Sus anhelos son de ser una profesional, por  lo que desde el año pasado empezó a estudiar la carrera técnica de secretariado ejecutivo en un instituto de su ciudad. Desde entonces cambio su labor agrícola por las aulas; pero los fines de semana, con el apoyo invalorable de su padre muy temprano por la mañana, ya está instalada en su chacra quitando las malezas y abonando sus plantas de café, que es el producto de su preferencia por ser muy rentable y le permiten acumular dinero rápidamente en las meses de mayo a julio.
 Mientras tanto, su madre la apoya con su la alimentación, por ello sus ganancias las comparte con sus padres y además ahorra para cubrir los gastos de su educación.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo demostró desprendimiento y entrega para su banco comunal, ya que se colabora redactando en el libro de actas de la junta directiva y apoya en los cobros a la tesorera. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y fungicidas para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Heydy is a single young woman who is 23 years of age. She is the oldest of all her siblings and lives at home with her parents.

Heydy hopes to become a professional. Last year she began studying for a technical degree at an executive secretarial school in the city. During the week, she transitions from farm work to her work in the classroom. On the weekends, Heydy provides invaluable support to her father. Early the morning, she establishes herself in the fields in order to pull weeds and fertilize the coffee plants. Coffee is the preferred crop because it is very profitable. A coffee farmer can accumulate money very quickly during the months of May through July. Meanwhile, her mother supports her by providing meals, so Heyde shares in the profits with her parents and also saves enough money to cover her educational expenses.

This is her second loan with MFP. During her time as a member, Heydy has demonstrated great generosity and dedication to her Communal Bank. She is in charge of taking minutes at all of the meetings and assisting the treasurer with the collection of receipts. The money she requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers and fungicides for her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & fungicides

loans.name: Anna Grace

texts.en:
Anna Grace D. is a 30-year-old mother who lives in a village located at Barangay Bangar, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband is Mr. Romar D. and they are gifted with two children named Russel D. and Raven D.. Being a parent, they are so concerned with the future of their children. Hence, they sacrifice their time and endure hardships and difficulties to earn a living and support the education of their children. 
Her husband works as a security guard in a Globe cell site located in their village while Anna Grace is engaged in selling frozen foods like hotdogs, tocino, chicken meat and fish. She acquires her products from Solano Public Market and sells them to their village. Through her patience and sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP1,000 per month, which she uses to acquire their daily basic needs and finance the schooling of their children. She wants to sell more frozen foods but she has a small amount of capital. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000 to be used in acquiring additional items to sell. She is so happy with this financial assistance because she is able to improve her small business. She hopes that someday she can improve their status of living and give their children a better future.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, en su casa propia.
Sus anhelos son de prosperar mediante sus cultivos de café y plátanos, por lo que trabaja todos los días, desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde quitando las malezas y las malas hierbas de la tierra, contando con el apoyo de su esposa para estas tareas.
Adicionalmente, trabaja como jornalero en otras chacras, empezando su trabajo a las 8 de la mañana y le pagan al día la suma de 15 soles, incluido almuerzo. 
De esta manera José ha empezado a sostener a su familia, la cual acaba de formar, por lo que tiene muchas esperanzas de comprase sus propias tierras en el  futuro, pues de ese modo asegurará la estabilidad de su economía.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y durante su crédito anterior demostró mucha responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old. He lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of their only child.

His aspirations are to prosper through his coffee and banana crops. He works every day from 6am until 5pm removing weeds and thickets from the soil. His wife helps him with these tasks. In addition, José works as a laborer on other farms. He starts that job at 8am and gets paid 15 soles, including lunch. Through these activities, José is able to support his family which is just now developing. He has high hopes of acquiring his own land in the future as a means of ensuring his financial stability.

This is his second loan with MFP. On his previous loan, José showed that he was responsible in making his payments. The money he requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeun Sin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S. and her husband, Mr. Keam Sokha, are farmers who own a piece of land and cultivate rice. This couple has six children: one is a construction worker, one is a motorbike taxi driver, another is employed in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school. Now Mrs. Saroeun S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband so he can be a motorbike taxi driver.

Mrs. Saroeun S. is the village bank president. This village bank consists of eleven people from Damnak Rovieng village in Takeo province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. San Sarom, who is the group guarantor, is present in the photo with the village bank members.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una madre soltera D. 27 años, tienen dos hijos, con lo que vive en su casa propia.
Hace dos años se viene dedicando a L. venta D. golosinas en su casa, prefiere vender estos productos porque son D. menor inversión y obtiene mayores ganancias en comparación con los abarrotes.
Durante este tiempo ha venido captando clienteL., y hoy en día su negocio es muy concurrido, especialmente por los jóvenes. María atienD., D. preferencia, desD. las 3 D. L. tarD. hasta 9 D. L. noche, por ser las horas D. mayor demanda, y por las mañanas aprovecha D. trabajar en sus cultivos D. plátanos. 
Gracias a estas actividades, obtiene los recursos necesarios y no tiene que solicitarle dinero al padre D. sus hijos. Para el futuro quiere crecer en su negocio logrando que sea más granD. y pueda ofrecer diversidad D. golosinas y dulces.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donD. reitera su compromiso D. puntualidad en sus pagos D. cada mes. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una variedad D. galletas y otras golosinas; también adquirirá fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María is a 27 year old single mother with two children. She lives in her own home.

María has been selling candy from her house for 2 years. She prefers these products because they require less investment and the profits are higher in comparison to selling groceries. Throughout this time she has been attracting customers, and now her business is very popular, especially among teenagers. María operates her business from 3pm in the afternoon until 9pm at night since these are the hours when she experiences the most demand. In the mornings, she tends to her banana crops.

Through these activities, María obtains sufficient income and has not had to seek support from the father of her children. In the future, she wants to expand her business by offering a variety of candies and sweets.

This is her second loan with MFP. María renews her commitment to making her payments on time each month. The money she requested will be used to purchase a variety of cookies and other sweets. She will also buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets to sell & fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú es una joven madre que vive con su pareja y su bebé. Anteriormente de dedicaba netamente al cultivo de café y plátanos con el apoyo de sus padres, pero desde que tuvo su bebé, su esposo no quiere que trabaje, por lo menos hasta que crezca su pequeño. Por ello, decidieron tener un negocio de la venta de abarrotes, y desde el año pasado se dedica a su tienda. Marilú está muy contenta con su negocio, ya que se distrae mucho con la gente, solo que a veces se incomoda de no tener la suficiente mercadería para sus clientes. Su deseo a futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo se mostró muy responsable y entregada a las labores de su banco comunal y para este ciclo promete seguir haciéndolo así. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de comestibles de primera necesidad para su bodega, así como también, fertilizantes para los cultivos de su esposo.
texts.en:
Marilú is a young mother who lives with her common law partner and her baby. She previously devoted herself to growing coffee and bananas with the support of her parents. After she had her baby, her husband did not want her to work until their child grew a little older. For this reason, they decided to start a business selling groceries. A year has passed since they opened their store. Marilú is very happy with her business since it attracts many people. Sometimes she gets uncomfortable whenever she does not have enough merchandise for her customers. Her desire for the future is to grow her business so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her second loan with MFP. All this time, Marilú has been very responsible and dedicated to the work of her Communal Bank. She renews her commitment for this loan cycle. The money she requested will be used to purchase grocery staples for her store as well as fertilizers for her husband’s crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store & fertilizers for her husband's crops

loans.name: Mrs. Oeurn Suong Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for twelve people who all live in Damnak Rovieng village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Mrs. Oeurn S. has been selected as the village bank president by the members. She is a Khmer noodle seller. Her husband, Mr. Khuy Sao, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a construction worker. Now Mrs. Oeurn S. has decided to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
Zenón es un padre muy abnegado, tiene 55 años y vive con su esposa y su único hijo.
Él se dedica al cuidado y labrado de sus chacras de piñas, café y plátanos, actividad que realiza sin dificultad alguna y solo, ya que su esposa tiene que dedicarse a su hijo pequeño. El producto que requiere de más trabajo es la piña, pero también al lapso de los 9 meses ya le permite captar dinero. 
En el caso del café, es muy rentable, pero también es de mayor inversión y se tiene que esperar cerca de tres años para su cosecha, es por ello que últimamente no ha sembrado mucho este producto, pero ahora que tiene su hijo quiere retomarlo para brindarle todas las comodidades necesarias.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy agradecido, ya que nunca antes había contando con un crédito, por ello paga puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de semillas de café para hacer un vivero, y  también adquirirá fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Zenón is a very self-sacrificing father. He is 55, and he lives with his wife and his only child. He cares for and works his pineapple, coffee, and banana fields. He does this alone with no difficulty. His wife has to devote herself to taking care of their small child. The product that requires more work is the pineapple. But, after nine months he is able to get money. Regarding the coffee, it is very profitable. But, it is also a greater investment. You need to wait close to three years for the harvest. That is why he has not planted much of this product lately. Now that he has his child, he wants to return to it so that he can give his child all of the necessary comforts. This is his second loan with MFP, for which he is very grateful. He had never had a loan before. He makes all of his payments punctually. The money he is requesting is to buy coffee seeds to make a nursery. He will also get chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Karren

texts.en:
At the age of 31, Karren is engaged in managing a retail store in their village. She also manages a poultry business. Her weekly net income is PHP 500.00. Due to some creditors, unfortunately, her retail store was not successful and she decided to close it and look for another business to start. After two years, she decided to re-open her store and that's why she would like a loan of Php 4,000. She will use it to purchase some grocery items to sell. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan in order to continue her business and to earn an income to support her family.
Karren and her husband are blessed with three children: Justin, five years old; Bejie, four years old; and John Rence, three years old. Their family resides in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near the Elementary School.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Ang T., 42 years old, is a motorcycle taxi driver from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He runs his business along the streets in and around the city and he typically earns an average of $5 a day to help cover his family’s expenses. Another source of family income is from his wife’s business. She is in the picture. She rents a medium size flat where there is an attractive place where she sells coffee and other soft drinks, earning $10 per day. She has just started her business and she needs more capital to improve the business. Ang T. requested a loan for his wife to use to sustain the growth of her business. This couple has a school-aged kid who lives with them at home.

loans.use: Capital to improve the business

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en: Mrs. Sinan P. lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice for a living. She faces an obstacle with her plantation because her field is infertile. It is affecting her crop. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the money to purchase a water machine to water the field. Her husband, Mr. Phan Kim, is a rice seller. Mrs. Sinan P. is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study (they are 2 and 4 years old).

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a machine to water the field

loans.name: Luciana Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LUCIANA está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio, que están ubicados alrededor del mercado Modelo, las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, arreglos para eventos sociales, venta D. víveres, procuradora D. cosméticos, tratamientos estéticos, repostería primer ciclo en la institución, siendo que las socias en un 50 % no tiene créditos.
Maria Elizabeth es la líder y presidente del banco,  socia fundadora que conformo el banco D. emprendimiento; en su banco  ha aprendido a ser  responsable y solidaria con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a la hora D. pago. Actualmente se dedica a la repostería siendo que no cuenta con créditos o prestamos en otras instituciones el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. sus productos, pasteles, galletas, tortas. 
Pamela, la señora es la Tesorera del Banco es una D. las fundadoras que dio origen a la conformación del banco LUCIANA se dedica a la venta D. ropa y venta D. cosméticos no contaba con capital para emprender su propio negocio, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá adquirir mercadería para  aumentar sus ingresos económicos familiares 
Soledad, es una Socia exigente es la secretaria del Banco, durante su preparación en el Banco demostró ser una líder mas del Banco D. Emprendimiento Luciana actualmente se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para la compra D. cosméticos.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en el aumento D. mercadería, por la cantidad D. pedidos que tiene, durante este fin D. año.
texts.en:
The Luciana Community Bank is maD. up of 10 clients who belong to the San Antonio region, and are located around the Modelo market. The members are dedicated to selling food, party planning, cosmetics, beauty treatments, and confectionary. This is their first cycle with the institution since 50% of the members have not received loans. Maria Elizabeth is the leader and president of the bank. She is a founding member who formed the entrepreneurial bank. In her bank, she has learned to be responsible and united with her colleagues. She is strict with her colleagues about paying on time. Currently, she is dedicated to confectionary. Since she has no loans with other institutions, she will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients to make her products, including cakes, cookies and pies. Pamela is the treasurer of the bank and is one of the founders who established the Luciana bank. She is dedicated to selling clothing and cosmetics. She did not have the money to start her own business. Nevertheless, now, with the loan that she will be granted, she will be able to acquire merchandise to increase her economic income. Soledad is a demanding member and is the secretary of the bank. While preparing for the bank, she proved to be a leader. Currently, Luciana is dedicated to selling cosmetics. She needs the loan to buy cosmetics.She will invest the loan in expanding her merchandise to meet the quantity of orders that she has at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An increase in capital

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng T. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this, she is also a chicken breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is a widow with three children, two of whom are chicken sellers. The other is married and lives separately.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken food for breeding.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Empredimiento LAS CHASQUIS trabaja en nuestra Institución desD. el año 1997, es un banco que se caracteriza porque la mayoria D. las socias son antiguas,además en este tiempo han  logrado consolidarse como grupo y establecer lazos D. amistad.  Lidia es una D. las fundadoras y presidenta del Banco, ella se dedica a la panaderia, con el prestamo a logrado poder abastecerse D. los principales insumos para realizar su actividad, logrando comprar por mayor harina, azucar, manteca y levadura, posibilitando D. esta manera que el alza D. precios no la perjudique. La Sra. Lidia se constituye en jefe D. hogar, ya que se encuentra separada D. su esposo, con el aumento y deversificación D. sus productos a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y tambien sus pedidos. Esther vive en una zona popular D. la ciudad D. La Paz, tiene una familia numerosa, la socia es una participante antigua del Banco y actualmente esta como tesorera,la Sra. Calderón se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan por su domicilio, con el prestamo a logrado comprar por quintales  harina, esto a posibilitado que pueda aumentar su producción mejorando D. esta forma su calidad D. vida. Daniela es una participante muy joven, pero una D. las fundadoras del grupo actualmente ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, ella trabaja en la venta D. productos D. belleza, con el prestamo a logrado comprar en cantidad y en oferta perfumes, desodorantes,talcos y joyeria, lo que permitirá que pueda ahorrar para seguir estudiando y terminar la Universidad.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank, Las Chasquis, has worked with our institution since 1997. It is a bank characterized by the fact that the majority of its members are old. Additionally, in this time, they have achieved to consolidate themselves as a group and establish bonds of friendship. Lidia is one of the founders and is the president of the bank. She is dedicated to selling bread. With the loan, she has been able to supply herself with the main needs to perform her activity, being able to buy flour, sugar, butter, and yeast, at wholesale, thereby ensuring that rising prices don't damage her. Lidia is head of her household since she is separated from her husband. Through expansion and diversification of her products, she has managed to improve her income and also her orders. Esther lives in a popular area of the city of La Paz. She has a large family. She is an old participant in the bank and currently is the treasurer. Mrs. Calderón is dedicated to making and selling bread from her home. With the loan she can buy flour per hundredweight. This enables her to increase her production thereby improving her quality of life. Daniela is a young participant, but one of the founders of the group. Currently, she occupies the job of secretary. She works selling beauty products. With the loan, she will buy perfumes, deodorants, talcs, and jewelry in bulk and at discount which will allow her to save so she may pursue her education and finish university.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan will serve to purchase merchandise and increase capital.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora P. is 40 years old and she is married to Rolando, who works as a farmer. The couple resides in the small village of Calaocan. They are blessed with five children, four of whom are already married.
Leonora has been engaged in the hog raising business for almost a year. She also sells vegetables and other commodities in their village. Leonora is requesting a loan of Php 7,000, which she will use to purchase some hog feed, and some young piglets to raise. She hopes that her loan request will be granted because this business is the only source of income they have at the moment and is very helpful to their family.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Ofelia Felipa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA OFELIA, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA A MEDIO USO YA HACE TRES AÑOS, ELLA ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO Y TIENE TRES HIJOS, LA MAYOR ESTA EN LA ARGENTINA TRABAJANDO, EL HIJO DEL MEDIO VIVE CON ELLA PERO TRABAJA Y ES INDEPENDIENTE, LA MENOR DE LAS HIJAS TIENE 9 AÑOS Y ES QUIEN LE LLENA DE ALEGRIA Y LE IMPULSA A SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON MUCHO ENTUSIASMO, ADEMAS DE LA VENTA DE ROPA LA SEÑORA TAMBIEN VENDE REFRESCO CUANDO HAY PARTIDOS DE FUTBOL EN EL ESTADIO PRINCIPAL DE NUESTRA CIUDAD, Y VENDE JUGUETES EN FERIAS DE FIN DE AÑO EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD, VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR CON CINCO DE SUS HERMANOS, LA CASA ES AMPLIA Y SE LLEVA BIEN CON SUS DEMAS HERMANOS.
texts.en:
Ofelia has been selling used clothing for three years. She is separated from her husband and has three children. The oldest child is working in Argentina. The middle child lives with her but works and is independent. The youngest child is 9 years old, fills her with joy and serves as her motivation to continue working enthusiastically. Besides selling clothes, Ofelia also sells soft drinks when there are soccer games in the city's main stadium and sells toys at year-end fairs in the city's downtown area. She lives in a big family home with five of her siblings and she gets along well with them.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie C. is  49 years old. She is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo Isabela, Cagayan. She is married to Michael, 48 years old, who manages their hog farm. Farming is the major source of income of  most of the residents in their village. The couple are blessed with three children and all of them are studying.

Connie has been raising pigs for eight years. She started  the  business to assist her husband in providing for the daily needs of their family and also to send their children to school. She wants her children to receive a college education. For this reason, Connie and husband are working hard for their future. Sometimes, her children help her in caring for the hogs, especially on weekends. 

Connie believes that with cooperation and patience, a lot of improvement will happen to their business. In this regard, Connie is asking for additional business capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to Php5,000. She intends to use the loan to buy a sufficient supply of feed for her hogs.

loans.use: For additional capital to purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Franklin Elio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANKLIN, SE SEPARO DE SU ESPOSA HACE UN PAR DE AÑOS ATRÁS TIENE 2 HIJOS QUIENES ESTAN AL CUIDADO DE SU MAMÁ, A UN PRINCIPIO EL COLABORABA EN EL NEGOCIO A SU MADRE QUIEN TIENE LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, YA CON EL PASAR DE LOS AÑOS EL DECIDE INDEPENDISARSE Y EMPRENDER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO, ES ASI COMO LLEGA A NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN, SIENDO EMPRENDER EL LUGAR DE DONDE SACO SU PRIMER CREDITO DEBIDO A LA CONFIANZA Y A LO BIEN QUE LE VA EL SOLICITA RENOVAR SU CREDITO, ES UNA PERSONA JOVEN QUIEN TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERARSE Y ESPERA A UN FUTURO TENER UN NEGOCIO MAS AMPLIO DEL QUE TIENE AHORA PARA SOLVENTAR A SUS HIJOS QUE SON MENORES DE EDAD Y SON EL IMPULSO PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Franklin separated from his wife a few years ago. He has 2 children who are in the care of their mom. Originally, he worked together in the same business as his mother. Over the years, he has decided to become independent and start his own business. Thus, he comes to our institution, with Emprender being the place where he took out his first loan. Due to familiarity and how well it's going for him, he is requesting a loan renewal. He is a young man who has the desire to overcome challenges and hope for a future in which he would have a business that has expanded beyond what he currently has in order to provide for his children who are minors and are his reason for carrying on.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will invest in the purchase of motors and accessories.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey Y., age 52, is married with four children, two of whom are married and  two are attending school. She is a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling  machine inside her home. She provides a rice milling  service to her neighbors. She also buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill, and she sells her finished rice to people for income. Her husband works with her in the business. Usually Srey generates around $5 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. This rice harvesting season Srey Y. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice

loans.name: Simeur

texts.en: Mrs. Simeur N. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Choy Tech Nich, is a laborer who can make a small income. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Simeur N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Simeur N. is the mother of five children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita C. is 47 years old and a hog raiser in the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is married to Hilario and blessed with eight school-age children.  Julita hopes that their children will finish their college education. Despite the difficulties of life, the couple is striving to improve their living conditions. Julita is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php6,000. She plans to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs with the additional business capital the loan will bring.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Nercy

texts.es: La Sra.  Nercy vive en la localidad de la Guardia, distante de El Torno unos 25 Kms. Su actividad principal es la carpintería, la cual la administra; su esposo atiende la parte operativa de la carpinteria. La Sra. muy pronto instalara su taller de costura, pero mientras tanto colabora con el esposo  en la manutencion de la familia de 4 hijos. El credito invertira en la construccion de un galpon donde colococara su maquinaria.
texts.en:
Nercy lives in La Guardia, which is about 25 km from El Torno. The main activity that she manages is carpentry; her husband tends to the operational part of their carpentry business. Nercy will very soon set up her sewing workshop, but in the meantime she and her husband are concentrating on providing for their family of 4 children. She will invest the loan in building a shed where she will put her machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a shed.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na Y. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a cow breeder. Since her breeding cow business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing three more cows for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Yeong Sareourn, helps her in her business. Mrs. Na Y. has three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy three more cows

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S. N. is 37 years of age and a married woman. Her husband works as a construction foreman for a small firm. They have two young children who attend school. Mao S. N. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has been doing this for twenty years and earns approximately $3 per day.  Mao S. N. hopes to expand her business and is applying for a US$900 loan to be used to buy a larger number of grocery items to sell. This will allow her to increase her income to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sineu

texts.en: Mrs. Sineu P. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sambo, is a motorbike taxidriver. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his motorbike is old and he spends a lot of money on fuel, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to change his motorbike for his business. Mrs. Sineu P. has three children who are attending the local school. Her husband appears on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To change his motorbike for his business

loans.name: 16.01.02 Đông Hải Group

texts.en: Hoan Lê Thị (1) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Đông Hải (16.01.02 Đông Hải). Hoan is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. In 2004, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hoan is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 7th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị Việt (28) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 2. Đỗ Thị Huyền (30) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 3. Lê Thị Hương (34) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 4. N. Thị Dung (31) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 5. Lê Thị Y (14) is a 60-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hoan Lê Thị (1) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Đông Hải (16,01,02 Đông Hải). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2004, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Việt (28) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 2. Đỗ Thị Huyền (30) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 3. Lê Thị Hương (34) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 4. N. Thị Dung (31) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 5. Lê Thị Y (14) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Deurng

texts.en:
Mrs. Deurng P. is a villager in Ta Saom village in Takeo province. She is married with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The other two are attending the local school; the youngest is too young to work or study. She owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice.

Her husband, Mr. Puth Teng, is a construction worker (he is on the right in the photo). Since his work site is far from home, it costs a lot to take a motorbike taxi to work. In order to reduce expenses, Deurng is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina D.'s main source of income comes from managing an eatery, making and selling food products and different viands, in her community. She is 63 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. Marina has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey T. is a villager in Krabei Prey village in Takeo province. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Taem Rom, is a construction worker and he is shown on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Srey T. is a rice seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle L. is happily married to Muslemia. They are blessed with five loving children, namely: Jhonn Mark (7 years old, elementary student), Jhonna Rose (6 years old, pre-school pupil), Ashley Joie (5 years of age), Jasmine Rose (3 years old), and Michelle Anne (one year old). They are harmoniously living in the village of Nagassican, Santiago City.

Michelle aims to improve their way of living by expanding her business, but she says that she needs financial support for this. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. This money will be a great help in the fulfillment of her dreams in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. runs a food stall selling specialty food products in her community. She is 47 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Iligan City. Norma has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Norma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita owns and manages a general store in her village. From this business, she earns a net of Php 6,000 monthly which is a big help to her family. For additional income, she sometimes sells vegetables which she gathers from her vegetable garden.

Angelita is borrowing Php 8,000 for the development of her business, hoping to have additional revolving capital for her general store. The loan will let her business grow and earn more income. She hopes that her loan request will be approved because she plans to purchase stocks of soft drinks and other merchandise that her valued customers may need.

Angelita is the mother of three children: her eldest just graduated from a short term course and her other two children are still studying and she hopes that they will also be able to finish their studies. Angelita is married to Rolando who works as a cook in a restaurant. Together, they help each other to provide for the needs of their children.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of soft drinks and other merchandise

loans.name: Janela

texts.en: Janela B. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Janela owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Janela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Janela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juvylin

texts.en:
Juvylin M. is involved in a direct-selling business where she sells products of Avon, Natasha, and MSE. She sells through a door-to-door basis with her brochure and little items of personal products.

Juvylin hopes to bring with her more products of Avon, Natasha and MSE to sell to her loyal customers. According to her, she needs additional revolving capital for her retailing business. She hopes to obtain a loan of Php 7,000 for her to purchase more items. Her loan will be of great help in making her business more profitable and that’s why she really hopes for its approval.

Juvylin is 34 years old and is married to Franeo who has been working as a taxi driver in Manila for eight years so they’ve been away from each other for the welfare of their children. Engaging in a retailing business is her own way to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children.

Juvylin believes that through their hard work and sacrifices they can achieve their goals in life.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza has a general store located in the village of Ballacong, Ilagan, Isabela, where her family also lives.

Flordeliza has been engaged in her retailing business since 2000 and according to her it is somehow improving. She hopes to maintain and expand her business further to earn more income for her family. She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to retail vegetables for additional profit. The loan she is requesting will be of big help for the expansion of her retailing business.

Flordeliza is a businesswoman already 51 years old. She is married to Pedro who works in a government agency. Most of their children are school-aged and, for this reason, the couple works hard to sustain their children’s educational needs and the other needs of their family. Uplifting their living conditions is one of Flordeliza’s goals.

loans.use: To retail vegetables for additional profit

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo C. would like a loan amounting to Php5,000 for additional capital for his food vending business. He works in the food retailing business where he sells fish and squid balls.

Most of the time his customers are elementary and high school students. That’s why he is able to sell all of his products. He hopes to further expand his business by increasing the types of items he sells. That's why he decided to borrow Php5,000 from KIVA lenders. According to him, he has been engaged in this business for almost a year. He generates Php250 daily, which contributes to their daily needs. His bicycle serves as his partner in vending his products. He wants to improve his business with the help of the loan.

Domingo is married to Ester, a full time housewife. They are blessed with three children; Desiree, Danica, and Daniel Althea. The family is harmoniously residing at the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela, which is one kilometer away from the national highway.

loans.use: Additional items for his food vending business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma B. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Elma owns and operates a business buying and selling specialty food products like longganiza (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Elma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte
