Mahmadsaid, a very hard-working and responsible man, is married, and to move his family ahead, he started his own business 12 years ago, selling groceries in his new neighborhood and taking advantage of the scarcity of shops nearby. Mahmadsaid started by selling a small number of products but now he has an extensive stock and has enlarged the store to take up the whole front of his home. His children have helped out; his family unit has been instrumental in developing and growing his business. The cost of enlarging his store left him unable to afford to keep his business well-stocked, which is why he's requesting a loan of $3000 USD to purchase merchandise. You can help Mahmadsaid meet his need and contribute to the growth of his business. He and his family are sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: God Power Group

texts.en:
Kuku W. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Power. She is 32 years old, married with children aged two and eight, but they are not schooling due to a lack of financial support. Kuku is a second grade drop-out due to poverty, and she started fending for herself through business. She and her family live on the V.P Road, a community that has both middle class and poor Liberians, south of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Kuku has been retailing fresh chickens for 5 years; having established a good relationship with her customers, in order to encourage them to continue buying from her she often extends credit when they face shortages while buying her goods. She needs this loan to purchase more fresh chicken to improve her business, and she dreams of educating her children and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh chicken to improve her business.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en:
B. Tolib is 31 years old. He sells fabric for national dresses. His store is located in the local central market called “Safina”. Tolib has been in his business for 10 years already. In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and wallet, Tolib travels almost every month to the neighboring town to purchase new goods. Tolib has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not fully able to meet the demand. That is why he needs a loan of $800 US.

Your generosity can change his family's life. Tolib wants to expand his business – success will bring a better quality of life for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
B. Haidar is married and has four children. He runs a small business selling rice in the local market. His place is located in the main food market where there are many customers every day. Haidar has been in this business for over 24 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Haidar is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Haidar's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en:
D. Djafar has always been a hardworking man who has made sure from a young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children. Djafar has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff like sweets, bread, soft drinks, juices, preserved food and many others. With starting capital of $100 US, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 15 years ago.

Today, he needs to buy additional foodstuff to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, Djafar is requesting a loan of $800 US. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for increasing his range of goods

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat K. is 32 years old. She is married and has 4 children.

She started her own business 5 years ago because her husband was unemployed at the time. Muhabat sells confections like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income she generates allows Muhabat to support her family. Muhabat dreams of educating all of her children through higher education.

Today, she is requesting 6000 TJS to purchase goods to increase her range of products. She plans to spend the income she generates on the well being of her family as well as her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase goods to offer more types of confections

loans.name: Shahzoda

texts.en:
N. Shahzoda is 54 years old. She is married with three children. Shahzoda's husband does not earn much. In order to help her husband and to support her family, Shahzoda has been running the business for 7 years already. She sells household appliances. All the equipment is imported from neighboring cities. The business generates significant income for the family, allowing improving their living conditions. Today Shahzoda requests a loan of 3000 Somoni. She is going to spend the loan purchasing new household appliances. Receiving loans from IMON since 2006, Shahzoda has shown herself to be a reliable client with a positive credit history.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing household appliances.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and is the happy father of three children. He owns a market vending business located in a busy locale where he sells men's clothing. Nemat decided to start his own business after he was unable to find other work. In addition to his business, he also works part time as a taxi driver, which enables him to supplement his income.

Nemat has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni. He plans to purchase new inventory for his business. Nemat will use the expected profits from his business to improve his standard of living and to do some remodeling to his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working in the fields and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Youth Organize For Peace Group

texts.en:
Ishmael is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Youth Organize for Peace. At age 22, he is a single youth who is a freshman student at the University of Liberia. He believes that building a business can change his life, bringing him from poverty to a better life. Ishmael lives and works in the Westpoint community, a very poor and crowded community close to downtown Monrovia, an area where the crime rate is very high.

Ishmael’s business is tailoring. He buys clothes and sewing materials wholesale, sews items of different designs, and sells these to residents of Westpoint. He has been running this business for six years. He has been involved in tailoring from an early age, and went through many challenges before becoming independent. He can now work independently and he makes his own money.

Ishmael guarantees his attractively designed goods in order to encourage them to continue patronizing his business. As the shop is in a crime-ridden area, sometimes customer goods go missing from the store, and this worries him, as business can suffer as a result. He hopes to increase security. He needs this loan to purchase more cloth so as to increase his offerings and improve business.

Ishmael dreams of giving his family the best support he can offer and to change his own and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth so as to increase his offerings and improve business.

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.en:
D. Muhamadjon is 23 years old. He has been running his business for about two years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is his main source of income. As a rule, Muhamadjon travels to the neighboring city to purchase his goods. His goal is offer a wide range of high-quality goods to meet the requirements of his customers. He hopes to satisfy the needs of a wide base of clients with different levels of income.

Today, Muhamadjon is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,600. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan through IMON. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of goods offered for sale. He has qualified for this loan due to his determination, his experience, and the profitability of his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
F. Mavluda is married with three children. She and her husband have a business selling children's clothing items in the central market of Dushanbe. Mavluda offers a big assortment of inventory and has a flexible discount system for her loyal customers. Mavluda’s business is going well, as demand has been very stable over the last 11 years.

Mavluda is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is hardworking and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she has a natural skill for making people feel feel valued, respected, and heard.

Mavluda is requesting a loan of $1,700 in order to purchase seasonal clothing, which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so that she can help to support herself and her family. Please help this woman of so much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en:
K. Muzafar is 57 years old. He is married with four children. Muzafar has been farming since he was 29 years old, and now he specializes in the cultivation of seedlings. He has gained a great deal of experience working the land for so many years. When it is the season to do so, he willingly works in the field from early morning till late night. Muzafar has a large and friendly family and they all try to help each other.

Muzafar has requested $800 in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. He thanks everyone who supports him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Labour and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a shop and buy supplies

loans.name: Suiun's Group

texts.en:
Suiun, the leader of this group, comes from the rural town of Kant. She has a family consisting of four members, having raised two sons aged twenty three and nineteen respectively. All members of Suiun’s family have different jobs. Suiun’s husband works at the public assistance service of Bishkek city as a leading specialist; her eldest son works in a furniture salon “Shatura” as a furniture maker; her other son works as a waiter in a café and is enrolled in college – he is getting tuition by correspondence. Suiun works as a teacher at an elementary school. Besides that, she manages to look after some cattle. The fact is that long ago, before their marriage, Suiun’s husband already had some livestock. Suiun and her husband have made best use of their opportunities and have achieved great success in increasing the population of livestock and in improving the quality of their living. The livestock allowed them to meet various needs like providing education for their sons, buying convenience goods for the house and making repairs to their home, etc. For the last twenty-five years, raising livestock has been an extra occupation and an extra source of income for the whole family, which every member of the family has shared concerns about. Suiun wants to continue dealing with cattle as it allows them to have quick and large amount of money whenever they need it. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to be able to buy two calves. Suiun’s partners are Tolobek, Gulzat and Sveta: Tolobek, 48, has three children and his wife is a teacher. To make a living, Tolobek works as a stoker at a railway station. He needs a loan to buy a calf to raise. Gulzat, 36, has two children and her husband works in construction. Gulzat is a teacher at an elementary school. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy a milk cow. Sveta, 41, is the mother of four children and her husband is a taxi driver. Sveta is a photographer, providing photographic services at weddings. Obtaining this loan would enable Sveta to buy a printer, which she needs in her work. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. has been in the beauty salon business for 20 years, and the name of his current shop is the Caruera Salon. It is a roadside locale and he caters to neighbors and walk-ins. The salon offers weaving, plaiting, and treatments.

He plans to use his KES 20,000 loan to buy more equipment (particularly dryers) and hair products like chemicals and oils. His biggest challenge is the power company, which systematically overcharges him. He is single and would ultimately like to run a salon in Nairobi and help other entrepreneurs build their businesses. George describes himself as generous, kind, humble, and willing to listen.

loans.use: To buy more equipment (particularly dryers) and hair products like chemicals and oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 2, 3 & 9 Group

texts.en:
Ysemitha, 26, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Ysemitha and the other borrowers in Dios es mi Pastor live in Boca Chica, a small town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica has unreliable electricity at best, and it has no potable running water. It also suffers from the pollution of its two large neighbors. Ysemitha lives with her husband and two children, 3 years and 3 months old, in a small concrete home.

Ysemitha will use this loan to purchase new and used clothing to sell to her customers. She has successfully repaid three loans, and she is excited to be taking out her fourth. Ysemitha’s business is run through her home, which she currently rents. Her dream is to one day own her own house using the profits from her clothing sales. Thank you for lending to Ysemitha and the Dios es mi Pastor group!

loans.use: To purchase new and used clothing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is the 47-year-old single mother of two children, ages 3 and 12, both of whom go to school. Gladys also takes care of an additional family member. The four reside in a one-roomed, rented house. The family has access to electricity but not piped water. They receive three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from Nakawa market, where she buys clothing materials and food. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Gladys owns a stall in Naguru market, selling bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. Gladys works seven days a week. She receives an average of 25 customers a day. Her major business challenges include ever-increasing prices of foodstuffs and the rainy season, which disturbs her work because she works in an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent, monthly market dues, feeding the family, and medication. She has been in this business for over three years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. Gladys joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of the availability of group loans.

She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, and sweet potatoes. She aspires to see her business expand and would eventually like to be able to start going directly to farmers to buy produce.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is the 45-year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Most of the town's inhabitants are involved in farming and other trading activities. Esther is in the fish selling business. She buys smoked fish from nearby fishing communities, then hawks her goods in her own community as well as selling at the local market. Esther has been in this business for 15 years. She hopes to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk in order to expand her business. She believes the loan will help her inject more working capital into her trade in order to enable her to make enough income to support her family and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina, age 45, has five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade. She works to help her husband to provide for the family. Rosina is a trader in palm fruits. She buys the palm fruits from nearby communities and villages, and supplies them to retailers and palm oil producers in her community. Rosina also sells at the local market. She has been in this business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business. She believes the loan would enable her to inject more working capital into her trade, allowing her to raise more income to support her children at school. Rosina says her kids are her future security and it is her desire to see them attain a high level of  quality education.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La socia EVARISTA pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 58 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos (dos varones y tres mujeres), ellos son casados y alternan sus actividades con el hogar y con el trabajo, cada uno de los hijos tienen su propia familia. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas.   

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de venta de comida. Ella prepara comida  para la hora del desayuno , almuerzo y cena,todos los días en su local. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de comida quiere compran mas insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, etc., para preparar más comida.          
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evarista is a member of the "Minibank" communal bank and is a native of the city of Cuzco. She is 58 years old, married and has five children (two male and three female). They are married and alternate between home and work activities. Each one of her children has his or her own family. Evarista maintains a small business selling food. She balances home activities with the job of selling food. Everyday, she prepares food for breakfast, lunch and dinner in her area. She is requesting the loan in order to increase the amount of food she can produce for sale. She wants to buy more supplies, such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, etc. in order to prepare more food. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and thus is committed to complying with the payment timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 31 year-old single mother of two children aged 9 and 16 years old. Both her children go to school. She resides and rents a one room house where she is staying with three people. Marjorie doesn’t take care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and gets three meals a day but has no piped water.

[She incurs   transport costs to and from buying baking materials from Kalerwe market   .]  She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall in Kyebando selling snacks in the market. Marjorie sells all types of snacks ranging from samosas, mandazi chapatti, pan cakes and kebabs.  She works seven days a week and averages 35 customers a day. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of cooking oil, wheat and baking flour and the rainy season which disturbs her work because she works in an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent for her residence, monthly market dues, feeding the family and medications. Besides this frying business she also operates a pre-primary school near her home.  She has been in this business for over two years and with Kiva partner MCDT for two years. She is now servicing her third loan working with the same group mates. Marjorie joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, wheat four and baking powder. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start supplying to different shops and schools.

loans.use: To buy additional cooking supplies.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 31 years old, and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade.

Susana works to support her husband in providing for their family. She has a palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community as well as selling it at the local market.

Susana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business. She believes that the loan will enable her to inject more capital into her trade, thus raising more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Bernice is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to help her husband provide for the family.

Bernice is a trader. She trades in textile goods such as headgear for women. She also trades in ointment. She buys the goods from nearby towns and peddles door-to-door to sell in her community. Bernice also sells at the local market.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She believes the loan would enable her to inject more working capital into her trade to help her raise more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted headgear and also ointment in bulk.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1,6, & 7 Group

texts.en:
Marquelina, 44, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Dios es mi Pastor (God is my Shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Marquelina and the other borrowers from Dios es mi Pastor live in Boca Chica, a small town in between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica has unreliable electricity at best, and when running water is available, it is never drinkable. Boca Chica also suffers from the pollution of its two large neighboring cities. Marquelina is a single mother of four, and all but one daughter have moved out of her home. With this loan, Marquelina’s third with Esperanza International, she plans to purchase foods typical of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, flour, oil, meat, juices and fruit. She currently runs her eatery from the side of her house, but eventually she would like to purchase or rent a separate building for her eatery.

Her dream is to give her children access to great educations so that they can all receive well-paid positions. Three of her four children are currently living and studying in New York City, and she said that her dreams for them are already coming true. Thank you for lending to Marquelina and the Dios es mi Pastor group!

loans.use: Purchase food to supply her eatery

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children between the ages of 15 and 25. Three of her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with four people. Esther takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets three meals a day.

She incurs transportation costs to and from buying groceries from Kalerwe market. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall in Wandegeya where she sells chips, fried cassava and chapatti. Esther works seven days a week, receiving an average of twenty-five customers a day.

Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of food and the rainy season, which disturbs her business because she works from an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent, monthly market dues, feeding the family and medication.

Esther has been in this business for over ten years and with MCDT for four years, now servicing her tenth loan and working with the same group mates. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour and a sack of charcoal. She is hopeful of seeing her business grow bigger so she could start distributing chips to different places.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of Irish potatoes, wheat flour, cassava, cooking oil and charcoal

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia YONNY pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene tres hijos (dos varones y una mujer). Los mayores estudian en la universidad y el menor estudia en el jardín. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de corte y confección de ropa.   

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de costura y hace manualidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de manualidades como arreglos navideños. Ella quiere compran más materiales para su taller de corte y confección de ropa.          .
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yonny is a member of the "Minibank" communal bank and is a native of the city of Cuzco. She is 43 years old, divorced and has three children (two male and one female). The adults study at the university and the minor studies in school. Yonny has a small seamstress and clothesmaking shop. She balances her home life with sewing and handicrafts. She is requesting the loan in order to increase production of handicrafts for sale, such as Christmas arrangements. She wants to buy more materials for her seamstress and clothesmaking shop. She feels grateful for the opportunity granted to her through this medium and thus is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make Christmas arrangements.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a thirty-nine-year-old married mother of four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade, a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Eunice is a food vendor. She prepares a local dish called kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. She sells in the morning by the roadside in her community. Eunice buys her ingredients from nearby communities.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 4 and 10. All her children go to school. She owns a four-room house where she lives with eight people. Gertrude takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets three meals a day.

Gertrude incurs transportation costs to and from buying food from Kalerwe market. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop in Ndeeba where she works at tailoring. She buys her clothing materials from Kiyembe shops in Kampala city, using public transport to and from shopping there.

Gertrude works seven days a week, receiving an average of twenty customers a day. She sells to women only. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of clothing material and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works in a muddy place.

Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, feeding the family and medication. She has been in this business for over five years and with MCDT for ten years, now servicing her twentieth loan and working with the same group mates. Gertrude joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more bolts of cloth. She is hopeful of seeing her business grow bigger, and would like to start a tailoring school..

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 25 años, 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio, brindando servicio de masajes juntamente con su esposo, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que día a día la frecuentan para brindarles el servicio. Nos cuenta que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, hoy en día se siente muy orgullosa de lo logrado.

 Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos como: esencias para masajes, aromatizantes, velas, comprará toallas y batas de color blanco y para brindar una mayor comodidad. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en esmaltes de pintura, para mejorar la infraestructura de su local, y así de esta manera ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Jesús, anhela implementar su negocio y convertirle en un SPA y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer, que cuando se propone algo lo logra.   Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a continuar con su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" (struggling women), district of Tarapoto, San Martin province, state of San Martin. She has a life partner and a 25 year old son that still depends on her for support. Her enterpreneurial spirit and the love for her family motivated her to start her own business and with her husband they offer massage services. She offers the service from her own home in a nicely conditioned area to serve her clients. She mentions that little by little her business has grown and by gaining experience in the field, she now feels very proud of her accomplishment. With the $700 loan, she will purchase products such as aromatherapy oils, candles, towels and white as well as different color robes to offer more comfort. She will invest part of the money purchasing paint to improve the infrastructure of her business area and by doing so offering better customer service to her clients. Jesus wishes to eventually make her business a SPA and expresses the conviction to make her dream come true because she is the type of woman that achieves the goals she sets for herself. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the continued help with her business and also to the many enterpreneurial women that want to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase aromatherapy products for her massage service business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a forty-seven-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Kade is a commercial town but the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Eunice is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called banku (cooked dough). It is served hot with soup. Eunice buys her materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

Eunice believes the loan would enable her to inject more working capital into her trade to raise more income to support her kids’ education.

loans.use: To purchase more food ingredients

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old and married with a two-year-old son. He has a shoe shop where he sells new and old shoes. He’s run this business for seven years and has one employee. Moses is requesting a loan for Kes 70,000 to increase his inventory.

Moses says that since joining Faulu, he has learnt about how to save and manage his business. He describes himself as determined, visionary, and cooperative. In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land and build a home for his family and expand his business into a large shoe store.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelo, 74, is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, “Canal De Bendicion” (Channel of Blessing), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Marcelo runs a successful small business selling new clothing to her friends and neighbors. The most common form of clothing sales in the Dominican Republic is used clothing, usually from the U.S., but Marcelo has differentiated her business by only selling the newest styles. With this loan, her fourth with Esperanza International, she hopes to continue investing in her business, continually expanding her items offered and keeping up with the latest trends.

Life in La Romana can be harsh – electricity is scarce if available at all, running water is never potable, and the hurricanes that rip through the Caribbean typically hit this side of the island first. Despite these difficulties, Marcelo keeps a positive attitude toward her business. She hopes to continually grow her business, and she is very grateful for the support given to her by Esperanza. Thank you for lending to Marcelo and the Canal de Bendicion group!

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emilia is 36 years old, and is divorced with three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to provide for her family.

Emilia has a palm oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community as well as selling it at the local market. Emilia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba S. est une femme de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend du poissons séchés, fumés et divers condiments sur étal. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Daba S. is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She sells dried and smoked fish and various condiments in her stall. This loan will allow her to bolster her business and to do better in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To run a business selling fish and a variety of foodstuff

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old, and is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband in providing for the family.

Doris has a palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community as well as selling it at the local market. Doris has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta G. est une dame de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de poissons séchés, fumés et de divers autres condiments. Ces revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille
texts.en:
Anta G. is a 56-year-old lady who is married and the mother of seven children.  She has a business involving dried and smoked fish and also a variety of other condiments.  These revenues enable her to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do business in fish and various other food items

loans.name: Emith

texts.es:
La señora Emith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 56 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella y sus hijos, emprendió un pequeño  negocio D. venta D. abarrotes establecida en su misma casa obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donD. sus principales clientes son los moradores, vecinos D. su barrio y amigos. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como: arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Emith, hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emith is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras: (struggling women), district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, state of San Martin. She is married, 56 years old, and mother of two children who are already independent. Faced with the need to contribute to her home's income and motivated by her children and herself, she began a small business selling groceries from her home with very good results from the beginning because of the quality of her produtcs, her reasonable prices, and good customer service. She continues with her business where the main clients are residents, neighbors and friends. With the $475 loan, she will buy additional products for her business such as: rice and sugar by the kilo, eggs by the box, personal hygene and home cleaning products, sodas by pack, candy and other products to maintain her clients happy. Emith feels very happy today for the services she offers and is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead in life. She hopes the help continues for a long time assisting many families and enterpreneurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase greater quantity groceries and offer more prodcuts

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 34-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Most of the town's inhabitants work in farming, palm oil production, and other trading activities.

Mercy has a fish-selling business. She buys smoked fish from nearby fishing communities and hawks to sell in her community. She also sells at the local market. Mercy has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish in bulk

loans.name: Concepcion Maria

texts.es: Concepcion es casada, tiene dos hijos el mayor de 6 añitos de edad estudia su primer grado de educaciòn primaria y un niño de 2 añitos de edad, trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 10 años, esta solicitando su 4to credito para construir una habitaciòn ya que necesita tener mejor comodidad y privacidad en su hogar,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como agricultor en la finca familiar, sembrando diversos cultivos y cuidando el ganado que ellos tienen; Concepciòn es una mujer trabajadora todos los dias se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana ha hacer todos los quehaceres de  hogar para irse a las  siete de la mañana a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de su comunidad, por las tarde cuida de su niños y ayuda a su marido, su sueño es tener mejor comodidad, salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Concepcion is married and has two children—her older child is 6 years old and is in the first grade of elementary school, while her younger child is two years old. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 10 years. Concepcion is requesting her 4th loan so that she can construct a room, since she needs to have greater comfort and privacy in her home. She has help from her husband, who works as a farmer on the family’s farm raising various crops and looking after their cattle. Concepcion is a hard-working woman who gets up at 4:00 every morning to do all of the household chores, and at 7:00 goes off to teach children from the rural part of the community. In the afternoon she takes care of her children and helps her husband. Her dream is to have greater comfort, health, and job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a room

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is fifty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Comfort is a trader. She trades in pastries. She fries the pastries by the roadside in her community and supplies to retailers. Comfort has been in business for over nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 57 años y es madre de 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lili, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pescado fresco y hoy en día nos cuenta que ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, decidió iniciarse con la Venta de Pollos desviscerados, ubicado en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde brinda el servicio a moradores y clientes fijos y ya viene realizando este tipo de actividad mas de un año. 
Con este préstamo de S/.2,500.00,  comprara  pollos vivos en jabas, también comprara su mesita para una mejor presentación de sus productos, así brindar confianza e higiene a sus clientes.
Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio. Lili, dice pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo brindado, así de esta manera pueda hacer su realidad sus demás sueños.
texts.en:
Lili belongs to the "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Fighting Women) Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, department of San Martin, Peru. She is a 57-year-old single mother of five children, all grown up. Previously Lili made a living selling fresh fish, and she tells us that due to the need to generate her own profits and thanks to her enterprising spirit and energy she decided to start selling cleaned-out chickens at her district's central market. She has been providing her service to residents and regular customers for more than a year now. With the loan of 2,500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase crates of live chickens and also buy a stand to better present her products and provide her customers with confidence and hygiene. She is an independent woman who administers her business and makes all the decisions. Lili says belonging to the group of women has helped her better understand her rights, and she is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its support in helping her reach her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crates of chickens

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband and provide for the family. She is a trader. Agnes is involved in palm oil production. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil, and supplies it to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Agnes has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and labor for growing corn and cassava

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène S., 47 ans, est marié et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison tels que mangues, orange et aussi de l’arachide. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Mbène S. is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. She sells sesaonal fruits such as mangos and oranges, and she also sells peanuts. Her goal is to strengthen her business and to help improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell seasonal fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Esther Magdalena

texts.es: La profesora Esther Magdalena es casada, se desempeña como docente desde hace 9 años en una Escuela de Nueva Guinea, tiene una bebita de 1añito, su esposo trabaja tambien trabaja como docente a 8 kilometro de Yolaina; Esther esta solicitando su 4to crèdito para realizar mejora de su vivienda, hecharle la ceramica a la vivienda y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones para su familia,   junto a su marido comparten  los gastos familiares y los compromisos adquiridos, espera ser beneficada con el fondo KIVA para poder cumplir el proyecto que tiene de hecharle la ceramica a su casa, pues su pequeñita esta en el proceso de dar sus primeros pasitos y desea tener un casa con buenas condiciones, es una mujer profesional y el año pasado se recibio como lienciada en ciencias de la Educaciòn en la Universidad URACCAN, su sueño es seguir estudiando, trabajo y salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Esther Magdalena is married and has been a teacher for the past nine years at Nueva Guinea School. She has a 1-year-old baby daughter and her husband also works as a teacher in Yolaina, 8 kilometers away. Esther is requesting her fourth loan to make improvements to her home, putting in ceramic tile, thus improving the living conditions for her family. She shares household expenses and commitments with her husband, and she hopes to benefit from Kiva's funds by completing the ceramic tile project in her home since her little girl is in the process of taking her first steps and she wants to have a home in good condition. Esther is a professional woman, and last year she received an educations degree from Uraccan University. Her dream is to keep studying and for work and health for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put ceramic tile in her home

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Nora is a trader. She runs a grocery store by the roadside in her community. She sells various kinds of groceries, from toiletries to candies. She has been in business for barely a year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Nora desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and hire help for her corn harvest.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
La señora Llerme, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San de Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 45 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Llerme, juntamente con su esposo, decidieron acondicionar algunos ambientes de su casa, para el alquiler mensual de habitaciones, la cual el servicio los brinda a estudiantes y conocidos que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a trabajar en el Distrito de Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y cuenta con 05 habitaciones. Además, se dedica a la venta de plastiquería y se traslada por  diferentes pueblos aledaños, cerca de la Cuidad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas habitaciones. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios, para los baños, para mejorar el servicio e higiene,  de esa mañera sus inquilinos queden   satisfechos y contentos.

Llerme, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Llerme belongs to the “Mujeres Luchadoras” ("Fighting Women") Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, Peru. She is a 45-year-old mother of three children, all grown up, and lives with her partner. Llerme, along with her husband, decided to set up some rooms to rent by the month out of their home, offering the service to students and acquaintances from other places looking to stay and work in Tarapoto. They have stuck with the business and currently have five rooms for rent. Furthermore, Llerme works selling plastics and travels to the different towns surrounding her city. With the loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase bricks, cement and plywood to build more rooms. She'll also use part of the money to buy accessories for the bathrooms to provide better service and hygiene. In this way her tenants will remain satisfied and content. Llerme feels very accomplished and has a strong desire to reach and fulfill her other dreams. She is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its help in starting her business and helping the many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build rooms to rent

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is forty-two years old, a widow with three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says that the sale of cosmetics is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to adequately support her family, especially her kids' education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock and sell palm oil

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is forty-three years old. She is married with five children. She is really resourceful and supportive of her husband in financing their children’s education to provide them with better opportunities in the future. At the moment, two of her children have completed senior high and are waiting to enter the university. She is a food vendor and sells cooked yam and rice with stew. She sells at the market square in her locality. She wants to use the loan to buy raw materials such as yam tubers, rice, vegetables, and cooking oil. She believes this will help her to reduce costs and save more, enabling her to provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio,  es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja como notificador del poder Judicial en el municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 4 años, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crèdito, para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcciòn y posteriormente con otro credito hacer la construccion de su casa,  pues actualmente habita en casa de sus padres, su sueño es seguir estudiando para llegar a ser un excelente profesional y tener mejores condiciones, es un joven muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo por ser muy humilde y de buenas costumbres.
texts.en:
Silvio is single and has no children. He has worked as a process server for the court in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for the past four years. He is requesting his second loan in order to purchase construction materials and later, with another loan, construct his house. Currently he lives in his parents' home. His dream is to keep studying so he can become an excellent professional and have better living conditions. He is a young man who is adored by his co-workers for his humility and good manners.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 2, 3, & 5 Group

texts.en:
Esperanza, 26, is a borrower who lives near L. Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Solution), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Esperanza runs a successful small business selling women’s clothing to her friends and neighbors. She also specializes in shoes and slippers, which she will purchase with this, her fourth loan, from Kiva partner Esperanza International. Esperanza came to Esperanza International because she wanted more comfortable payments with lower interest than she could find elsewhere.

Life in L. Romana can be harsh – electricity is scarce (if available at all), running water is never potable, and the hurricanes that rip through the Caribbean typically hit this siD. of the island first. Despite these difficulties, Esperanza keeps a positive attituD. toward her business. After all, the extra profits from her business have allowed her to improve her home and proviD. comfort for her children. She hopes to continue reaching for the future by improving her family’s living conditions and expanding her business. Thank you for lending to Esperanza and the Cristo L. Solucion group!

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes, and slippers

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est age de 21 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de parfums et de tissus. Les revenus générés contribueront à améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady D. is 21 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has a business involving perfumes and fabrics. The revenues generated will help to improve her family’s healthcare and living situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do commerce in cloth and perfumes

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Claudia Maria M. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villa Nueva en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Claudia se dedica al comercio, vende ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños, en estos momentos esta un poco corta de presupuesto para invertir en su negocio, por tal razon necesita un credito para comprar mas ropa al por mayor, en esta epoca que ya viene la navidad las ventas son muy buenas y por eso es que ella desea invertir en comprar mercaderia, Claudia tiene esperado vender mucha ropa para la navidad.
su meta es poder tener una tienda en la cual pueda poner toda su ropa, ahora ella vende ambulantemente, sale a vender a diferentes colonias tambien se pone cerca del mercado, en las paradas de buses y ahi es donde mas vende.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria M. is 32 years old and lives in the Villa Nueva district in the city of Tegucigalpa. Claudia makes a living selling new clothing for women, men, and children. At present she does not have enough money to invest in her business, and that is why she needs a loan so that she can purchase more clothing wholesale. This is the time of year when Christmas is approaching and the sales are very good, and so she wants to invest in purchasing more merchandise. Claudia hopes to sell a lot of clothing for Christmas. Claudia’s goal is to have a store where she can put all of her merchandise, since she currently sells clothing as a street vendor. She goes out to sell clothing in different districts near the market as well as at bus stops, where she makes a lot of sales. This is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing jeans, trousers, shirts, undershirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, socks, dresses, and clothing for infants

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Justice

texts.en: Justice, 29, is married and has two children who are currently in school. He works very hard, driven by his passion to provide brighter future opportunities for his children. Justice sells logs of wood in his community, buying his stock from saw millers and retailing them to his clients. He wants to use the loan to buy more logs of wood so he can increase his income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase wooden logs in bulk.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 40 years old and is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family. Millicent trades in clothes and shoes in her local community market. She buys from big cities and retails the items to her customers. Millicent has been in this business for the past 12 years and therefore has acquired a lot of marketing skills. She wants to use the new loan to buy more women's shoes and clothing to meet her customers’ preferences, and also to enable her to make more profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio Cesar G. tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica al servicio de transporte desde hace 20 años, el se levanta desde muy temprano ya que trabaja de las 4:30 a.m. a 9:30 P.M. el es el dueño del taxi, hace diario unas 20 carreras y las cobra a $ 3.00 obteniendo una utilidad diaria de $ 40.00 el no tiene un punto fijo de taxi, pero cuenta con clientes fijos, los cuales lo llaman para que los vaya a recoger a determinado lugar, vive con su esposa quien labora en una empresa privada desde hace varios años.
Tienen un hijo adolecente el cual esta estudiando.
Esta solicitando el credito para comprar repuestos como ser pistones, anillos, vielas, quita empaque de motor, rectificacion de motor para poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El sueño de Julio a corto plazo es ahorrar y comprarse otro vehiculo ya que el es muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar G. is 36 years old and has worked in transportation for 20 years. He gets up very early since he works from 4:30 A.M. to 9:30 P.M. He is the owner of a taxi and has about 20 runs a day. He charges $3.00 each, obtaining a daily income of $40.00. He doesn't have a fixed route for his taxi rounds, but he relies on regular clients who call him so that he can come pick them up at a particular place. He lives with his wife who has worked in a private business for several years. They have a teenage son, who is a student. Julio is requesting the loan to buy spare parts, such as pistons, rings, rods, motor seal removers, and motor correctors in order to provide his customers with better service. Julio's short-term dream is to save money and buy himself another vehicle because he is very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for automobiles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica, 78, is a widow with five children, all independent. Though Veronica is old, she travels to the northern part of the country to buy tomatoes in bulk, supplying them to other retailers. This is a trade she has been doing for the past 30 years, and she wants to use the loan to buy more baskets of tomatoes to meet the daily demands of her customers. Veronica hopes to use part of her profit to support her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old, married and has four children. She owns and operates a grocery store where she sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc., in her neighborhood.

With the loan, Mary wants to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to boost her savings to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries to increase her inventory

loans.name: Nelida Adriana

texts.es:
La señora  NELIDA ADRIANA, tiene  42 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella tiene estudios de panadería y repostería. Tiene 3 hijos pero solo 2 dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando en el colegio. La socia se dedica  a la preparación de tortas, pasteles y bocaditos, con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró 2 sacos de harina, huevos, mantequilla, pecanas, pasas, etc para la preparación de sus pedidos.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles comprará 2 sacos de harinas y un horno pequeño. Ella sueña con asociarse con una panadería para así poder aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelida Adriana is 42 years old and lives in the district of Esperanca, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Santa Elena II Community Bank and has studied baking and pastry-making. She has three children, two of whom are still in school and are dependents. Adriana makes a living making tortas, cakes and sandwiches. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased two sacks of flour, eggs, butter, pecans, raisins and other items to fulfill her orders. With the current loan of 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase two sacks of flour and a small oven. Her dream is to become associated with a bakery so she can increase her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two sacks of flour and a small over

loans.name: Lisbith

texts.es:
La señora Lisbith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, también se dedica a brindar pensión. Lisbith, nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de S/. 200.00, y poco a poco fue ahorrando y creciendo cada día. Se levanta muy temprano, para preparar sus alimentos.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus pensionistas con ese carisma y rica sazón que la caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará una cocinita para facilitar sus comidas además utensilios para brindar una mejor atención y parte  del dinero invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Lisbith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante, asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por enseñarle como administrar su negocio y  contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lisbith belongs to the "Mujeres Luchadoras" ("Fighting Women") Community Bank, district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, department of San Martin, Peru. She is a 53-year-old married mother of two children, both grown up. Out of the need to make headway for her children and thanks to her enterprising spirit and energy, she decided to start her own business selling food in a well-conditioned space out of her home, where she also provides a boardinghouse. Lisbith tells us that she started with 200 soles of capital and little by little she saved and it grew each day. She wakes up very early to prepare her meals. She tends to her boarders with the charisma and tasty foods she is known for. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she plans to set up a small kitchen area where she can make her meals and also purchase cooking utensils to provide better service. She plans to use part of the money to purchase rice, sugar and other products of primary need. Lisbith feels very safe and has a strong desire to keep moving forward to assure herself of a peaceful life. She is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for teaching her how to administer her business and helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Alejandra Candelaria

texts.es: Alejandra Candelaria tiene 47 años de edad, junto a su esposo tienen 6 hijos y todos viven de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. La ubicación es en su casa de habitación, por lo que sus inicios fueron con la venta de refrescos y poco a poco fue que comenzó a cocinar y decidió elaborar platillos, como gallo pinto, enchiladas y tacos, ya que no tenía el capital suficiente para ofrecer otro tipo de platillos pero ha logrado salir adelante por medio de los créditos. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de granos básicos. Ella sueña con mantener siempre su negocio y obteniendo mas clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandra Candelaria is 47 years old, married and has six children, all who live on their own. She makes a living making and selling food out of her home. She started out selling refreshments and little by little she began cooking and decided to make meals, such as chicken, enchiladas and tacos. She did not have sufficient funds to offer other types of meals but has been able to make headway thanks to the loans she has received. The loan she is currently requesting is to purchase basic grains. Alejandra dreams of always having her business and getting more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Diana Sebastiana

texts.es:
La señora  DIANA SEBASTIANA S. N., tiene  46 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijos quienes económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. La socia se dedica a la venta de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, papas, golosinas, cerveza, gaseosas, etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosa, golosinas, leche, fideos, aceite y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, comprará cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor para generar mayores ganancias.
Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener su restaurante  por lo cual esta ahorrando y así lograr  su meta.
texts.en:
Sra. Diana Sebastiana S. N. is 46 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Santa Elena II Communal Bank. Diana completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 3 dependent children who attend school.

Diana sells rice, sugar, milk, noodles, potatoes, candy, beer, sodas, and other products from the store located in her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy inventory and a display cabinet for exhibiting her products. With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy cases of beer and sodas in bulk so that she can generate better earnings. Her dream is to expand her business and open a restaurant. For this reason, she is accumulating savings so that she can achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & sodas

loans.name: Nimia Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora  NIMIA IDELSA L. M., tiene  39 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. La socia se dedica  a la crianza y venta de pollos. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró pollos bebes y alimento para criarlos, los mismo que vendió posteriormente.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, comprará gallinas ponedoras para vender pollos y huevos.
Ella sueña con tener su propia granja de pollos para así poder generar mayores ingresos y continuar apoyando en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia Idelsa L. M. is 39 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Santa Elena II Communal Bank. Nimia has 3 dependent children. She completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school.

Nimia raises and sells chickens. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought baby chicks and feed for maintaining them. Those birds were eventually sold. She is requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy hens to sell for meat and eggs. Her dream is to have her own poultry farm so that she can generate more revenue to continue supporting her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase egg-laying hens

loans.name: Relia

texts.es: La señora Relia es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región  D. Ucayali, tiene 52 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que trabaja como mecánico D. motores y soldador. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desD. hace nueve años. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, este préstamo le permitió invertir en la compra D. cosméticos. En la actualidad requiere un préstamo D. 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos D. belleza como perfumes, talcos, cremas, maquillaje y vender a sus clientes y amigos. La meta D. Relia  es culminar sus estudios y  tener una tienda D. prendas D. vestir y productos D. belleza para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Sra. Relia is an enterprising and dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 52 years old and the mother of four adult children. She sells beauty products and has the support of her husband, who works as a mechanic and welder.

Relia became a member of the Carmen Cabrejos Communal Bank nine years ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase cosmetics. She currently needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase beauty products such as perfumes, talcum powders, crèmes, and makeup to sell her customers and friends. Relia’s goal is to finish her studies and open a store where she sells dress clothes and beauty products for women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Mirian Geraldina's Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario denominado las brisas del Henecan esta integrado por tres personas un hombre y dos mujeres, se han asociado con el fin de obtener capital de trabajo.
estas son las actividades que ellos realizan:

las señora Dayani Mercedes C. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Elvin Leonel Perez, tiene un hijo pequeño.
su negocio es la compra venta de ropa usada que la vende en su casa, en colonias y barrios de san lorenzo esta solicitando un credito para invertir en ropa para vender en navidad.
 
la señora Mirian Geraldina E. tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos. vive con sus padres.
Su negocio es la compra venta de ropa nueva y usada, lacteos, chiclera esta solicitando el credito para comprar un fardo de ropa, e invertir en los lacteos.
 
el señor Fredys Omar Funes tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Grecia Maricela Perez, el se dedica a la compra venta de pescado y tamabien a la venta de ropa esta actividad la
realiza desde hace 03 años. su esposa le ayuda con las ventas. esta solicitando el credito para capital de trabajo quiere invertir para la navidad ya que las ventas son buenas para esa 
epoca.
texts.en:
