The Solidarity Group named “Las Brisas del Henecan” (The Breeze of Henecan) consists of three people, one man and two women. They have partnered together in order to obtain working capital. Their business activities are described below:

Sra. Dayani Mercedes C. is 22 years old and in a common law marriage with Sr. Elvin Leonel Perez. They have a young son. Her business involves buying secondhand clothes and selling them either from home or in the neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. She is requesting a loan to invest in more clothing to sell for the Christmas season.

Sra. Mirian Geraldina E. is 39 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives with her parents. Her business involves buying and selling new and used clothing, dairy products, and chewing gum. She is requesting a loan to purchase a bundle of clothing and to invest in more dairy products.

Sr. Fredys Omar Funes is 25 years old and is in a common law marriage with Sra. Grecia Maricela Perez. His business involves buying and selling fish and clothing. He has been engaged in this business activity for 3 years. His wife helps with selling these products. The loan he requested will be used as working capital to invest in more merchandise for the Christmas season, since sales are good during this time of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
La señora Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el del distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria incompleta.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles,  el mismo que será invertido en la compra de redes, ella manifiesta que las mallas son lo primero que se malogra es por eso que requieren cambiarlas.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse un carro y así facilitar su trabajo.

A ella le  gustan las oportunidades que les da Manuela Ramos para que las mujeres realicen sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sra. Pelagia is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives in the community of Capana. Pelagia did not finish elementary school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Pelagia is now requesting a new loan of 1000 soles to buy fishing nets. This piece of equipment is the first thing that tends to deteriorate, so it needs to be replaced regularly. She someday hopes to buy a cart in order to make her work easier.

Pelagia enjoys the opportunities Manuela Ramos provides women to develop in their work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de dos menores, ella tiene una bodega en su casa, actividad que realiza en sociedad con su hermano. Eloísa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caribeñas” desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de gaseosas. Actualmente requiere un crédito de 1200 soles, monto que será utilizado para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. para implementar su bodega. La meta de Eloisa es tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Eloisa is one of our dynamic and hardworking members who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 34 years old and the mother of two young children. Eloisa and her brother manage a grocery store out of her home.

She became a member of Las Caribeñas Communal Bank five years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy sodas. Eloisa is now requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items to keep her store running. Her goal is to have another business of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
La señora Eudosia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra-venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mallas y gasolina para su lancha, para realizar la pesca artesanal que luego lo comercializa directo con los acopiadores.
La señora también se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y pollipapas (comida al paso).

Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Juliaca y hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra Eudosia is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. Eudosia lives in the community of Ccotos and completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos since the time her Communal Bank was founded. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling fish.

Eudosia is requesting a new loan of 2000 soles to purchase fishing nets and fuel for her motorboat. This will enable her to keep fishing so that she can sell her catch directly to the distributors. In addition, she also sells “salchipapas” and “pollipapas” (forms of fast food). Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Juliaca and see her children become professionals. Eudosia enjoys her savings and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets & fuel for her motorboat

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario cristo rey esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son tres miembros los de este grupo y a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
la señora Catalina L. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Adalid Araujo tienen un hijo que depende de ellos.  
la señora L. se dedica a la costura desde hace unos 30 años, elabora vestidos, faldas, arregla pantalones, necesita el prestamo para comprar tela y juguetes ya que para esta epoca navideña vende bastante.
 
Gloria Emerita R. tiene 66 años de edad, es soltera, vive sola en su casa, no tene hijos que dependen de ella su unica hija vive en Costa Rica y ella se dedica a la comercializacion de perfumes,cremas, acsesorios de limpieza y enchape. esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos ya que la epoca de navidad es buena para el comercio.
 
el señor Oscar Elvin M. tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la compra venta de pescado y cerdos.  los cerdos los destaza para luego comercializarlos, esta actividad la realiza
desde hace unos 6 años, sus ventas las realiza en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas cerdos y pescados.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey Solidarity Group is located in the Buena Vista neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. There are three members and the details of their business activities are described below:

Sra. Catalina L. is 55 years old and in a common law marriage with Sr. Adalid Araujo. They have one dependent child. She has been sewing for 30 years. Sra. Catalina produces dresses and skirts, and also does trouser alterations. She needs a loan to buy fabric for her business and toys to sell for the Christmas season.

Gloria Emerita R. is 66 years old, single, and lives by herself. She does not have any dependents since her only daughter lives in Costa Rica. She sells perfumes, crèmes, cleaning supplies, and plates. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these products for the Christmas season, since this is a good time for sales.

Sr. Oscar Elvin M. is 29 years old and single. He sells fish and pigs. The pigs are butchered before being sold. He has been in this business for 6 years and sells his products within the different neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. Oscar is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and fish.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Candida Norberta

texts.es: Candida Norberta tiene 68 años, esta señora ha sido una mujer muy ejemplar para sus hijos ya que les ha enseñado a trabajar de una manera muy humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que al inicio ella recorría las calles para ofrecer sus productos y por medio de sus amistades logro obtener más clientes, pero con los años se le ha hecho muy difícil seguir recorriendo los lugares que visitaba, pero aun así algunos de sus clientes la visitan en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de ropa, calzado, artículos, perfumes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Candida Norberto is 68. She has been an exemplary woman for her children. She has taught them to work in a very humble manner. She sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over ten years. When she started she traveled the streets to offer her products. Through her friendships she was able to get more customers. But, the years have made it very difficult for her to keep traveling to the places that she used to visit. Even so, some of her customers visit her in her house. The loan she is asking for is to buy clothes, footwear, and perfumes among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abra Emefa

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert en 2004 à l’université de Lomé un restaurant très fréquenté par les étudiants. Son restaurant est logé dans un grand hall, où elle vend du riz, de la pâte locale dénommée « akoumé », des spaghetti, de l’igname pilée appelée « fufu ». Grâce à cette activité, elle a recruté une dizaine de jeunes filles qui l’aident dans ses activités. Elle réalise de très bonnes affaires car elle est la seule à qui est confiée cette activité de restauration dans le hall du campus universitaire. Elle a en ce moment besoin de s’approvisionner en denrées alimentaires ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 02 sacs de maïs, 05 sacs de riz et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady opened a restaurant in 2004 at the University of Lome which is much frequented by students. Her restaurant is housed in a big hall where she sells rice, local pastry called 'akoumi', spaghetti, pounded yam 'called fufu'. Thanks to this business, she recruted about ten young girls who help her in her business. She makes good busines because she is the only one entrusted with the responsibilty of this catering business in the lobby on campus. She wants at this moment to get her supplies of foodstuffs, reason why she is requesting a loan from Wages to buy 02 bags of corn, 05 bags of rice and other miscelleneous products. She is married and the mother of 03 children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, rice and other miscelleneous products for catering

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K., Hassan T., Wullamatu K., Ramatu C., Ramatu K. and Adamsay K.. They have named their group Believe in God.

These group members have received several loans from Kiva through SMT, and have repaid previous loans successfully. Their last loan was for 1,000,000 SLL each. That loan made a tremendous impact in the lives and businesses of these borrowers. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, and were thus able to solve many of their problems. Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 SLL each to add to their businesses.

Mariatu K. (third from left) is the leader of this group. Mariatu was born in Sanda village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 35 years old, married to a businessman, and they have four children. Mariama’s children attend primary and secondary school. Mariama sells ready-to-wear-clothes for children. She has been in this business for about four years now.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of children's clothes

loans.name: Brian Albertico

texts.es: El señor Brian Albertico es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Alberto  se dedica a la elaboración de bolsas de hielo, bolsitas y bolis los cuales luego sale a distribuir en y algunas veces los ofrece en su misma casa. Este negocio ha sido unos de los medios de supervivencia más importante para Brian. El  inicio  su negocio hace 3 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue idea de su esposa para ofrecerle a sus hijos el sustento diario. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias primas para su negocio. Lo que el sueña es terminar de construir su casa ya que la compra de los materiales es muy cara. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Brian Albertico is married and has 4 dependent children. He manufactures ice packs, ice chests, and popsicles which he later sells for distribution. Sometimes he offers his products out of his home. This business has been an important means of survival for Brian and his family. He started this business 3 years ago and says that it was his wife’s idea to find a way to provide for the daily needs of their children.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase materials for his business. He dreams of finishing the construction of his house, but buying materials in order to do this is expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase materials

loans.name: Christ In Me Group

texts.en:
Here are Ramatu B., Abu K., Memunatu S., Zainab K. and Kadiatu K.. They are small scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni, seeking a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit, thereby enabling them to better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and academic pursuits. 

Ramatu B. (in the middle) is the leader of this group.  Born in Makeni, she is a 27-year-old widow with two children. One of her children is attending primary school (Class I) and the other is in nursery school. Ramatu has been a businesswoman for seven years now, selling rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She will use this loan to buy more gallons of palm oil to sell.

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of rice and palm oil for the business

loans.name: Irma Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudio educación Primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado porcino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado mayor para engorde, la señora mejora el ganado y luego los comercializa  en las ferias regionales, una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es poner un negocio tipo emporio para expender carnes.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of San Pedro community bank in the community of Ancara, which is in the Ilave district of El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married, and has 1 child. She lives in the Cahuaya sector of Ancara and completed primary schooling. Irma has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan for 300 PEN allowed her to increase working capital for her business buying and selling pork. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,000 PEN which will allow her to buy livestock, which she will fatten then sell in weekly regional markets. Her greatest wish is to open a butcher shop. She enjoys saving and attending her group's meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos, vive la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria (incompleta).

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de la pesca artesanal.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mallas y cambiar las que ya están deterioradas, ella  realiza la pesca  en le lago Titicaca, y luego vende su producto en las plazas de Juliaca y Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprarse una casita en Juliaca y dar educación a  sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  las charlas y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of Juchuy Niño community bank in the Capachica district of Puno province, department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in the community of Capana and did not complete primary school education. Maria has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the group was established; her first loan of 300 PEN allowed her to increase working capital for her work in traditional small-scale fishing. Currently, she needs a loan of 500 PEN that will allow her to buy to nets to replace the ones she has that are in poor condition. Maria fishes in Lake Titicaca and sells her catch in the town plazas of Juliaca and Capachica. Her greatest wish is to buy able to buy a house in Juliaca and provide her children with an education. Maria enjoys her group's meetings and workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es La Puerta 2&3 Group

texts.en:
Sonia, 43, lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, “Jesucristo es la Puerta” (Jesus Christ is the Door), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Sonia runs a successful arts and crafts business from her home, where she lives with her children and husband. This is Sonia’s fifth loan with Esperanza International, and she plans to use it to buy paint and other supplies for her crafts. In particular, Sonia will paint paintings to sell to her community and to tourists who often pass through La Romana.

Life in La Romana can be harsh; electricity is scarce, running water is never potable, and the hurricane season can take a toll on the often-flimsy homes typical of the area. Despite the difficulties, Sonia has found blessing in the support her business brings to her family. She has already been able to construct two brand-new rooms and purchase school supplies for her children.

Sonia hopes that with continued profits, she will be able to purchase paint for her home to make it look nicer. She knows this goal is easily within reach as her business continues to grow. Thank you for lending to Sonia and to the Jesucristo es la Puerta group!

loans.use: To buy paint and other art supplies

loans.name: Claudia Banessa

texts.es:
la sra. Claudia Banessa G. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Claudia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual es muy buena ya que este alimento es muy consumido por el pueblo hondureño, se come en el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ademas tambien sirven para hacer varias golosinas, este producto lo vende en deferentes casas y caserios, tambien lo reparte en pulperias y negocios.
ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Claudia Banessa G. is 30 years old; she lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in San Lorenzo. Claudia prepares and sells tortillas, an activity she has done for many years. It is good work because tortillas are in high demand in this Honduran town: they are eaten for breakfast, lunch and dinner. They are also used to make various snacks. She sells her tortillas door-to-door, and also distributes them to local stores and businesses. Claudia is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize flour, firewood, whitewash, water, and matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yola Nohemi

texts.es:
La señora Yola es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina” ubicado en el  distrito de Platería, Provincia Puno,  Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la av. Platería, estudió educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, con el cual comprará ganado vacuno (vacas)  para engorde, para venderlo en la feria de Acora cada semana. La señora tambien se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías por pedidos..

Su mayor deseo es formar una empresa de venta de artesanías.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Yola is a member of the "Flor Andina" ("Flower of the Andes") communal bank, located in the Platería district of Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner on Platería Avenue; she has one child and has completed her primary education. Yola has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years. Her first loan, for 300 Peruvian soles, provided increased capital for her retail business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan of 1500 soles, which she will use to purchase cattle to fatten up and sell at the Acora market each week. Yola also works making handicrafts in response to orders. Her greatest desire is to start a business selling handicrafts. She enjoys saving money and attending informational lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Macharia

texts.en:
Macharia is 40 years old and married with two young daughters. He was previously a farmer but has been selling scrap metal in Nairobi for two years now. He is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES to add to his stock of scrap metal.

Macharia describes himself as hardworking and determined. Since he joined Kiva partner Faulu, he says that he has learned business management skills. As his business expands, he hopes to buy a truck for transporting his goods, and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To add to his stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Lilia Flor

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Lilia Flor, se dedica a la venta de queso,  hace 4 años atrás y nos cuenta que se iniciaron juntamente con su esposo con un capital de S/. 100.00 y trabajaban con pedidos anticipados de sus clientes. Actualmente, se encuentra mas establecida y cuentan con un fundo donde crían sus propios ganados vacunos y a diario extraen la leche de sus vacas, para la preparación de los quesos, y cuentan  con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, lo invertirá comprando insumos como: cuajos de leche, limón en kilos, sal y algunos moldes para sus quesos y tercios de leña. 

Lilia Flor, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro,  cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  las demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante y brindarle una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Lilia Flor belongs to the Mujeres Luchadoras Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 45, married, and has two dependent children. Lilia Flor sells cheese. She tells us that four years ago she began with her husband and 100 PEN. They worked on anticipated orders from her customers. She is currently better established. They have a farm where they raise their own cows. They milk the cows daily in order to makes the cheeses. They have a well equipped place. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy supplies like milk rennet, kilos of lemons, salt, some molds for her cheeses, and firewood. Lilia Flor feels very satisfied with the work that she does. It is hard work, but she believes it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill her dreams and meet the goals she has outlined for her life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering support to her and to the rest of the women who want to get ahead and have a peaceful old age

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for makes cheese

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old and married with a six-month-old daughter. He runs a boutique selling clothing for men and women. He has been in business for three years and mostly sells to teenage and middle-aged customers. He is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES to increase his inventory for the festive season.

Daniel describes himself as organized and willing to share his experience with other people who want to open a business. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business and expand to more stalls. His dream is to facilitate his child's education and be a family man. He says that through Kiva partner Faulu he has learned that his goals and objectives in life can be attained.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: La señora Milka es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad, Milka se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y Bisuteria, ella tiene este negocio en su casa y ofrece sus productos a sus amigos y familiares. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace un año y siete meses,  el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, préstamo que le permitió invertir en gaseosas. En la actualidad ella requiere un préstamo de 1200 soles que utilizará para comprar un carrito sanguchero (para venta de comida al paso), ya que venderá salchipapas por las noches en la vereda de su casa. La meta de Milka es tener un restaurante que ofrezca alimentos de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milka is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is a 39 year old single mother. She has five children; three of them are grown. Milka sells clothing and jewelry. She has this business in her house. She offers her products to her friends and family. She has been a member of the Carmen Cabrejos communal bank for one year and six months. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to buy soft drinks. She currently needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy a vending cart (to sell fast food). She will sell “salchipapas” (food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes) in the evenings on the sidewalk to her house. Milka’s goal is to have a restaurant that offers quality food to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vending cart

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario santa maria esta ubicado en el barrio que lleva su mismo nombre, esta integrado por tres miembros todos vecinos de la comunidad de nacaome, valle, estos señores son comerciantes, desde hace mucho tiempo se conocen muy bien, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Alcida A. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Luis Alonzo Lopez quien labora como motorista, la señora A. se dedica a la costura confecciona vestidos, pantalones, faldas, blusas esta solicitando el credito para comprar telas, botones, hilos.
 
la señora Maria de la Paz F. García tiene 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Santos Javier García el trabaja en una panaderia y ella se dedica a vender en la pulperia y elaborar y vender tortillas a los vecinos de la comunidad, su pulperia la tiene desde hace 05 años esta solicitando el crediito para surtir mas su negocio.
 
el señor Santos Roberto A. tiene 25 años de edad, es casado con la señora Nixia Yolani F. Bustillo ella es ama de casa, el se dedica a la compra venta de frutas de temporada la trae en el carro de su primo viaja a comayagua, montelibano y otros lugares donde compra las frutas. Las vende en el mercado de nacaome en barrios y colonias de esta ciudad. esta actividad la realiza
hace unos 06 años, esta solicitando el credito para compra de dos pailas de naranjas.
texts.en:
The Santa María Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of the same name. It is comprised of three members, who are all neighbors in the Nacaome Valle community. They are business people. They have known each other very well for a long time. Following are details about their different activities. Alcida A. is 39. She is married to Luis Alonzo Lopez, who works as a driver. Mrs. A. is a seamstress. She makes dresses, pants, skirts, and blouses. She is asking for the loan to buy fabric, buttons, and thread. María de la Paz F. García is 35. She is in a common law marriage with Santos Javier García, who works in a bakery. She sells in the mini-market. She makes and sells tortilla to the neighbors in the community. She has had the mini-market for five years. She is asking for the loan to further stock her store. Roberto A. is 25. He is married to Nixia Yolani F. Bustillo, who is a housewife. He buys and sells seasonal fruit. He carries them in his cousin’s car. He travels to Comayagua, Monelibano, and other places to buy the fruit. He sells them in the Nacaome market, in neighborhoods, and in suburbs of this city. He has been doing this for six years. The loan is to buy two large containers of oranges.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, corn, wood, water, limes, pastas, soft drinks, rice, beans, bread, crackers, sardines, juice, milk, sausage, ham, cheese, preserves, fabric, and needles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y 02 hijas, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Maritza, lleva 4 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, a pesar de algunas dificultades, ella sigue adelante y poco a poco, fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Nos cuenta, que se dedica a confeccionar baby door,  pantalones, blusas y vestidos y que estas ventas le va muy bien. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones.

Maritza, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the “Mujeres Luchadoras” ("Striving Women") communal bank, in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still dependent on her. For the past 4 years, Maritza has worked making clothing. She has persevered in spite of some difficulties, and little by little she has been able to generate her own income and save money. She tells us that she makes baby clothes, pants, blouses and dresses, and that these sales are going very well for her. Her business is located in her own home, which provides a very well-suited environment for receiving her customers. She works in response to orders from her clients. With this loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will purchase fabric of various types in bulk, along with supplies and tools she uses, such as scissors, needles, sewing machine needles, pins and buttons. Today, Maritza feels that she is a very fulfilled woman, with an increased desire to make her remaining dreams come true. She would like to thank Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, along with many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Aydelina

texts.es: La señora Aydelina S.  tiene años de trabajar con adim en este tiempo ha demostrado ser una mujer con carácter, visión en los negocios, trabajadora y comprometida. Es una persona muy inteligente que a pesar de sus carencias educativas ha podido superarse, ella vende ropa y realiza reposterías.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aydelina has worked for years with ADIM. During all this time she has demonstrated herself to be a woman with character and business vision, and is hard working and dedicated. She is a very intelligent person who despite her lack of education has been able to forge ahead. She sells clothes and has a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES AND SUPPLIES TO MAKE PASTRY

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años y es madre D. 05 hijos,  01 que aun depenD. D. ella y está estudiando.

Dora, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas por iniciativa propia, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. Además nos cuenta que sus principales clientes son estudiantes que viven por esa zona,  es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dora, se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar y acondicionar su restaurant al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Fighting Women), in the Tarapoto District, in the Province of San Martin, San Martin Department. She is married, 54 years old and the mother of 5, 1 who is still a dependent and is a student. Dora decided herself to sell prepared food. She has a well-appointed stall in her home. She tells us that every day she has many customers because of the tasty food that she prepares. Her main customers are students who live in the area. She has many regulars who already know her. She is very popular. Currently she is still in the same business and she’s very happy with her daily work. She sells in the mornings and afternoons. She is the one who personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic enthusiasm. With the loan of 1,500 soles, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of the food such as kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, bags of potatoes, a number of chickens,and vegetables amd also utensils to replace her old ones. Thus she can take better care of her customers. Dora is full of life and determined to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as to spruce up and stock her restaurant. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their contribution in starting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food she makes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Las ganas de salir adelante y el impulso optimista que posee, hizo que Maribel iniciara su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, donde poco a poco, trascurrido el tiempo, le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en la actualidad, con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta y orgullosa. Los productos que ofrece son de la línea Avon, donde cada tarde después de realizar sus obligaciones del hogar, se dirige a ofrecer sus productos que tiene en stock y de paso también aprovecha para mostrar sus catálogos a sus clientes, donde sus productos le llegan mensualmente. Como complemento para su negocio también se dedica a la venta de Productos de Gano Café (Productos naturales para la cura de diferentes tipos de enfermedades). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo comprar una  vitrina para exhibir  sus productos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando productos de Gano Café.

Maribel, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the “Fighting Women” Community Bank in Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is living with someone, is 33 years old and the mother of 2 children, who still depend on her and are studying. The desire to get ahead and the optimistic impulse which she possesses led Maribel to initiate her own cosmetics business. Little by little, over time, she obtained very good results and today, at present, she feels very content and proud of herself. She offers Avon products, and every afternoon, after attending to her household obligations, she ventures out to offer the products which she has in stock, and to show her customers catalogs of items which she receives monthly. To complement her business, she also sells Gano Café products (natural products to cure different types of illnesses). With this loan of 1000 new sols she will buy beauty products for her stock, including women's and men's perfumes, creams, powder compacts, lipstick, nail polish, plus a display counter to exhibit her products. Part of the money will be used for purchasing products from Gano Café. Maribel is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her initiate her own business and those of other women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BEAUTY AND HEALTH PRODUCTS

loans.name: Ayda María

texts.es: La señora Ayda María Juares C. es una de las clientas más antiguas de adim y en estos años de estar con nosotros ha demostrado ser una mujer con carácter, visión en los negocios, trabajadora y comprometida. Es una persona muy inteligente que a pesar de sus carencias educativas ya que solo llego a cursar primaria pero eso no la ha detenido en su lucha y poso su propio negocio una pequeña pulperías la cual quiere ver convertida en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Ayda María Juares C. is one of the oldest Adim clients. In the years that she has been with us she has demonstrated herself to be a woman of character with a vision for business. She is hard-working, and she is committed. She is a very intelligent person in spite of her lack of education. She only went to first grade, but that has not stopped her in her fight. She has her own business, a small mini market. She wants to convert it to a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Zoraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 03 hijas, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva 1 año, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Zoraida, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Zoraida belongs to the “Women of the Hill II” cooperative bank, located in the San Martín province. She is married, 33 years old, and the mother of 3 daughters who still depend on her and are in school. She has been dedicating herself to this type of activity for 1 year, providing urban transportation services using her motokar. To do the work, her husband is in charge of moving to different parts throughout the city. She started out with the first loan from Manuela Ramos and, little by little, she saved money to buy replacement parts to improve her services to the inhabitants of the community. With this loan of 1,800.00 Peruvian soles, she will buy parts and oils such as lubricants and sparkplugs in order to provide a better quality of service and to better tend to the customers. Today, she is an independent woman and her and her husband are the ones that make the decisions and manage the business. Zoraida tells us: belonging to a group of women has helped her know more about her rights and how to work together to be respected. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her get a start in the business arena.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudió educación primaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar redes para realizar pesca artesanal dice que eso es lo primero que se malogra, ella vende pescado en la plaza de Juliaca y Capachica, además se dedica también a la elaboración de artesanías en tejido a punto, luego del hilado.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar una casa en Puno.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, and has 4 children. Francisca lives in the community of Ccotos and has an elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Francisca is now requesting a new loan of 700 soles to buy fishing nets. She says that when you buy a net and begin fishing, it is the first piece of equipment that breaks down. Her catch is sold in the town squares of Juliaca and Capachica. In addition, she makes needlepoint and hand-knitted crafts.

Francisca hopes to buy a house in Puno. She enjoys the Communal Bank meeting and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Liz Karen

texts.es:
Liz Karen es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la comunidad nativa Vista Alegre en la ciudad de Iparia, región de Ucayali, tiene 21 años, es madre de un hijo. Liz se dedica a la confección de trajes típicos, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es agricultor. Forma parte  del  Banco  Comunal “yabi II” desde hace un año.
El primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de telas y abarrotes para llevar a su caserío.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Ahora requiere un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de abarrotes en general. La meta de Liz es tener una bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Liz Karen is a hard working and dynamic woman, who lives in her native community of Vista Alegre in the city of Iparia, located in the Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and the mother of one son. Liz dedicates herself to making traditional outfits, as she has a small sewing workshop in her house. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a farmer. She has belonged to the “Yabi II” cooperative bank for one year. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to buy fabrics and groceries to take to her locale. Concurrently, she dedicates herself to selling groceries. She now needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy a variety of supplies. Liz’s goal is to have a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries/supplies to offer for sale.

loans.name: Linda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Linda está integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y con mucho deseos de auto superarse ellas son Marcia del Rosario R. Núñez quien tiene una pequeña venta, Rosa Argentina R. vende ropa y frijoles cocidos, Patricia E. comercializa con ropa y cosméticos y Katherine L. L. tiene una pequeña pulpería. 

Ellas ocuparan el préstamo en sus respectivos negocios aprovechando esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
The Linda Group consists of three strong-willed, hardworking women who have a great desire for self-improvement. They are Marcia del Rosario R. Núñez who has a small retail store, Rosa Argentina R. who sells clothing and cooked beans, Patricia E. who sells clothing and cosmetics, and Katherine L. L. who operates a small grocery store.

They will use the loan for their respective businesses so that they can take advantage of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 48 años, es madre soltera D. cinco hijos todos mayores D. edad, Sadith se dedica a la venta D. zapatos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” desD. hace seis años,  el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en zapatos. En la actualidad requiere un préstamo D. 1400 soles, monto que será utilizado para comprar D. zapatos. La meta D. Sadith es  tener una tienda D. zapatos con diferentes diseños y tallas.
texts.en:
Sadith is a dynamic and hard-working woman, who lives in the Pucallpa region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, and the single mother of five children who are now grown. Sadith dedicates herself to selling shoes. She has been a member of the “Jesus’ Heart” cooperative bank for six years, having received a first loan of 300 Peruvian soles that allowed her to invest in shoes. Currently, she requires a loan of 1,400 soles, an amount that will be used to purchase more shoes. Sadith’s goal is to have a shoe store with different styles and sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Her loan will be invested into the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Alba Marina M. tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la Portuaria, sus hujos viven en Estados Unidos. Alba necesita el credito para ampliar su negocio que es en su casa de habitacion,necesita comprar otro tipo de zapatos para esta navidad. en esta epoca las ventas son muy buenas entonces tiene que aprovechar a comprar mercaderia al por mayor y tiene que viajar a El Salvador para comprar la mercaderia.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, a parte de unas remesas que le envian sus hijos.
ella se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que su calidad de vida esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Alba Marina M. is 60 years old and married. Her husband works on the docks. Her children live in the United States. Alba needs the loan to expand her business, which is in her house. She needs to buy other types of shoes for this Christmas. Sales are very good in the Christmas season. She needs to take advantage of this and buy wholesale merchandise. She has to travel to El Salvador to buy the merchandise. This is her only source of income besides the remittances her children send her. She is very happy that everything is going well for her and that the quality of her life is improving.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes for women, men, and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Mary es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad D. Ancara, del distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Ancara , ella no tuvo la ocasión D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 3 años y su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino y también algunos balones D. gas para venderlo en las ferias D. la zona.  Paralelamente se dedica a las labores propias del campo.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando y generar sus propios ingresos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mary is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank located in the Ancara community in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has six children. She lives in the Ancara community. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan for 300 PEN allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling sheep. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep. She will also buy tanks of gas to sell at the regional fairs. She does her own field work at the same time. Her biggest desire is to keep working to generate her own income. She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and tanks of gas

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
La señora Enedina P. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales han  pagado puntual mente.
Donde actual mente en la casa que esta viviendo es de renta y le están pidiendo que desocupe la vivienda, decido tener su propia casa y un lugar seguro para ella y su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia que tiene para que le puedan entregar su casa y así tener su patrimonio seguro para su familia. 
Doña Enedina tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada y nueva afuera de su vivienda este ingreso es para pagar el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares le ayudara su hija la señora Rosaura Juárez P. quien vive.
texts.en:
Enedina P. has had three loans with FVP, which she paid off punctually. She is currently renting the house where she lives, and they are asking her to leave the house. She decided to have her own house in a safe place for her and her family. She is a single mother, who is responsible for two children. She is asking for a loan to be able to pay the difference that she has to pay so that they will be able to give her the house. That way she will have a secure inheritance for her family. For over two years Enedina has been selling new and used clothes outside of her house. This income is to pay the loan. Her mother, Rosaura Juárez P., helps her with the family expenses. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the difference for a house bought through a government loan

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora Mery es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en Ccotos, estudio educación secundaria (incompleta).

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta  de pescados.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar redes y  corchos para realizar la pesca artesanal, su producción la distribuye en las ferias de Amantan, Ccota y Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es darles educación a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas ya que puede compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the “Juchuy Niño” communal bank, located in the Capachica district of Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ccotos and has partially completed her secondary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past three years. Her first loan, for 300 Peruvian soles, provided increased capital for her business of selling fish. Currently, she needs a new loan of 1000 soles in order to purchase nets and floats for fishing with traditional methods. Her catch is distributed and sold at the Amantan, Ccota and Capachica markets. Her greatest desire is to provide her children with an education. She enjoys saving money and attending information sessions along with her fellow entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing nets and floats

loans.name: Yessika Carolina

texts.es:
la sra. Jessika Carolina Q. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene un hijo de un año, su compañero de hogar trabaja de albañil y ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las cuales las vende en diferentes caserios y colonias de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. ahora necesita el credito para comprar leñe, maiz, cal ya que la demanda es mayor y no produce lo suficiente.
su sueño es poder hacer una casa propia y darle un techo digno a su hijo, ahora viven en la casa de los padres de su marido.
texts.en:
Jessika Carolina Q., 28, is in a common-law relationship and has a one-year-old son. Her life partner works as a bricklayer and she makes and sells tortillas in various farms and neighborhoods in the city of San Lorenzo. She has been working at this task for the past three years and needs financing to buy firewood, corn and lime powder since demand is high but her production is not sufficient to meet it. Her dream is to build her own house to provide her son with a proper home. They currently share her inlaws' home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, water, firewood, matches, lime powder.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Floridelia

texts.es:
la sra. Floridelia B. S. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, Floridelia tiene 30 años de edad, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que ahora que tiene su propio negocio todo le esta saliendo bien, tiene buenas ganancias pero le gustaria mejorarlas y para eso es que necesita el credito, desea invertir en mas variedad de productos.
floridelia vive en el barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su negocio esta bien ubicado ya que por ahi pasan muchas personas.
su sueño es llegar a tener un supermercado y crear fuentes de empleo.
texts.en:
Floridelia B. S., 30, sells popular consumer goods. She has a small grocery store where she stocks all kinds of products. Floridelia tells us that she feels very happy because, now that she has her own business, things are going very well; she earns good profits but would like to increase them and this is the reason she needs this financing. She wants to invest in yet a wider variety of products. Floridelia lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. Her store is well situated since many people pass by it. Her dream is to some day have a supermarket and create jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, churros, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, spices, sardines, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, candles, matches, batteries, safety razors, bread, crackers, juices, notebooks, pencils, balls, chocolate, powdered soft-drink mix, milk, ham, cheese, soups, pasta.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 6 Group

texts.en:
Marie, 40, lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo (Christ and Our Strength), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Marie runs a successful colmado in her community. Colmados are small corner stores that sell anything from bread to batteries. Marie tries to focus on typical Dominican foods such as rice, beans, flour, oil, and fish. Her colmado is located in her home, where she lives with her husband and children.

Life in La Romana can be strenuous. Access to electricity is unreliable at best, running water (if you have any at all) is never potable and the constant threat of hurricanes for half the year weighs heavily on the minds of those whose small homes are made of wood. Despite these difficulties, Marie is optimistic about the future. She hopes to continue investing her profits back into her business and continually expanding her line of products and customer base. In addition, Marie hopes that the extra income will one day allow her to send her children to university. Thank you for lending to Marie and the Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo group!

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, oil and flour.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida tiene 56 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 3 hijos, D. los cuales, solo uno D. ellos vive en su casa.

Su esposo se dedica a la siembra D. zanahorias, espinacas y lechugas en sus propias chacras, pero como ella tiene dolencias en los pies no pueD. desplazarse con mucha facilidad y se limita a apoyarle en los trabajos D. menos esfuerzo.
Pero en temporada D. cosecha busca entre 5 a 8 personas para trabajar en sus chacras, a quienes les paga 15 soles diarios, incluido almuerzo. En esos días Aida prepara para todos el almuerzo y como tiene fama D. tener una muy buena sazón, todos quedan muy satisfechos.

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, ella es una cliente muy puntual y es quien presta su casa para todas las reuniones D. su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo va a utilizar en la compra D. fertilizantes químicos para que abone sus chacras D. hortalizas.
texts.en:
Aida, 56, is married to the father of her three children, of which, only one still lives at home with them. Her husband grows carrots, spinach and lettuces in his own farm but, because she suffers from foot pain, she is unable to get around very easily and is restricted to helping him only with the least strenuous chores. However, during harvest time, he hires 5-8 persons to work the fields for a salary of 15 soles a day each, including lunch. On those days, Aida prepares the lunch for all of them and, because she is famous for her tasty preparations, they are all very satisfied. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is a very punctual client and she lends her house for all the communal bank meetings. The funds requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to use on the vegetable crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela es una mujer de 33 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.
Con una mirada tierna y una sonrisa amplia, atiende todos los días su tienda de abarrotes, la cual implementaron con su esposo en un espacio de su vivienda.
Adicionalmente, Isabela apoya a su esposo en las labores agrícolas, pero la mayor cantidad de tiempo está en su negocio, pues durante todos estos años ha podido captar mucha clientela. 
Ella trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana, preparando los condimentos que vende en su tienda, siendo las 8 de la mañana la hora de mayor demanda.
La mayorías de sus clientes, amas de casa, son quienes comprar los condimentos molidos que elabora, y con estos productos obtiene buenas ganancias, es por ello que se toma el tiempo necesario en licuar las especias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que todo es novedoso para ella. Asimismo, hace el juramento de cumplir puntualmente con todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para comprar más golosinas, pues es el pedido que le han hecho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabela, 33, lives with her life partner and father of their four children in her own house. With her tender look and ample smile, she takes care of her grocery store everyday. She and her husband set up the store in a space in her house. Additionally, Isabela helps her husband with his farming work. But, most of her time is spent in her business. Throughout the years she has been able to attract a lot of customers. She starts working at six in the morning preparing the condiments that she sells in her store. Eight in the morning is when they are in their greatest demand. Most of her customers, housewives, are the ones who buy the ground condiments that she makes. She gets good income from these products. That is why she takes the necessary time to liquefy the spices. This is her first loan with MFP, so everything is new for her. She takes an oath to make all of her payments punctually. The money she is now asking for is to buy sweets, which is what her customers are requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marcia H. es una mujer emprendedora, con deseo de superación, ella es costurera y vende ropa variada, zapatos, sandalias, también hace varios años formo un grupo de danza con sus sobrinos que van a todos los eventos que los invitan, ella es la que hace los traje para el baile por que en cada participación le dan una ayuda económica lo cual comparte con los del baile una parte y la otra para comprar tela oh lo que haga falta. Ella va a comprar mercadería al mercado oriental ropa, tela, zapatos, chapas, adornos para el cabello. El cual vende al contado y al crédito,  entrega a las oficinas del banco y a sus clientas. Tiene 43 años de edad, de tres hijos solo uno tiene a su cargo de 16 años de edad, que esta cursando su secundaria. Los otros dos están casados. Cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio y compro poca ropa y solo  trabajaba por encargo. La idea era poder ayudar  a su esposo a cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz ya que el trabaja como conductor y su salario es bajo. Con este préstamo invertirá  en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar a construir un cuarto e ir poco a podo terminarlo ya que todo esta caro. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo a mejorar su vida personal como en la inversión de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcia H., 43, is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. She is a seamstress and sells assorted clothing, shoes, sandals. Also, a few years ago, she formed a dance troupe with her nieces and nephews and they perform wherever they are invited. She makes all the costumes for the dances and, with each performance's earnings, she shares part with each dance troupe member and part she uses to buy more fabric or whatever else is needed. She buys fabric, clothing, shoes, buttons, hair accessories at the east market which she then sells for cash or credit. She distributes to the bank's offices and to her customers. Of her three children, only a 16-year-old, who is a secondary school student, is still under her care. The idea here is to help her husband with basic household expenses like utilities since he works as a driver and his salary is low. With this financing she will buy building materials such as stone, sand and iron to begin to build a room and little by little finish it since materials are very expensive. She thanks the institution for the help given to improve her personal life and for investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 21 años, por el momento vive en casa de sus padres, con su pareja y madre de su único hijo.

Para poder solventar los gastos de su nueva familia quiere empezar a sembrar sus propios cultivos, por ello quiere comprar plantitas de plátano, por ser un producto de menor inversión, pues tiene la oportunidad de sembrar en las chacras de su padre.
Mientras tanto, viene trabajando como peón para las chacras de sus vecinos y por su trabajo diario le pagan 15 soles, con ello sólo logra cubrir la alimentación diaria de su familia.

Jesús recurre a su primer crédito con MFP y para devolver su préstamo se compromete a trabajar arduamente, ya que quiere ganarse la confianza de sus compañeros de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado lo usará para la compra de 500 plantitas de plátano, y por lo menos 2 sacos de guano de corral, como abono para la tierra.
texts.en:
Jesús, 21, currently lives in his parents' house with his partner, his only son's mother. To meet his new family's expenses he wants to farm his own crops so he wants to buy banana seedlings, since this is a low-cost item, because he has the opportunity to grow them on his father's farm. Meanwhile, he has been working as a laborer on his neighbors' farms for which he's paid a daily salary of 15 soles which is barely enough to cover his family's daily food requirements. Jesús is asking MFP for his first loan and he plans to work very hard in order to repay it since he wants to earn his fellow communal bank members' trust. He will use the money to buy 500 banana seedlings and, at least, two sacks of farm animal guano (natural fertilizer), to fertilize the land.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: Don José Carlos R.,  hace dieciocho años  formo su propio negocio de venta de ropa electrodomésticos, utensilios de plásticos, todo esto logro hacerlo con dinero de su liquidación de su trabajo anterior en donde laboraba en una distribuidora de empaque de carne en los Estado Unidos en donde por mucho años estuvo para poder mantener  a su familia al mandarles las remesas. Logro mejorar también hacer su casa aunque le falto cerrarla completa de concreto, pero esta en lo propio. Lleva once ciclos en Afodenic el cual ha invertido al comercio para elevar las ventas y seguir trabajando. Tiene 55 años de edad, y vive junta a su esposa e hijos seis de los cuales  tres están estudiando para un porvenir mejor en  un trabajo. Vive en villa reconciliación, su esposa trabaja como supervisora de calidad en un supermercado para poder dar los estudios a sus tres hijos y que no le falta nada en sus necesidades, don José con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de ropa, utensilios de trastes y electrodoméstico para mejorar las ventas y así poder obtener mejores ganancias. Agrádese a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Eighteen years ago, José Carlos R., 55, set up his own business, which is the sale of clothing, electrical appliances and plastic utensils with money he got from his settlement from his previous job, which was working for a meat packing company in the United States. For many years he was able to support his family with the funds he'd send back home. He managed, as well, to build his home though he wasn't able to completely finish sealing it with concrete; but it is adequate. He has been involved in eleven lending cycles with Afodenic which he has invested in his business to raise sales and continue working. He lives with his wife and six children, three of whom are studying in order to have better jobs in the future. They live in Villa Reconciliación and his wife works as a quality control supervisor at a supermarket in order to provide their three children with an education and so that they will lack nothing. José will use these funds to buy clothing, kitchen utensils and electric appliances to improve his sales and, thereby, earn better profits. He is grateful to the institution for making possible his business' improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, kitchen utensiles and electric appliances to increase sales.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años, es una persona muy risueña, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su pareja en su casa propia.
Años atrás se proyectó al futuro elaborando 5 viveros de grandes extensiones, de los cuales una parte vendió y la otra la trasplantó en sus chacras, pero nada le hizo presagiar que la plaga de mosquitos atacarían las hojas de sus cultivos y no la pudo controlar a tiempo, perdiendo muchos granos de café. Por ello, sus cosechas el año pasado mermaron notablemente pese a toda la dedicación y empeño puesta en ellas. A pesar de la tristeza, José cree que no todo está perdido, pues cree que podrá recuperarlas durante este año o tal vez el próximo, menciona. 
Sin embargo, el también cuenta con una chacra de plátanos, a la cual no le tenía mucha fe, pero hoy es con esta fruta con la que logra cubrir la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. 

En vista de que quiere recuperar sus cultivos, solicita este primer crédito a MFP, asimismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que está muy agradecido por permitirle ser parte de un banco comunal. Con el dinero comprará fungicidas para erradicar los mosquitos y si le alcanza adquirirá semillas de café para hacer un vivero.
texts.en:
José, 44, is a very cheerful person. He has 4 children and lives with his partner in his own home. Years ago he planned his future by building five large nurseries from which he sold part of the product and part he transplanted to his own farmlands. But nothing prepared him for the mosquito plague that would attack the leaves of his crops and he was unable to control it in time losing many coffee beans as a result. For this reason, his crop yields last year were greatly diminished despite his dedication and hard work. Despite the sadness, José believes that all is not lost because, as he states, he feels he can salvage them this year or next year, perhaps. However, he also planted some bananas; a crop upon which he didn't have great expectations. However, it is precisely this fruit which allows him to provide his children with food and schooling. Since he wants to salvage his crops, he is asking MFP for his first loan which he pledges to repay in a timely fashion since he is very grateful to be allowed to be part of a communal bank. With the funds he will buy fungicides to erradicate the mosquitoes and, if he has any money left over, will buy coffee seeds to start a new nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fungicides.

loans.name: Generation 2006 Group

texts.es: La asociación “Generación 2006” esta formada por doce integrantes, ellas  se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación,  trabajan de forma responsable en todas sus actividades de grupo. Actualmente las socias tienen negocios distintos, por ejemplo  Maria Eugenia Q., que es la presidente de grupo se  dedica a la venta de mercadería  de acuerdo  a la temporada, Jackelyn vende abarrotes, Miriam confecciona  mantas y polleras (pollera= falda tradicional para mujeres de algunas regiones) ,Verónica tiene un puesto de libros y revistas, Samuel es mecánico, Lita vende pañales desechables.Toda la asociacion  desea  obtener mayores ventas, para este objetivo necesitan comprar mercadería, tienen la certeza de  generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer  bienestar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Generation 2006 Association consists of twelve members who meet at the Villa Exaltación community center. They work responsibly in all of their group activities. The members currently have distinct business. For example, Maria Eugenia Q. is the president of the group and sells seasonal merchandise. Jackelyn sells groceries. Miriam produces blankets and “polleras” (traditional skirts worn by women from certain regions). Veronica has a newsstand where she sells books and magazines. Samuel is a mechanic. Lita sells disposable diapers. All of the members want to obtain better sales. For this reason, they need to buy merchandise. They are certain they can generate more revenue to allow them to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Bertha, lleva 10 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Bertha, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad Bertha esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Muy a parte, también se traslada a diferentes pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer sus vestidos, que ella misma confecciona.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Bertha, 34, is a member of the “Mujeres de la Colina II” communal bank, which is in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her partner and has three children, all of whom still are dependent on her. For the past 10 years, Bertha has been a seamstress. Having these skills, she didn't hesitate to set up her own sewing workshop in her home. It is a very well-equipped environment where she tends to her regular customers on a daily basis since she is well known and they require her services. Bertha works based on advance orders placed by her customers and, thanks to the ever-present smile and kindness they get from her, they feel happy and satisfied. Currently, Bertha is very happy and proud of what she has accomplished. And, on another point, she also travels to neighborhing towns to sell her dresses which she herself has made. With the 1,700 sol loan she plans to buy meters of fabric in various colors and kinds, tools she uses, like scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, sewing needles (both hand and machine), pins and buttons. Today, she feels very fulfilled, with stronger desire to reach and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also to many women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
la sra. Adriana Z. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio de venta de refrescos, agua, jugos etc. Adriana Vive en la aldea de Lajero blanco carretera a Cedeño, este lugar es muy caliente, ya que cedeño es una playa de la costa del pacifico de Honduras.
este tipo de producto se vende mucho aqui en esta localidad ya que hace mucha calor en todo el dia y las personas buscan tomar algo helado y refrescante para calmar la sed. 
Adriana busca comprar mas mercaderia ya que tiene una refrigeradora vacia y necesita llenarla de prodcuto para tenerlo bien helado y asi mejorar sus ventas, ademas que los carros que reparten los refrescos llegan una vez por semana y su producto se le termina muy rapido y para comprar mas tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Çholuteca es por tal razon que ella necesita el credito.
texts.en:
Adriana Z. is a merchant. She sells soft-drinks, water, juices, etc. Adriana lives in the Lajero Blanco village, located along the Cedeño highway. The climate here is very hot since Cedeño is a beach on Honduras' pacific coast.
