La meta de Madeleide es ampliar su bodega y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Madeleide is a dynamic and determined woman. She lives in the Yarinacocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 41 years old and the mother of two children, one of them is already an adult and helps her as much as he is able to. She sells groceries from a store setup inside her home. She also works with her husband fishing.
She has been a member of the communal bank “Nuevo Edén” for two years. She has always been on time with her payments. Her first loan was used to buy merchandise for the grocery store.
Madeleide is now requesting a loan for 2000 soles that will be used to buy more merchandise for her grocery store and to buy fishing accessories. Madeleide’s goal is to expand her store and to continue to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región  de Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de tres hijos y casada, se dedica a la venta y repartición  de productos de belleza,  trabaja junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús” desde hace cinco años. El primer crédito que obtuvo le permitió invertir en colonias, talcos, lápiz labial, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1800 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza y repuestos para su movilidad. La meta de Rosa es ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Rosa Angelica is an enterprising and dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She sells and distributes beauty products.

Rosa became a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank five years ago. Her first loan was used to purchase colognes, talcum powders, and lipsticks. She currently needs a loan of 1800 soles to buy beauty products and spare parts for her vehicle. Her goal is to help her children in completing their higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & spare parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es:
Mildred  es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes que funciona en su casa. Su esposo es profesor jubilado. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caseritas” desD. hace dos años, el primer que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que utilizó en la compra D. algunos artículos para su bodega.
Este crédito D. 2000 soles será utilizado una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en la compra D. una congeladora y poner sus bebidas gaseosa, carnes, etc. La meta D. Mildred es surtir su negocio y ampliarlo. Además esta agradecida con la ONG Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos que le dieron pudo implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mildren is a dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 65 years old and the mother of four adult children. She has a small grocery store that she operates out of her house. Her husband is a retired teacher.

Mildred joined the Communal Bank “Las Caseritas” two years ago. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase items for her store. With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy merchandise for the grocery store and use part of the loan to purchase a freezer for storing sodas, meats, and other products. Mildred’s goal is to expand her business and keep it well-stocked. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing loans that have kept her business in operation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery products & a freezer

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: La señora Milagros es una mujer trabajadora y perseverante, vive en la cuidad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, madre de una hija que es mayor de edad, Milagros se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y pollos brostrer, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, también vende salchipollo por las noches, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se desempeña como perito forestal. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas. Este crédito de 1000 soles  será utilizado para comprar artículos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, pollos y otros insumos más para vender. La meta de Milagros es tener un galpón y dedicarse a la crianza de pollos para distribuirlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milagros is a hard-working and persistent woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old, and the mother of one daughter who is now grown. Milagros dedicates herself to selling salchipapas (sausage and French fries) and roasted chickens every day of the week. She also sells salchipollo (fried chicken with French fries) in the evenings. She counts on the support of her husband, who works as a forest ranger. She has been a member of the “Carmen Cabrejos” cooperative bank for two years, having received a first loan of 300 Peruvian soles that allowed her to invest in soft drinks. This loan of 1,000 soles will be used to buy items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, chicken and other ingredients to sell. Milagros’ goal is to have a shed and dedicate herself to raising chickens to distribute to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, chicken, and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, madre de tres hijos y uno de ellos es mayor de edad. Ella se dedica al alquiler de motokar, además vende zapatos y productos de belleza además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es Economista. Olivia es una de las integrantes D. Banco Comunal “Las Caseritas” desde hace cinco años, Olivia empezó con crédito de 300 soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de zapatos, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar zapatos y carteras. La meta de Olivia es llegar a tener una zapatería.
texts.en:
Olivia is an enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is now grown. She dedicates herself to renting out a motokar, and she also sells shoes and beauty products. She counts on the support of her husband, who is an economist. Olivia has been a member of the “Las Caseritas” cooperative bank for five years. She started out with a loan of 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to invest in shoes. She now needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which will be used to buy shoes and purses. Olivia’s goal is to manage to establish a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy shoes and purses to sell to the general public.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernarda Lucila

texts.es: La Señora Bernarda Lucia tiene la edad de 41 años, tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo, sus propósitos son de seguir con su negocio adelante para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus deseos son de seguir luchando para darle mejoras a su vivienda. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa nueva. Hace más de  5 años, ella inicia este negocio porque necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos para su familia y acude a la venta de estos productos, por lo que logra ver los resultados de sus sacrificios. Es el destino del  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos como pantalones, faldas, camisolas, shorts y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Sra. Bernarda Lucia is 41 years old and has one dependent child. She intends to move her business forward so that she can support her family. In addition, she hopes to continue working hard so that she can make improvements to her home.

Bernarda sells new clothing. She started her business 5 years ago as a means of generating income for her family. Everything she has achieved has been a result of many sacrifices. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase trousers, skirts, camisoles, shorts, and undergarments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Semira

texts.es: Semira  es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 29 años, madre de dos hijos mayores, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro, ya que este negocio le genera  un ingreso diario, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el cual es albañil. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Lupuna” desde hace seis años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de ropa de segunda, para vender en su casa. Con este crédito de 1000 soles, dará mantenimiento de su motocar. La meta de Semira es comprar otro motocar y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Semira is a dynamic and persevering woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 29 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her main business is renting out a “motocarro” (a three-wheeled motorized vehicle), which brings in daily earnings. A second business is the sale of second-hand clothing. She also counts on the support of her husband, a brick mason.

Semira has been a member of the “La Lapuna” communal bank for six years. Her first loan, 300 soles, was used to buy used clothing to sell from her home. This loan of 1000 soles will be used for maintenance of the motocarro.

Semira’s goal is to buy a second motocarro and continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Parts for maintenance of vehicle

loans.name: Nanett

texts.es:
La señora Nanett, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Nanett, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, es una mujer que poco a poco, fue incrementando su negocio y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Aleydith, vende sus productos de belleza de diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. También se dedica a la venta de golosinas, ubicada en su misma casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra de golosinas como: bolsas de  caramelos, chupetines, chocolates. 

Nanett,  a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nanett is a member of the “Mujeres de la Colina II” community bank, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is 39 years old, lives with a partner, and has two dependent children. Nanett’s business is cosmetics sales. She been growing her business little by little and getting known by more clients. The business is going well. She sells several beauty product lines, such as Unique, Esika, and Avon, and is happy with the results. Nanett also sells candies from her home. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase beauty products for her stock, such as perfumes for women and men, creams, compacts, lipstick, nail polish, and also another display case. She will also invest part of the money in candies, such as bags of caramels, suckers, and chocolates. Nanett, at her age, is setting an example for many women who start a business and, with perseverance, achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for helping her start her and other women start and grow their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y sus cinco hermanos en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la música desde hace más de seis años. Estudió en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo y aprendió a tocar la trompeta de varas. Actualmente trabaja en algunas bandas y orquestas de la región que contratan sus servicios de manera eventual. Los ingresos que percibe los utliza para apoyar al sostenimiento de la familia y solventar sus gastos personales.

Alberto nos cuenta orgulloso que hace poco creó junto a su familia una orquesta a la que han llamado Unión y Progreso. Por ahora sus integrantes se encuentran trabajando arduamente para comprar los instrumentos que necesitan para formalizarse y empezar a recibir contratos.

Debido a que la empresa que está formando junto a su familia aún necesita de capital y que los ingresos que percibe no le bastan para aportar al crecimiento de su orquesta, Alberto ha pensado en empezar a trabajar en el negocio de venta de ropa: tiene planeado comprar la ropa en la ciudad de Chiclayo y venderla a los pobladores de los caseríos aledaños, ya que la zona en donde vive no cuenta con las facilidades de transporte necesarias para trasladarse a la ciudad. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer que su orquesta crezca y sea reconocida a nivel nacional. El es un joven trabajador, empeñoso y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Alberto is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents and five siblings in the village of La Pava. This community is in the District of Mochumi, Lambayeque Province, located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Alberto has been pursuing music for more than 6 years. He studied at an institute in Chiclayo and learned how to play the trombone. He currently works with a few bands and orchestras in the region who hire him as needed. Alberto uses his earnings to contribute toward the household and cover his personal expenses.

He says that he is proud that his family recently formed a band called “Union and Progress”. For now they are working hard to buy all the instruments they need to become official and start booking engagements.

Since the family band is in need of capital and his earnings are not enough to cover the start-up costs, Alberto decided to start a business selling clothing. He plans to buy the merchandise in Chiclayo and sell his products to residents of the surrounding villages since public transportation is not available. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

His greatest hope is that his band will be successful and become recognized nationally. This young man is hardworking, determined, and very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Julia Kelly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Kelly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 32 años y no tiene hijos. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le motivó a crear su propio negocio de Servicio de Locutorio, se inicio con  S/. 800.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela, dando el buen trato que les brinda. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando con más cabinas y considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará tarjetas virtuales. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de madera y tripley, para implementar una cabina más.

Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Julia Nelly belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 32, in a common law marriage, and does not have children. Strength and perseverance characterize her. She was motivated to create her own business, a calling center. She started with 800 PEN. Day by day she was gaining customers by giving them the good deals that she offers. She currently continues with this business. Considering her customer demand, she is expanding with more booths. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy calling cards. She will use part of the money to buy wood and “tripley” (Amazonian wood) to set up one more booth. She says that she works with a lot of optimism. She is grateful for the opportunity to have loans that help her develop herself as a woman and as a small business person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calling cards

loans.name: Alis Marisol

texts.es:
Alis es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el caserío Los Bances, distrito de Pacora, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que lo que su esposo percibe como trabajador de un molino de arroz no es suficiente para sostener los gastos de educación de sus tres hijos (uno de ellos tiene problemas con el lenguaje por lo que debe recibir educación especial), ella se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar a solventar los gastos familiares: desde hace tres años se dedica a la comercialización de los diversos productos que cosechan los agricultores de la zona: los compra luego de la cosecha para venderlos a un distribuidor que viene a recoger la mercadería a su casa.

Por otro lado se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, las cuales vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Ella desea comprar algunas ovejas para criarlas y luego venderlas; por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre entregada, trabajadora y optimista. Su sueño es poder vivir en el pueblo cercano para instalar una tienda y con ella seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alis is a 33 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the town of Los Bances, District of Pacora, Lambayeque Province, which is located 1½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Her husband works at a rice mill, but his income is not enough to cover the educational expenses for their three children (one of them has problems with language and is currently enrolled in special education classes). Therefore, Alis concluded that she needed to work and help with the household finances. For three years she has been selling various crops grown by local farmers. She later decided to sell to a distributor who comes to her house to pick up the produce.

In addition, Alis raises and sells sheep. Her customers are livestock dealers who pass through the area. She wants to buy some sheep to raise for later resale. For this reason, she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Alis is committed, hardworking, and optimistic. Her dream is to live in the nearest town so that she can open a store as a means of providing continued support to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep to raise for later resale

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva 07 años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Ludith, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Ludith belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 33, in a common law marriage, and has two children. The children, still dependent upon her, go to school. She has been working in this type of activity for seven years. She offers urban transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). Her husband drives it through different parts of the city. She started with her first loan from Manuela Ramos. Little by little, she was saving. With this money she was buying replacement parts to improve the service to the inhabitants of the community. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, circuit boxes, and spark plugs. This way she will offer better service and take much better care of the customers. Today she is an independent woman. She and her husband are the ones who make the decisions and administer her business. Ludith, as she is affectionately called, tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights. Together they make sure these are respected. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start in the field of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to improve her service

loans.name: Magsayo

texts.en: Mrs. V. Magsayo is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and is blessed with four adult children. V. owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. In 2003, V. joined PMPC to obtain its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 16th loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos en el caserío Pocitos, distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la confección de pantalones desde que tenía 18 años de edad, su padre le enseñó esta labor y trabajaron juntos hasta que se casó; desde entonces trabaja junto a su esposa: confeccionan un buen número de prendas y las venden por temporadas en las ciudades de Cajamarca y Piura.

Cuando no se encuentran confeccionando pantalones se dedican a la costura. Jacinto también apoya a su padre en las labores agrícolas. Los ingresos percibidos por estas actividades le ayudan a solventar los gastos de alimentacion y educación de sus hijos, todos en edad escolar.

Jacinto desea confeccionar prendas para esta temporada navideña, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar el material (telas de poliéster y drill) por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es seguir sacando adelante a su negocio y hacer mejoras en su casa que está construida de material rústico. Este es su segundo crédito con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus coutas.
texts.en:
Jacinto is a 40 year old father. He lives with his wife and their five children in the village of Pocitos. This community is in the District of Mórrope, Lambayeque Province, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jacinto has been manufacturing trousers since he was 18 years old. His father taught him this trade and continued to work with him until he got married. He now works with his wife, and as a couple, they are able to produce a number of different items based on the season and sell them in the cities of Cajamarca and Piura.

When he is not sewing, Jacinto helps his father with his farming duties. The income he receives from his various business activities goes toward the cost of feeding and educating his school-age children.

Jacinto wants to produce clothing for the Christmas season, but he does not have enough capital to purchase materials (polyester and cotton drill fabric). For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Jacinto dreams of moving his business forward and making improvements to his home, since it is built out of basic materials. This is his second loan with our Institution and he has demonstrated that he is responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making trousers

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es: La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Lleva 07 años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.Ludith, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Ludith belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 33, in a common law marriage, and has two children. The children, still dependent upon her, go to school. She has been working in this type of activity for seven years. She offers urban transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). Her husband drives it through different parts of the city. She started with her first loan from Manuela Ramos. Little by little, she was saving. With this money she was buying replacement parts to improve the service to the inhabitants of the community. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, circuit boxes, and spark plugs. This way she will offer better service and take much better care of the customers. Today she is an independent woman. She and her husband are the ones who make the decisions and administer her business. Ludith, as she is affectionately called, tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights. Together they make sure these are respected. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start in the field of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to improve her service

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es: La señora Gulnara, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes.Anteriormente Gulnara, se dedicaba a la venta de frutas, en el Mercado Central y por motivos de salud dejo de ejercer este tipo de actividad, hoy en día lleva 05 años, dedicándose al servicio de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.Gulnara, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Gulnara belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 49, in a common law marriage, and has two children. The children are now independent. She previously worked selling fruit in the Central Market. But, for health reasons she had to stop doing this type of work. She has now been working in this type of activity for five years. She offers urban transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). Her husband drives it through different parts of the city. She started with her first loan from Manuela Ramos. Little by little, she was saving. With this money she was buying replacement parts to improve the service to the inhabitants of the community. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, circuit boxes, and spark plugs. This way she will offer better service and take much better care of the customers. Today she is an independent woman. She and her husband are the ones who make the decisions and administer her business. Gulnara tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights. Together they make sure these are respected. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start in the field of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to improve her service

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: La señora Emerita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”,  Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 62 años; 06 hijos que ya son independientes.Anteriormente Lucia se dedicaba a la Venta D. frutas y sus ganas D. salir adelante, con sus propios medios le ha valido para implementar su propio negocio D. Alquiler D. habitaciones, ubicada en su misma casa.  En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, que vienen D. otras zonas por estudio o trabajo. Sus ganancias los obtiene cada fin D. mes, en los pagos D. sus habitaciones, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas D. pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo D. negocio. Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, comprará accesorios, para modificar los servicio higiénicos (baños y duchas) D. los cuartos y valdes D. pintura, para dar una mejor infraestructura a sus habitaciones.Emerita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Emerita belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 62, married, and has six children. The children are now independent. Lucia previously sold fruit. Her desire to get ahead by her own means served her in setting up her own business of renting rooms in her own house. She currently has loyal customers who come from other areas to study or work. She gets her earnings at the end of each month when the rooms are paid for. She tells us that she is very responsible with her payments, and she plans to continue in this manner and set up another type of business. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy accessories to modify the hygienic services (bathrooms and showers) for the rooms. She will also buy buckets of paint to improve the infrastructure of the rooms. She has a lot of strength to keep working and to get ahead in order to have a peaceful old age. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: At the age of 48, Antonia manages a transportation business. Her weekly net income is 600 PHP. She was also engaged in a vending business for almost 20 years, but unfortunately she wasn't able to pursue that business—that's why she switched to motorcycle transport. She desires to avail of a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP, to be used for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle. She is married to Cifriano, a driver. Their marriage was blessed with two children. They are Cherry, 21 years old, and Xavier, 20 years old, both high-school graduates. Their family resides in the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, one of the towns in Isabela Province. Their house is near an elementary school.

loans.use: For repair and maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita G. is 23 years old, living in Barangay Mozzozzin Norte, Sta. Maria Isabela. She is happily married and blessed with a child named Angelica Mae, who is 5 years old and in kindergarten in their village. Clarita is engaged in the retail of rice. Her husband is a local farmer and also a Barangay Councilor in their village. Since her husband does not have regular work, she started her own business as another source of income. Together they are helping one another to provide for their basic needs. Clarita wants to improve her business; thus she is asking to borrow a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She plans to buy several sacks of rice and other commodities that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Evangieline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangieline G. is 42 years old and from the village of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. She is married to Mr. Virgilio G., 43 years of age. They are blessed with three children: Benjie, Virgilio Jr., and Ronald. Evangieline has been engaged in the business of fattening pigs for two years already. Her goal in life is to uplift her family's living conditions. She and her husband are really doing their best to give their children a better and more fruitful future. Even though they faced a lot of trials, they are very positive that they can achieve their goal as long as they believe that God will guide them.

Evangieline needs additional capital for the purchase of her pigs' feed. She is asking Kiva lenders to consider her as one of their clients, so she can continue her business. She wants to borrow a 5,000 PHP loan, which will serve as a big help in making her business productive.

loans.use: Additional capital for the purchase of her pigs' feed

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 31 years old and married to Gary, who is an overseas factory worker. They are blessed with two children: Daniel, six years old; and Irene Mae, two years old. Michelle is hoping that she can sustain the needs of her family with the income earned through her store business. Michelle is a store owner within the village of Quezon, San Isidro. They are happily living there. She would like to expand and buy additional merchandise so that she can provide for the needs of her family. In this regard, she is requesting 5,000 PHP as additional capital for buying merchandise for her store. She would be thankful if her loan request were granted. Expanding her business is one of her dreams, so that she can improve her way of living.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is 23 years old and happily married to Joselito, a local farmer. The couple are blessed with one child, Jay Gabriel, who is a year old. They live in the peaceful village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan.

For the past four years, Grace has run a sari-sari store (community-based store) business in their village. She wants her business to grow as the income from the store is a great help to her husband in providing for their daily needs.

Grace now wants to borrow additional capital for her business since she needs more merchandise to improve her store. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock to meet customer demand. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Maria Hilmer

texts.es: La señora Maria Hilmer, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Lideres II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 47 años y es madre 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Maria Hilmer, lleva 03 años dedicándose a la venta de condimentos, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Nº 02 de su Ciudad. Maria Hilmer es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, que a pesar de su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir al mercado, para vender sus productos, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes.En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su puesto a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará cominos, colorantes, achiotes, ajinomotos, clavo de olor en kilos y diferentes especies, para mantener satisfechos y contentos a sus clientes.Maria Hilmer, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Hilmer is a member of the Mujeres Lideres II (Women Leaders) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the San Martin Province, department of San Martin. She is a 47-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 6 children, 2 of whom still depend on her financially. Maria Hilmer has been selling condiments for a living for the past 3 years. Her business is located in the Number 2 Market in her city. Maria is a hardworking woman who, despite her age, does not have any difficulties in getting ahead with her work. She states that she feels really good about what she does. She wakes up at 5:00 am to go to the market and sell her products. She used to sell provisions. She is currently well-known by her customers, who frequent her stand to purchase what every homemaker needs. She attends to them personally with the charisma that she is known for. With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, she will purchase cumin, colorings, annatto, chili pepper seasoning mix, cloves and assorted spices by the kilo so that she can keep her customers satisfied. Maria Hilmer now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to get as far ahead as God gives her the strength to do so. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for having helped her out with launching her business, and for helping so many women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condiments

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito V. is popularly known as “Jay-r” in his village in Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. After graduating from high school, he married Analiza and they are now blessed with two children. They want to improve their standard of living to give their children a better future. Despite the hardships and difficulties, they have strong faith and determination to achieve their goal through patience and hard work.

As a way of earning income, Jay-r buys and sells rice in their village and also manages a piggery. Jay-r and his wife want to improve their businesses to earn a higher income. Due to financial constraints, they want to borrow 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to strengthen their capital and improve their business. They believe that through hard work they will achieve their goal.

loans.use: As additional capital for rice business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: La señora Lilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Lideres II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 21 años y es madre de 01  hijo,  que aún dependen de ella.Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco hace, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/.300 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprara pescado frescos en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Lideres II” (Women Leaders II), which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of one dependent child.

Lilia started selling fresh fish with the intention of helping her family financially. She started with capital of 300 soles and invested that money well, so her business continues to this day but in greater quantities and with more variety. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy fresh fish by the kilo that is produced in the region as well as raised off the coast of the country. The variety of fish she will obtain includes bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapia, toyo, and pejerey. The will enable her to maintain sufficient inventory for her business and satisfy the discerning tastes of her customers.

Lilia says she is excited to be part of a group of women who have helped her overcome difficulties. Now she is able to face challenges with tremendous strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is married to Elly who is tricycle operator. They are blessed with four loving children namely: Mark Alvin - 18 years old, a college student; Mark Jim Narel - 13 years old, a high school student; Angelica Mae - 11 years old, an elementary pupil; and Glydee Hann - 3 years old. Elizabeth’s family lives happily in the village of Quezon, San Isidro.

Elizabeth manages a general store and at the same time she is vending vegetables and fruits in their village. She is thankful because she is able to improve her store.

Elizabeth would like to buy more vegetables, fruit and merchandise for her store so that she is able to generate more income for the educational needs of their children. In this regard, she would like to obtain a loan as additional capital for improving her business. She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000. She would be very thankful if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Julia Rosario

texts.es: La señora Julia Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Lideres II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 04  hijos,  02 que aún dependen D. ella.Lleva 10 dedicándose a la venta D. pescado fresco, ubicada en el Mercado central D. su Distrito, llevada por la intención D. ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital D. S/.500 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que en la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad D.  especies.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprara pescado frescos en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los D. la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto D. su clientela. Julia Rosario, manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer a un grupo D. mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Julis Rosario, 50, is a member of the "Mujeres Lideres II" communal bank which is located in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of 4 children, two of whom still depend on her. For ten years she has sold fresh fish from a stall in the central market in her district. Inspired by the need to contribute to her family's income and having 500 soles that were very well invested, she is able still to be engaged in this business but now with a greater variety and quantities of species. With this 1,000 sol loan she means to buy kilograms of locally-produced fresh fish as well as fish from the country's coastal regions like: bocachico (a fresh-water, migratory fish), palometas (pomfret, an important food fish), toa, gamitada (a tasty river fish from the Amazon basin), tilapia, toyo, pejerrey (smelt), to keep her business well-stocked and satisfy her customers' demanding taste. Lulia Rosario is happy to belong to a group of women who have helped her overcome obstacles that at times arose but now she can face with great strength.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina, 57 is involved in retailing mung beans and rice in her village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Every time she sells her commodities, her net income is Php 2,000.

Rufina wants to obtain a loan of Php 9,000 from lenders to purchase some bags of rice to sell again in the village. She wants to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's quality of life.

Rufina is married to Mr. Francisco T., who is a farmer. Their marriage is blessed with six children, five of whom are already married. She hopes that her requested loan from Kiva will be granted immediately to help her business to become productive.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Soth Khoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in the Ba Khong Khang Kaet village of TaK. province in Cambodia make up this village bank loan group. They are seeking this group loan for various purposes, depending on their business operations.

Mrs. Soth K., for example, is the village bank president, and she is a farmer. Indeed, she owns a 1-hectare field of land, where she cultivates rice, but she also breeds pigs in her house. Since her business has been doing well, she decided to ask for loan to buy piglets for breeding purposes. Ultimately, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Soth K. is a widow with two children, who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Roath Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of thirteen members, is located in DaeU. Kray village in Takeo province, and they plan to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Roath S. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nheom Houn, is a recycling collector who collects empty bottles, cans and so on. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Roath S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Roath S. is the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Choeurn Pich Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of fourteen people, is located Daeum Kray village in Takeo province. Mrs. Choeurn P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and she owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sun Hom, is a beef seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more beef for her husband's business. Mrs. Choeurn P. is the mother of three children. One is employed in a garment factory, another is a guard and the youngest one is studying at the local school.

loans.use: to buy more beef for her husband's business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida sells red eggs (salted duck eggs coloured red to distinguish them from fresh eggs) within the village of Villa Marcos, Ramon. She is married to Felipe who is a farmer.

This couple would like to have a better living through the business they manage but lack finances. Zenaida would like to ask for financial support of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She would be very grateful if this amount is approved so that she can develop her red egg vending business. She believes that through this loan her business will somehow become productive because she can produce more red eggs.

Zenaida also shared that her determination to become successful in life motivates her to work harder. She just hopes that lenders will become generous to approve her loan.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo R. is 35 years old and married to Maria Nela who is also 35 years old. Leonardo is from Camarunggayan, Aurora, Isabela. The couple is blessed with two angels namely: Bea Lobel and Lea Loreine. Bea Lobel is seven years old and Lea Loreine is only five years of age.

Leonardo wants to help his wife because of their living conditions. He wants to improve their living conditions while he is still young and strong for the welfare of his children. He is also saving for the future education of his two lovely angels.

Leonardo wants to borrow Php 5,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle because it is his main source of income. He’s hoping that the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders will be considered.

loans.use: To use for the maintenance of his tricycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann S. lives in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sap, is a motorbike taxi driver. Now Mrs. Sarann S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, sewing machine, and she would use the rest of money to repair motorbike. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a tailor while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, sewing machine, and she would use the rest of money to repair motorbike.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeun Y. is a villager in the Doem Rom Del village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies for the paddy. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and hire laborers to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Hang Hen, is a laborer. Mrs. Savoeun Y. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is attending the local school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: Chan Sopha

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Sopha U. is a villager in Doem Rom Del village in Takeo province. She is a middle woman in the rice business. Her husband, Mr. Huong Soeu, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have money to pay for plowing. Thus, Mrs. Chan Sopha U. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use the rest of loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the rice field. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are farmers and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn K. is 39 years old and lives in Ank Prasat village in Takeo province. She raises ducks. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 1000 more ducklings for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Dorn, is farmer who owns 2.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy 1000 more ducklings

loans.name: Onh

texts.en:
Mrs. Onh D. lives in Ream Andoeuk village in Takeo province. She sells rice and soup. Her husband, Mr. Yaem Muoy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family.

Mr. Yaem Muoy wants to start his own business charging batteries. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Onh D. decided to request a loan to buy the equipment he needs, and she would use the rest of the money to buy more supplies for her own business.

She is 51 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a soup seller and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy equipment for charging batteries.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Y. lives in Ta Saom village in Takeo province. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The others are attending the local school. Mrs. Sok Y. sells traditional medicine. Mr. Koem Pech, is a construction worker and a farmer. He owns a small plot of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Sok Y. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  This will help her diversify and improve her income and provide better for her children. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mrs. Chek K. is a villager in Trapaing Khlout village in Takeo province. T She has couple has two children, one of whom is a driver while the other is attending the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Yoem Yun, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. Mrs. Chek K. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her family. Diversifying their income will increase their income and standard of living. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family for using.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch T. lives in Prey Sbat village in Takeo province. She is a seller. Her husband, Mr. Chin Ra, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Touch T. decided to request for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to use for plowing.

Mrs. Touch T. is 33 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and to use for plowing

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Mr. Jonas A., who is 29 years old, is engaged in the pig-fattening business. He also manages a farm lot. His wife, Sherilyn, who is 32 years old, is usually at his side, helping him manage their hog-raising business. However, at present she is seven months pregnant and not able to help him clean the pig pens, so Jonas is doubling his time in caring for the animals.

He said that the fattening of pigs is a good business, because at the same time he can work in their field. Due to financial constraints, he was not able to buy a supply of feed for his hogs, so he is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his pigs. As an optimistic person, he believes that Kiva lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Noeurn Y. is 62 years old and lives in Trapaing Saom village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Art Noup, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Now Mrs. Noeurn Y. is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and plowing to reduce her expenditures. She has four children; one is a construction worker, another is a hairdresser, and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and plowing

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
With their interest in improving their standard of living, Marites and her husband help each other to generate a bigger income so they can provide the needs of their family. Marites manages her general store, while her husband is busy in his barber shop. They are both striving hard to earn an income for the expansion of their businesses. Though they don’t have children yet, they still would like to double their income.

Marites is able to generate an income of $62 a week, but due to the high cost of commodities, she is in need of funds for business maintenance and improvement. Marites is requesting 5,000 PHP for her business expansion. She is praying and hoping that she can obtain this amount.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store expansion and maintenance

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. lives in Trapaing Saom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nget Seng, is a rice miller and a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from their house, it is difficult for him to get there. Thus, Mrs. Sokha K. decided to ask for a loan to add her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband drive to work. She is 47 years old and the mother of three children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband drive to work.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom N. lives in Trapaing Svay Village, in the Takeo Province of Cambodia.  She is a grocer and her husband, Khat Bun Thorn, is a farmer.  He owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice and breeds pigs.  His pig breeding business is going well, and he wants to expand it.  Srey Mom N. is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed for the breeding business.  She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband is also presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed for the breeding business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene H. is married to Mr. Nerry who works as a laborer at La Suerte rice mill in Aurora, Isabela. Arlene is 39 years old and engaged in the selling of goods in her variety store. She has been in this business for one year, and it helps her to assist in providing the educational needs of her four children. Three of her children are already in college, while the other one is currently enrolled in high school. She is grateful because her husband also helps her provide for their children's needs.

Arlene wants to have her own savings to improve her business. It is one of her dreams, because the income from her store is very beneficial to her family, especially in covering her children's expenditures. She is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP for additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund A. is from the village of Sili, Aurora, Isabela. He is 23 years old and works as a tricycle operator in his village. He wants to improve the living conditions of his family. He and his wife are helping each other provide the necessities for their children. His wife, Angelie Mae, is a housewife, and is the one who takes care their children. Sometimes she works for someone else as a laborer and is paid by the day. She washes someone else's clothes and cleans their house.

Raymund wants to maintain the needs of his two children, Rey Angela and Ghio. Rey Angela is three years old and Ghio is only three months old. Raymund is applying for a loan from the Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his tricycle. He is asking to borrow 5,000 PHP.

loans.use: maintenance of his tricycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is engaged in vending frozen food in the village of Rizal Santiago City. She is thankful because she has her loving husband and children. She is married to Joey, who is a hollow block maker. They have three children: Jhoana Mae, ten years old and an elementary student; Eizelle Ann, five years old; and Bea, two months old. Josephine would like to buy additional frozen foods so that she can sustain the needs of her family.  However, due to insufficient funds, she needs to borrow 4,000 PHP from the KIVA lenders so she can buy more frozen food to sell in order to meet her customers' demands and to make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
Al L. is 28 years old and single. He is living in the peaceful place of Barangay San Roque Enrile, Cagayan, together with his parents and siblings. He has been operating a sari-sari store business (community-based variety store) in their village for four years. He is also engaged in the rice-retailing business as another source of income to help provide the needs of his parents.

He wants his business to grow, for it is a great help in meeting the needs of his family. He is able to assist his parents by earning an income that is being utilized for the daily allowances of his siblings, who are attending school. He wants to borrow additional capital for his business because he needs more merchandise, such as rice, biscuits, canned goods and soft drinks, for the improvement of his store. He is in need of 7,000 PHP, and this will be used to buy more goods to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes that Kiva lenders will consider his request.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is a hardworking person who lives in the village of Mozzozzin Norte, Sta.Maria Isabela. She is 30 years old and married to Fedrick, who is also 30. Fedrick is working in Maryland as a Booker (agent/manager). They are blessed with three children: Rizeth,15 years old and a junior high school student; Andrew Jerald, 13 years old and a first year high school student; and Elton Jhon, 11 years old and a fifth grade student.

As a mother, Jocelyn is hoping to provide the best future possible for her children. For that reason, she is striving hard to maintain her business, and hopes that someday she will be able to expand it into a more stable business. Jocelyn has been engaged in the hog-raising business for five years. She needs additional capital to purchase more hogs to raise and to buy a supply of feed. She is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders, which she will use to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs. She is hoping that her loan will be approved, because it will contribute a lot to the progress of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a supply of feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Josenilo

texts.en:
Josenilo B. is 43 years old. He is single and lives in the village of General Balao Solana,Cagayan.

He has been cultivating a vegetable farm in his backyard for almost ten years. His business has been his partner in sustaining the needs of his family members. His parents also assist him by selling the harvested vegetables in their village market. However, their income is not enough to sustain their needs and their small farm, so Josenilo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds for the farm. The loan will help him to achieve his dreams and his goals in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 42 years old and married to Crisensio S.. They are peacefully living in the village of Purok 2 Villa Marcos, Ramon. They are grateful because they are blessed with three children: Mea Anne, who is 19 years old and a college student; Maricris, who is 16 years old and a fourth-year high school student; and Mark Anthony, who is 15 years old and a third-year high school student. The couple wants all of their children to finish their education, because they believe that education is the only thing that they can offer to them besides their love.

Nenita and Crisensio are striving hard to provide the needs of their children, especially in providing the tuition fees, allowances and other things needed for their schooling. Crisensio is engaged in rice farming, and Nenita is managing their sari-sari (variety) store. She would like to buy additional merchandise for her store, but she doesn't have enough capital, so she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for the improvement and expansion of her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her variety store business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
“I would like to sustain our business and somehow expand it in the future, because it is my goal to help my husband in supporting the needs of our family, especially the education of our children,” Susana S. said. She is helping her husband earn a living by collecting and selling firewood in their village. During weekends, their children also help her collect wood, and she is very grateful to them because they know that her business means a lot to their family. Susana is married to Pedro, a local farmer in their village. They are helping each other to provide for the needs of their family, especially the education of their children who are still studying. They are blessed with five children: Antonio, 33 years old and a high school graduate; Orlan, 29 years old and a high school graduate; Eric, 21 years old and an elementary school graduate; Maximo, 15 years old and a senior high school student; and Christian, 11 years old and a fifth grade student.

Susana wanted to become an entrepreneur, but lack of capital prevented her from sustaining her wood business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP, which she will use as capital to run her business. She is very optimistic that lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: Additional capital for her firewood business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
“If you want to achieve something, be patient!”: those are words of encouragement for Emily T. of Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. After her college education, she married Resty T. but they don’t have a child yet. They aim to become successful in the future so they will be able to support their parents and their future children. Her husband works in a construction company at Bagabag.

To help her husband in gaining income, Emily is engaged in the retailing of electronic cellphone loads and the selling of Avon, MSE and Natasha cosmetics and apparel products in their village. She wants to acquire more products but her capital is not enough, so she wants to borrow PHP 10,000 to be used in acquiring additional products to satisfy her customer's demands.

Emily believes that with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to improve her small business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Selling pillow cases is the business of Marivic Z.. Most of her customers are her neighbors and friends. Aside from that, her family also has a motorcycle transport business which is managed by her husband. She is thankful these businesses are able to support their everyday living, but she really wants to see some business progress. Thus she decided to request a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders which she will use to buy more pillow cases to sell. She also plans to use some of the money for motorcycle maintenance.

Marivic and her husband are blessed with five children, namely: Mei Ann (10 years old, Grade 5 pupil), Joseph (8 years old), Carnillo (5 years old), C. Jay (4 years old), and Rhea Mea (1 year old). Her family is living in the village of Quezon, San Isidro.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

loans.name: Twegate Nazili Judith Group

texts.en:
N. Judith is thirty-five years of age and married with one child schooling. She operates the business of pay phone and also selling air-time to the public. She is been in her business for over one year.

Judith is using the loan to purchase air-time for at least a big amount which was not the case previously. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to develop herself and grow her business too.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of air-time

loans.name: Novy

texts.en:
Novy, 35 years old, is the married mother of three children:  King Arvie, 15 years old,  Christian Loyd, 14 years old, and Carlos John, three years old. Their family resides in the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is in front of a resort.

Novy has been engaged in cross stitching for almost ten years now, creating different designs through various colored threads.  When she sells one design of her work, she earns a net income of Php 2,000.  Because she wishes to produce and sell more products, she is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 from KIVA lenders to buy more cross stitch materials. Novy dreams of strengthening her business and producing a bountiful income so as to support the schooling of her children. She hopes that lenders will grant her the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy more cross stitch materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
"Success in life starts within ourselves," says Gina P.. She has a motorcycle transport business with her husband as the driver. This couple really works hard to meet their daily needs, especially the educational needs of their children. Though their two children are only in elementary school now, they are starting to save little by little for the high school and college education of their little angels, namely: Michael, 12 years old, and Lorraine, who is only 8 years of age. Gina wants them to finish their schooling so they can have a more secure future.

Gina wants to borrow 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders to maintain and repair their motorcycle. She hopes that lenders will consider her requested loan.

loans.use: Additional capital for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn S. sells cosmetic products. She is happily married to Jayson and they have a baby girl named Stephanie Joy, who is seven months old. She is very determined to earn an income that will allow her to meet her family's needs; specifically, Jackelyn wants to maintain the business so that she can provide for her baby. 

Consequently, she would like to ask for additional capital, with which she will improve her business by buying additional products to sell. Jackelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She hopes that she will receive the money so that she can make her business more profitable.

loans.use: purchasing more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Kajjansi A Zaina Nabakoza Group

texts.en:
Zaina N. is thirty-nine years of age and married with two children, one of whom is going to school. Additionally, she looks after three orphans, all of whom are also going to school.

Zaina has been running a restaurant for over ten years. She is requesting a loan, with which she will purchase restaurant items such as wheat flour, bananas, charcoal, and so forth. She believes that this will improve her restaurant and subsequently allow her to earn higher profits. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and build them a house.

loans.use: purchasing restaurant items such as wheat flour, bananas, charcoal, and so forth

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann P. is 25 years of age and is married to Romulo. The couple are blessed with two children; Roldan-eight years old, an elementary school pupil, and Princess Joy who is four years old. Through sacrifice and patience, the couple they are able to sustain their basic needs. They are engaged in a recycling business. They own a junk shop where they buy recyclable materials from their neighbors and nearby villages.Wanting to have additional capital for buying empty cans, bottles and other junks, Mary Ann is requesting a loan of Php5,000 from KIVA lenders. By expanding the business, Mary Ann hopes that the family's income will increase.

loans.use: For additional capital for business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle G. is 31years old, married, and has been blessed with two children: John Mel, nine years old and Justin, seven years old. They are both in primary school. Annabelle would like her two children to finish their schooling to be able to have a bright future. So she is striving hard to earn a bigger income for her family needs. Annabelle has a recycling business in which she buys materials for recycling from junk shops and other businesses. Annabelle would like to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000. She hopes that her request will be granted so that she can use the loan funds to buy additional empty bottles and other kinds of recycled materials for her business development. Annabelle has a strong determination in life and a deep faith in God. She is thankful because she has a happy family.

loans.use: For additional capital for business development

loans.name: Kajjansi A Namuwoza Tereza Group

texts.en: Tereza N.  is an active business woman, age forty-seven years who is a widow with eight children. She is also caring for two siblings who are in school. Tereza has been carrying out a restaurant activity and also selling firewood since the year 2003. She will use the loan to purchase restaurant items and for more firewood for sale. She really yearns to improve upon her business. Tereza is a hardworking business woman whose dream is obtain land on which she will construct a permanent home where she can always belong.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant items and more firewood for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria D. 37, has been engaged in vegetable vending for almost five years now.  Most of the vegetables that she is vending  come from the farm which is being managed by her husband, Freddie. Their marriage has been  blessed with four children; Jefferson, 15, fourth year high school; Jenard, 11, grade five student; Jamaica, 9, grade four student; and Jema Rose, seven years old, grade two level. The family resides in  the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Gloria usually earns an income of Php350 weekly. She is requesting  a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php5,000 for additional capital for her business. Gloria hopes to expand the  business and increase her income.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine C. sells raincoats within the village of Quezon San Isidro. Her husband is her helper. They have one child named Princess Gline-two years old. This couple is thankful because their business is improving. With additional financial support from KIVA lenders, Catherine will be able to continue improving her business. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of Php5,000 which would allow  her to buy additional raincoats.

loans.use: For additional capital for her business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry has been managing a retail store in her village for almost ten months now. She is 25 years of age and married to Roel, who works as a company driver in their village. They have one daughter named Glory Antonette, four years old. They reside peacefully in the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. One of their sources of income is the salary of her husband, but his income is insufficient to meet their daily needs. Cherry's weekly net income is 500 Philippine pesos (PHP). She desires a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to increase the income from her business. She wants to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her retail store. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Fatia Namagembe Group

texts.en: Fatia N., 28, is married with two school age children.  She has been selling clothes for three years. She is using the loan to purchase more stock of used clothes for sale. She wishes to improve upon her business so that she can be selling a larger range of clothes to her customers.  Her future plan is to expand her business so that she will be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Imie

texts.en:
Imie A. is 27 years old. She is engaged in the hog raising business while her husband, Edgar, is a tricycle operator. They are blessed with two children.  Seven-year-old Mark Edmil is an elementary school pupil and five-year-old Gian Carlo is a pre-school pupil.  The family lives in the village of Sto.Tomas, Saguday, Quirino. 

She is thankful because she is able to maintain her business, but she still needs to continue improving it for the welfare of her children. According to Imie, she would like to buy feed stock so that she could minimize her cost in going to and from the market. For this purpose, she would like to apply for a loan of 4,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for the maintenance of her hog raising business.
