Imie is praying that she will receive the loan amount she is requesting.

loans.use: additional capital for  her hog raising business

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Katushabe Harriet Group

texts.en: K. Harriet, 30,  is married with two school-age children. She has a used clothing business which she has been operating for over 10 years. She needs additional capital for her business in order to purchase more stock of used clothing from the Owino market in Kampala. She is an industrious business woman whose plan is to work hard for a good future for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more stock of used clothes

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Being engaged in her hog-raising business for already two years, Lourdes C. can say that hog raising is really helpful to their family. Because of that, she really wants to continuously engage in her business. Thus, she is requesting a Php 5,000 loan from Kiva lenders for her to obtain the needed feeds for her pigs.

Lourdes is married to Rodolfo, 42 years old and a farmer. As fruit of their love, they are blessed with four children. They live happily in the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn B. is a village store owner. She is married already and her husband cultivates their small farm lot by planting rice and some vegetables.

Due to the high cost of commodities, Ailyn wants to acquire more products to sell but she cannot do so because she lacks business capital. At present, she wants to borrow additional capital of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders and will use the money to purchase more goods to retail in her store. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her small variety store and to earn a higher income.

As parents, Ailyn and her husband are concerned with the future of their children. They sacrifice their time and effort to support the needs of their seven children, namely: Val David, 12; Jaylord, 11; Jefrelyn, nine years old; Leonajane, five years old; Cristin, four years old; Yumi, two years old; and Nicole, one year old.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
According to her children, Gina is a loving and a caring mother. Their family resides in the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, a rural area. She is married to Mr. Felix C. and they are blessed with two children named Althea and Elaisa.

Gina is engaged in vegetable vending in their village and sells house to house using her borrowed bicycle. According to her she usually earns Php 200 a day from her business, which is very beneficial to her family. Gina also shared that her vegetables sell immediately because village people really love eating such food.

Gina’s desire to purchase more vegetables motivated her to borrow Php 9,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes and prays that lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S., 52 years of age, is a widow having two children: Emiliano, 31 years of age, and Mayflor, 28 years of age. Nenita lives in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, in Isabela province.

Nenita is contented with what she has right now. She want to spend her time in her business, because her two children are already married.

Nenita manages a vegetable-vending business, selling at the public market of Cauayan City. Her weekly net income is Php 300. She wants to obtain a loan of Php 5,000 for her additional requirements in her business.

Nenita continuously gains patience and a strong determination for the success of her business. She said that being diligent is her way to reach her goals in life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital in her vegetable-vending business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita, 38, and Pablo, 39, are almost twelve years married. The couple is blessed with three children, namely: Judy Ann, 13; followed by Juliet, 10; and their youngest is Julius, 4. They are presently living in the village of Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela, a rural area.

The couple is working hard to support their family. Perlita is engaged in vegetable and fruit vending in their village and her daily net income is Php 200. She desires to obtain a loan of Php 6,000 from some kind-hearted Kiva lenders as additional working capital for her business. She hopes that they will grant her requested loan as soon as possible. She wants to gain more income to have a productive lifestyle.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her food-vending business

loans.name: Modi

texts.en: Modi P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She is 45 years old and is divorced with six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: 02.1.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Luận T. Thị (17) is a 59-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Luận is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.4 Nam Ngạn (02.1.4 Nam Ngạn).


Luận is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Luận sells rice products in the local community.  Luận has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Luận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luận has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Luận plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Vũ thị Hạnh (18) is a 63-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  T. Thị Mùi (19) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  Lê Thị Hường  (20) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  T. Thị Len (21) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


5.  T. Thị Hanh (22) is a 63-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Luận T. Thị (17) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Luận là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.1.4 Nam Ngạn (02.1.4 Nam Ngạn).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Luận thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Luận kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Luận đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Luận đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Vũ thị Hạnh (18) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  T. Thị Mùi (19) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Lê Thị Hường  (20) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  T. Thị Len (21) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


5.  T. Thị Hanh (22) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Oyla

texts.en:
Oyla S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use.  Oyla is 38 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to use

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita C. is from the village of Magcamiguing Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 38 years old. Mercidita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercidita owns & operates a "sari-sari store" or a general store, selling daily used products such as can goods, candies, shampoo, and other products in the local community. Mercidita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercidita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercidita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercidita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for their own needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: 02.1.5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Huệ N. Thị (23) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Huệ is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.5 Nam Ngạn (02.1.5 Nam Ngạn).


Huệ is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Huệ owns & operates a specialized retail store selling flowers in the local community.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Lan (24) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


2.  Ngô Thị Ngọc (25) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


3.  N. Thị H. Nhung (26) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


4.  C. Thị M. Hoàn (27) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  H. Thị Dung (28) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


6.  Ngô Thị Đức  (29) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Lovely Ann

texts.en:
Lovely Ann E. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Lovely Ann is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Lovely Ann owns and operates a "tricycle" business in the local community. Lovely Ann is just starting this business.

Lovely Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely Ann is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lovely Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income for their daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Korofo

texts.en:
Korofo A. is currently in the business of selling beans in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans and other items like onions, maize etc. to sell.  Korofo is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma R. is from the village of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old. Norma is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business planting & harvesting banana "saging" for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer for her business. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and invest in another business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and save for future needs.
